loans.name: Vaiutu

texts.en: Vaiutu L., 37, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in cooking taro, taamu, banana, and palusami and selling it as her business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Vaiutu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses.

loans.use: Vaiutu would like to make home improvements, get transportation for delivering her goods to the market, and school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mkatawa

texts.en:
Mkatawa is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at her business, earning a monthly profit of about US$90.

Mkatawa now hopes to receive a loan to buy additional food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for a business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, D. 56 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad, viven con su esposo Mario quien la apoya en todo. 
Hace 3 años compró un motocarro, junto a su esposo, quien lo conduce y tiene muchos años D. experiencia en este rubro, trabajan brindando servicio D. transporte público, durante todo el día. Teresa administra las ganancias D. su motocarro, así como también es la encargada D. llevar a repararlo cuando tiene desperfecto. Lo que le gusta D. este trabajo, es que le genera buenos ingresos, por ello, piensa comprarse otro, para dar trabajo a un chofer que lo necesite. 
Ahora, con el dinero que solicita, quiere mandar a reparar su vehículo, para que puedan continuar con el servicio que prestan, además D. ahorrar para poder comprar otro.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús, age 56, has 5 grown-up children who are all independent. She currently lives with her husband, Mario, who supports her in everything she does. Three years ago, she purchased a motorcycle taxi with her husband, who drives it with many years of experience in this field. Their job is to offer public transportation services all day. Teresa manages the finances and is also in charge of having the motorcycle taxi repaired when it is having problems. What she likes about this job is that it generates good profits, which is why she is thinking about purchasing another motorcycle taxi. This way, she can give a job to a driver in need of employment. Now, with the loan she is requesting, she wants to have her vehicle repaired so that they can continue to offer their services, as well as save money to purchase another motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi for public transportation services

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Mr. Sot D. is a villager in Tropang Pring Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is 33 years old and the father of four children, two of whom attend the local school while the others are too young to work or study, being five and two years old. He sells firewood for a living and his wife helps him with this business. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it so he has decided to request a loan to buy a cart in order to transport his firewood to sell from door-to-door. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport his firewood to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Рахмонова Шахло жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 32 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее.Клиентка занимается куплей продажей женских и мужских носков.Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке района Вахдат.Имеет опыт в бизнесе 5 лет.На кредит Шахло хочет закупить больше качественного товара.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Shakhlo R. lives in the Vahdat region. She is thirty-two, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. She works buying and selling socks. She has a small shop in Vahdat’s local market. She has been doing this for five years. Shakhlo wants to use a loan to buy higher-quality goods. She plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar S. is a 45 year-old woman living in Bar Elias in the Bekaa valley. A mother of three, Kawthar started working from home as a tailor in 1985. Being a very creative woman, she began to sell homemade souvenir gifts. As more and more clients requested her products, Kawthar soon opened her own workshop. Today she is asking for $1000 to buy inventory to produce more gifts and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy supplies to meet customer demand for her tailored goods.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Meriam L. is residing at Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, with twin children who are both in Grade 2 pupils. Her husband is former clerk employee in Copylandia Company, a supplier of photocopier machines.

Three years ago her husband resigned from his job and decided to engage in photocopier business.  The business started in their house and after a year they decided to rent a space near Saint John High School at Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She personally handles their photocopier business and her husband does the marketing.

She is a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than a year now. She is very participative and active in their Weekly Center Meetings. She is now requesting a loan of  PHP 10,000 to purchase photocopier toner and school supplies.

What she plans right now is to renovate her house and be able to have additional stocks and school supplies for their business.

loans.use: Purchase Photocopier Toner & School Supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.es: Helen, de 30 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus suegros. Años atrás trabajaba en una y otra actividad que se le presentaba según la ocasión, pero desde que se comprometió se dedicaba a su casa, y hace 2 meses ha empezado en vender picarones (postre a base de harina de camote, en forma de donuts y se sirve con miel); prestándose la cocina de su suegra, por el momento prepara solo los fines de semana y el resto de días cocina chicharrones (pedazos de carne de cerdo frito) en porciones de 1 y 1.50 soles. El esposo de Helen se dedica a la agricultura y recién están empezando a realizar sus plantaciones de cítricos, por lo que tienen que esperar de 4 a 5 años, para que estas plantas puedan dar sus frutos. Mientras tanto ha visto por conveniente dedicarse de lleno al negocio de la comida, no le es tan rentable vender solo los fines de semana, entonces ha pensado hacerlo diariamente, vender desde las 6.00pm hasta 11.00pm en la puerta de su casa.  Helen espera tener mucha suerte para captar clientela rápidamente. Helen se incorpora a este banco comunal que ya está en su quinto préstamo, para ella será el primero, pero se compromete a realizar todos su pagos correspondiente, con las esperanzas de que le sigan apoyando con futuros prestamos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de una cocina y cacerola especial para freír los riquísimos picarones, y el resto de dinero será para adquirir los insumos e ingredientes necesarios, tanto para los picarones, como para los chicharrones.
texts.en:
Helen is 30 years old, lives with her partner, has 4 children, and currently lives with her in-laws. A few years ago she worked here and there wherever the opportunity arose, but since she became engaged, she has been a housewife. Two months ago she started selling donuts using her mother-in-law's stove to cook them; currently she only cooks during week-ends, the rest of the week only making pork rinds, which she sells for 1.00 to 1.50 soles. Helen's husband (partner) is a farmer, and they have just started planting citric fruits, but they have to wait about 4 or 5 more years to harvest the fruit. Meanwhile, she has seen it fit to dedicate herself completely to the food business, but realizes that it is not lucrative to sell only during week-ends, so she has decided to do it daily at her doorstep between the hours of 6 and 11 PM . Helen hopes to have good fortune in capturing clientele quickly. She has joined this community bank which is in its fifth loan cycle, the first for her, and she vows to make payments on time in hopes to continue to qualify for future loans. She is requesting funds for the purchase of a stove and a special pot to fry her great tasting donuts, as well as to purchase the necessary ingredients for making donuts and the pork rinds.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una cocina, utensilios e ingredientes para la preparación de sus platos

loans.name: Suvonkul

texts.en:
B. Suvonkul is 56 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Mr. Suvonkul was born in a simple rural family and has worked with livestock for 30 years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. Suvonkul is requesting a loan of $800 USD to enable him purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him increase the milk produced and will provide income security to the family when one of the cows is in-calf. The income will enable Suvonkul provide for his family, take good care of his cows and supply his neighbors with quality milk.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: La señora Karla Vannessa González Martines tiene la edad de 29 años habita el barrio las enramadas ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian , una de las hijas de doña Karla estudia su secundaria y después de clases le ayuda en el mercado a despachar sus variedades de ropa, zapatos y otros articulo que vende, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio ya que esto le permite mejores condiciones para sus ventas como para brindar un buen servicios a sus clientes. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda. Gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado ha logrado poder hacer su vivienda en mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Ms.Karla Vannessa González Martines is 29 years old and lives in the neighborhood Las Enramadas located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother who has two children who both study, one of Ms. Karla's daughters studies in secondary school and after classes she helps in the market to sell varieties of clothes, shoes and other items that they sell. Her plans for the future are to improve the business infrastructure to allow for better conditions for her sales so she can provide good services to her clients. This request for credit is to purchase construction materials to make improvements to her home. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic she has been able to make her home better for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make improvements to her house

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S., 33, is the mother of two children. She has a business catching fish and selling it at the market, earning approximately US$5 profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, has been operating a motor taxi business since 2005 and makes US$1.5 per day. Touch S. is asking for a loan to purchase fishing tools. (Her husband pictured here because Touch S. was not available for picture)

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera S., 36, is married and has six children. She has four years of experience in the BBQ business, selling cooked meats and other food items to the public six days a week. Sera has taken out and repaid six previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $354. SPBD loans are Sera’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy various food products to sell to the public.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años, vive con su pequeño hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, específicamente el cuy, también vende productos alimenticios por medio de los viajes que realiza cada quincena a otras ciudades. Día a día cuida su granja de animales, porque de ello depende la venta que realizará, pues su negocio abastece a los clientes que solicitan para realizar grandes banquetes a base de cuy, entonces ella misma los vende listos para cocinar, pero a un costo adicional. Sus expectativas para el futuro son de tener más cuyes para incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo en su banco comunal porque han superado problemas y ahora tienen muchos ánimos de seguir adelante. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de truchas (pescado de río) para vender en otras ciudades, así como incrementar la cantidad de cuyes que cría.
texts.en:
Ana, 34, lives with her young son in the home of a relative. For 2 years she has been raising small animals, specifically guinea pigs; she also sells nutritious foods while on her bi-weekly trips to other cities. She takes care of her livestock farm every day, since her business supplies clients she solicits in order to put on large guinea-pig banquets. She also sells them ready to cook, but at additional charge. Her expectations for the future are to have more guinea pigs in order to increase her sales. This is the second time that she has taken a loan through MFP, and she works very enthusiastically with her communal bank because they have overcome problems and now they are very encouraged to keep getting ahead. The money she is requesting is for the purchase of trout (a river fish) to sell in other cities, as well as to increase the number of guinea pigs that she raises.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of trout to sell

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera con 01 hijo a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Simón Bolívar  Nº 328 Barrio Lizandro luna, es profesora de segundaria, ciencias sociales. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 meses, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chalona, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar mas chalona.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas chalona, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo seguir trabajando para poder en el futuro vender al por mayor su producto, y aumentar con la venta de carne  o cualquier otro producto de la zona.

A ella le gusta mucho las reuniones y las charlas que a veces se da.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Aswancaris II community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 24 and a single mother raising one son. She lives at Jr. Simón Bolívar Nº 328 in the Lizandro Luna neighborhood. She is a high school social sciences teacher. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two months. She buys and sells chalona (cured meat made from lamb). Her first loan for 500 PEN was used to buy more chalona. She would now like a loan for 500 PEN, which she will repay in six payments. The loan will allow her to buy more chalona. This way her business will keep growing. She wants to keep working to be able to sell her product wholesale in the future. She would like to increase her business by adding the sale of meat or another product from her zone. She really likes the meetings and talks that are sometimes given.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chalona (cured meat made from lamb)

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie and Arnel D. are a young couple who happily live in the rural community of Barangay Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They are both high school graduates and got married after their graduation at a very early age without even thinking of the consequences. Now that they have a two-year-old child, they realize that having a family is not that easy. Regrets come to their minds, but they have nothing to do but to get on with their life choices.

They use an inherited motorcycle for a transport business to earn daily income. Winnie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport business. She hopes that an increase in revenue will pave the way to other sources of income, especially for her. She also hopes to save for the future education of her children. They believe that, with patience and strong determination, they can earn and save more money for the future of their child.

loans.use: For maintenance of a tricycle

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella B. is twenty-six years old. She is married and has one child, a boy who is yet to start school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a hard working woman. Her husband is in the sand winning business while Stella runs a provision store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a chocolate malt beverage), sugar, rice, candies, and bread in a store on the street. She has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her store. She hopes to improve her standard of living and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her grocery store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a vendor of fruits and vegetables in their village. She is already 52 years old and still very diligent in the business. She purchases her products from her neighbors who have their own vegetable farms and banana crops, then sells them at retail prices.

At present, she would like to borrow PHP 5,000 that she will use to increase her merchandise. Her business is really important to her because it is their main source of income. Though her three children are already married, Editha still sometimes extends help to them, especially when it comes to her grandchildren.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La señora Felicita V. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA los cuales a pagado puntual mente y está muy agradecida por su gran ayuda que le han brindado con estos préstamos, con los cuales a surtido y remodelado su negocio.   
Eso le ha permitido tener un mayor ingreso y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia.
Esta solicitando un tercer crédito para poder surtir su negocio de mercancía, como es de lácteos, productos congelados y verduras. Ya que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda estos productos, porque es la única tienda ya hay en la colonia y para ellos es más como acudir a su negocio a comprar el producto. 
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicita V. has already had two loans with Kiva, which she repaid punctually, and she is very thankful for the great help that she has been offered with these loans, with which she supplied and remodeled her business. This has allowed her to have a larger income and, in this way, to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting her third loan so that she can supply her business with merchandise, like dairy products, frozen products, and vegetables. Because hers is the only store in the neighborhood, her clients are asking her to sell those products and they turn to Felicita’s business to buy the products. She plans to repay the loan with the income from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase addional stock in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es una madre muy cariñosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa con sus 2 hijos: Maycol de 15 y Reveca de 12 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, chullos (prendas para la cabeza), etc, Mariela pasa sus días. Sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace. Con todo el esfuerzo que realiza, espera para el futuro tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindarles una mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Mariela se encuentra en su quinto préstamo con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Prica

texts.en: Prica is married with three children and she is 35 years old. She sells beef at the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Ariutsogt

texts.en: S. Ariuntsogt is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. Her oldest son attends local secondary school and his younger daughter hasn't yet reached school age. Ariuntsogt operates a small electronics shop in his town. She offers a variety of products and services including DVD rentals, cellphone parts sales, and computer services. Ariuntsogt started his business in 2003 and has since built a great reputaition in her community among her customers and suppliers both. She attributes her success to her strong accounting practices. Ariuntsogt's business is very important to her and her family, and she says, "I want to expand my DVD rental business so that I can provide for my children's education."She is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2460 USD) loan to purchase more cellphone parts to sell and DVDs to rent at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cellphone parts to sell and DVDs to rent

loans.name: Jenifer's Group

texts.en:
Jenifer M. is married and cares for her five children and three nephews. She is the leader of her group in Rukungiri. Her husband is in jail, so the responsibility of providing for the household solely falls to her. She has had much success in her business enterprises and, through her plantations and animal husbandry operations, generates 170,000 USH in profits per week.

Jenifer would like to use the loan amount to purchase two more cows for her dairy operation. She hopes that one day with the continued success of her business, she will be able to buy more land and have a larger farm.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is busy running her hog-raising business. She is married to Andres who works as a farmer in their village. They have been blessed with one child, Aiverson, seven years old, who is a grade II pupil. Analyn and her husband help one another to further improve their way of living. Her husband is busy cultivating their rice fields in order for them to have a high yield.

Through the sacrifices and patience of Analyn, she is able to provide the needs of her family with the help of her loving and responsible husband. She would like to buy feed for her pigs to further minimize her expenses going to and from the market. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 for the feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.use: additional capital to buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Regina is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a specialized retail business buying and selling rice in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Regina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Regina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Liz Vani

texts.es:
La señora Liz Vani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 24 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Liz Vani, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, ubicada en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado. Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 06 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará mas bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Liz Vani, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Ms. Liz Vani belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Solidarias II”, Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law marriage, she is 24 years old and has one son, still dependent upon her.

Liz Vani is a woman that likes to work so she decided to start her own soft drink business, located in her own home, in very well equipped premises. She runs her business herself, without a timetable or a boss. She tells us she started with S/. 300.00 and began by purchasing six packages of soda pops. She saw things were going very well and she needed more soda pops, so little by little she invested more. Nowadays she continues the business and she is already well known among her clients.

With this S/. 2,500.00 loan she will purchase more drinks, such as sodas in different flavours, sizes and brand names, as well as mineral water, both still and sparkling.

Liz Vani has many goals and feels motivated to make her plans come true. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her repayment terms and means to continue this way.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 45 years old and is married with five children. She is a friendly and hardworking woman.

Dora sells children’s clothes and shoes of various sizes and colors. She purchases her goods from Onitsha and Lagos to sell at the market in Benin City, Edo state. This is the high season for business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Dora is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Dora needs a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more children’s clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Celia Lidia

texts.es: La señora Celia es una cliente nueva que llego a la institucion por recomendación de su hermana Rosmery, la señora vive en codavisa y es vecina de su hermana Rosmery, ella se dedica a la venta al por mayor de varios articulos que trae del desaguadero, entre estos se destacan poleras, juegos de cama, juegos de olla, tunta y ajies del Peru. La señora y su esposo don Simon son una pareja muy trabajadora que viven bien y tenian planeado comprar un auto mas a parte del que tienen, el credito o solicitaron en otra institucion financiera por un monto de $us 6000, el credito fue desembolsado y a las pocas horas mientras don simon trabajaba con el auto sufrio un grave aacidente, por lo tanto el total del monto desembolsado fue gastado en la operacion del señor, despues de un año de fisioterapia y trabajo duro por parte de doña Celia han salido de este mal momento y estan invirtiendo mas dinero por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene la señora por fin de año, es por eso que el destino de su credito sera para incrementar su capital y poder traer maa mercaderia del Peru
texts.en:
Señora Celia is a new client that arrived at the institution through the recommendation of her sister Rosmery. Celia lives in Codavisa and is her sister's neighbour. She works selling a variety of articles she brings from Desaguadero, including jumpers, bedding, cookware, white potato flour and chillies from Peru. Celia and her husband Simon are a very hard-working couple that live well and planned to buy a car in addition to the one they have. They sought a loan from another financial institution for an amount of US $600. The loan was paid out and a few hours after Simon was working with the car he suffered a grave accident, because of which the entire amount of the loan was spent on his operation. After 1 year of physiotherapy and hard work on Celia's part, they have left this bad period and are investing more money because of the amount of orders Celia has at the end of the year. The loan is destined to be used to increased her capital and to bring more merchandise from Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo y el último D. sus hijos.
DesD. hace 6 años decidió explotar al máximo el recurso que tiene en sus terrenos D. suelos arcillosos, por lo que empezó a fabricar ladrillos. Para ello, contrata la mano D. obra D. personas expertas en la fabricación y luego los comercializa. Al mes venD. un promedio D. 20 millares  D. ladrillos, lo cual le sirve para solventar los gastos D. su familia, a parte del dinero que aporta su esposo. 
Francisca se proyecta al futuro y desea tener más extensiones D. tierra arcillosa para fabricar mayor cantidad D. ladrillos. 

Esta es la novena oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy estricta en el cumplimiento D. sus cuotas y en esta ocasión no será la excepción. El dinero que ahora solicita le servirá para la compra D. cobertizos D. plásticos que le servirán para proteger sus ladrillos y también otros materiales necesarios para la fabricación.
texts.en:
Francisca, 54, lives with her husband and their youngest son. For the last 6 years she has been dedicated to exploiting, to the greatest extent possible, the resource she has in her clay-rich property: she makes bricks. She hires expert help to manufacture the bricks and she takes care of the sales. She sells approximately 20,000 bricks per month, which, added to her husband's earnings, is enough to meet family expenses. As Francsica looks to the future, she would like to have more clay-rich land to make a greater quantity of bricks. This is her 9th loan with MFP. She has always been very strict about making her repayments on time and this time will not be the exception to this. The funds requested now will be used to buy plastic sheeting that will protect her bricks and other supplies needed for their manufacture.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic sheeting to protect her bricks.

loans.name: Oussèye

texts.fr: Oussèye B. est âgée de 33 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec sa fille de 7ans. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de NEMATABA dont elle est secrétaire depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce d'arachide. Son objectif est de prendre en charge la santé, scolarité et nourriture de sa fille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
Oussèye B. is 33 years old. She is divorced and lives with her 7 year old daughter. She has been a member and the secretary of the Villagers Bank of Nemataba for six and a half years. She has developed a little peanut shop. Her goal is to take responsibility for the health, schooling and food of her daughter and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her financial returns and strengthen thier activity

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of upper Bunawan, Misamis Occidental.  She is 27 years old, married, and has one infant. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a a general store selling daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for 1 year.

In 2007, Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality, accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Raúl Adán

texts.es: Raúl Adán A. y A. de 39 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijas menores de edad. Raúl posee una venta de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. Este negocio le permite salir adelante y  poder contar con el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar. El mayor deseo de Raúl es el de poder seguir adelante dándole a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos perecederos y de primera necesidad para el hogar, aumentando la cantidad de lo que ya posee y agregando otros con los cuales aún no cuenta, Raúl tiene  muy buena clientela, ya que no posee competencia en los alrededores, lo cual Raúl desea aprovechar al máximo para aumentar sus ventas..
texts.en:
Raúl Adán A. y A., age 39, lives in the city of San Martín, which is located in the San Salvador department. He lives in his own house with his wife and their three minor daughters. Raúl has a business selling perishable products and basic needs items. The business is located in his house. This business allows him to get ahead and be able to count on the money that is needed to pay all of the household expenses. Raúl’s greatest wish is to be able to keep getting ahead and giving his family everything they need to live. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to buy perishable products and basic needs items for the home. He will increase the quantity that he now has and add other things that he still does not have. Raúl has good customers because he does not have any nearby competition. He wants to take maximum advantage of this to increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishable products

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S. is married and resides with her children in the Takeo province in Cambodia. She has five children. She and her husband are engaged in the agriculture sector as farmers on their own plots of farmland, earning an income of $2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by four of S.’s children, who are currently working at a local garment factory, earning an income of $3 each per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more plots of farmland to expand her agricultural output for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: Buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Tuzinduke Group

texts.fr:
N. Jeanne est une burundaise âgée de 48 ans.  Elle habite le quartier Cibitoke (Bujumbura-Ville).  Elle est mariée à un menuisier et elle est une tailleuse.  Elle préfère le métier qui la permet de travailler avec ses mains a la machine au lieu d’un travail intellectuel.  En 2002, elle a ouvert son propre atelier surnomme « L’Atelier de Couture chez Maman Anitha, » le nom de son premier enfant.

Elle est mère de 7 enfants dont 3 garcons et 4 filles.  Un seul entre eux n’est pas allé a l’ecole ; tous les autres sont a l’ecole et un seul suit les études de droit a l’universite.  Au début de la crise politico-sociale burundaise (1994), toute la famille se refugiee en RDC.  Au retour en 2000,  elle a continue son métier de tailleur avec une expérience de 12 ans.

Elle compte, avec le crédit Kiva, augmenter son capital et son business en achetant des chaussures, pagnes, et tissus en provenance de l'Ouganda pour les vendre au Burundi.  Ensuite elle a deja planifie d’ouvrir un magasin propre a elle au marche central de Bujumbura.  Alors que son mari est chômeur pour le moment, Jeane supporte toutes les charges de la famille y compris les frais de scolarité, le loyer de la maison de son fils a l’universite, et surtout la ration alimentaire.  

Elle salue beaucoup l’initiative de Turame qui tend a lutter contre la pauvreté et soutenir les petits commerçants.

Elle fait parti du groupe Tuzinduke, qui veut dire en Kirundi « Levons-nous tot le matin. »  Les membres sont dans leur deuxième cycle avec Turame.
texts.en:
N. Jeanne is a Burundian aged 48. She lives in the Cibitoke neighborhood (Bujumbura-City center). She is married to a carpenter and is herself a tailor She prefers this trade which allows her to work with her hands and on a sewing machine over an white-collar job. In 2002, she opened her own workshop that she calls "Maman Anitha's Sewing Workshop"--named after her first child. Jeanne is the mother of 7 children, three boys and four girls. Only one of them did not attend school. All the others are enrolled in school and one is studying law at the university. At the beginning of the socio-political crisis in Burundi (1994), the whole family took refuge in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Coming back in 2000, Jeanne continued to work as a tailor with 12 years' experience. With the Kiva loan, she intends to add to her capital and grow her business, buying shoes, lengths of African print cloth, and fabric coming from Uganda to sell in Burundi. After that, she already has plans to open a shop of her own in the central market of Bujumbura. Since her husband is presently out of work, Jeanne is the sole breadwinner for the family, paying school fees as well as the rent for the living quarters for their son who is studying at the university, and of course their food. Jeanne is very grateful for the Turame initiative which aims to reduce poverty and support small businesspeople. She is part of the Tuzinduke group, a word that means in Kirundi "Let's Rise and Shine". Its members are on their second loan with Turame.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cloth and shoes for resale

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestro socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socia es el Sr. Eduardo, el tiene 55 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 29, 22 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es productor de escobas y el mismo las realiza en su casa taller, nuestro socio compra todos los materiales y las elabora con una máquina que le permite calibrar las medidas y que queden uniformes. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y de este modo continuar con su pequeño negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Moreno” and lives in the city of Cusco. He is 55 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 32, 30, 29, and 22).

Eduardo has a small business manufacturing brooms from a workshop in his home. He buys all the materials and produces the brooms using a machine that calibrates the measurements so that they are all uniform. Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy materials so that he can continue his small business and move his family forward.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided, and therefore promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to make brooms

loans.name: Jubana

texts.es:
Jubana es socia del Banco Comunal Abejitas Trabajadoras.
Jubana es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Jubana tiene un puesto en el mercadillo Señor D. Arequipa en donD. carne que compra en L. feria, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jubana necesita un préstamo D. 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. ganado.
Jubana sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jubana, 25, is a member of the "Abejitas Trabajadoras" (Working Little Bees) communal bank. She is single and has a son. She has a stand in the Señor D. Arequipa market where she sells meat that she buys in the farmer's market; she is open for business every day. Jubana needs a 2100 sol loan to buy cattle. She hopes to improve her business a proviD. her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ramasula

texts.en:
Ramasula S. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Ramasula is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ramasula provides photography services to local community members. Ramasula has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ramasula joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramasula has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ramasula is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be Ramasula's fourth loan from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand her services

loans.name: Sope Mame Mor/ndoffene2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité "SOPE MAME MOR" est créé en 2007, au jour d'inauguration du Banc Villageois de NDOFFENE2 qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village, elles sont toutes mariées et mères d'au moins de 3 enfants. La proximité et et la bonne cohabitation favorisent une bonne entente entre les membres du groupe. La zone où est implanté le Banc Villageois est très propice au commerce a cause des marchés hebdomadaires ce qui facilite les femmes à mener des activités commerciales telles l'embouche bovines et/ou ovine, le petit commerce, la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide, de vente de poissons frais etc. Ce faisant, la plus part des femmes du village se sont adonnée a des activités lucratives. Et ce nouveau crédit leurs permettra d'augmenter leur niveau d'autofinancement afin de mieux développer leur commerce et embouche.

Madame Mbossé N., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo un foulard jaune à la main est âgée 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et de légumes. Elle pratique quotidiennement cette activité et les jours de marché hebdomadaire elle se déplace en fonction des localité qui abritent lesdits marchés. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

Madame Sokhna D., pour des raisons d'indisponibilité, à cause d'un parent malade était absente lors de la prise de la photo.
texts.en:
The "SOPE MAME MOR" solidarity group was created in 2007, on the day the NDOFFENE2 village bank where it is based was inaugurated. The group is made out of 14 women, all from the same village. They are all married and mother to at least three children each. Their proximity encourages goodwill and cohesion within the group. The area where the village bank is located is very favorable to commerce thanks to the weekly markets, which facilitate the women's business such as the fattening of cattle and/or sheep, small-scale commerce, the production and sale of peanut oil, the sale of fresh fish, etc. Given this, most of the village's women devote their time to lucrative activities. The new loan would allow them to increase their self-financing level and expand their commerce and fattening activities. Mrs Mbossé N., standing at the far right of the photo with a yellow scard in hand, is 68-year-old and a mother of 6. She sells fresh fish and vegetables. This is her daily activity, and on market days she travels to the villages where said markets are located. Her goal is to help improve her family's living conditions. Mrs Sokhna D. was unavailable due to a sick relative and was therefore not present for the picture.

Translated from French by Loïc Haméon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the self-financing level of the solidarity group

loans.name: Lala

texts.ru:
A. Lala rodilas v 1968 qodu. Ona jenata  u neqo odin rebonok sin kotoromu 20 let. Na fotoqrafii eyo sin (Amir). On rabotayet v meste so svoim otcom . Oni remontiruyut mashini uje 4 qoda no Amir rabotayet tam uje 2 qoda. 

Seychas A. nujdayetsya v 2000 AZn chtobi oni smoqli razvit ix biznes  i kupit zaposniye avto chasti. 
sama Agaalarova leyla toje rabotayet v etom biznese oni pomoqayet yesli bivayet rabota s shityom sideniy. V budushem ona xochet jenit svoyeqo sina.
texts.en:
Lala A. was born in 1968. She is married and has one child - a son, who is 20 years old. Her son, Amir, is the one on the photo. He works together with his father. They have been fixing cars for 4 years, but Amir has been working there for 2 years. Currently, Lala needs 2000 AZN in order to develop their business and buy spare auto parts. Lala also works in this business. She helps when there is seat upholstery work. In the future, she wants to marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare auto parts

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia M. is from the village of Brgy.Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old and is single. Eulogia owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eulogia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eulogia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Eulogia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, distrito de la provincia de Chepén, ubicado en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente de una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para ser utilizada en labores de transporte) el brinda sus servicio dentro de la localidad en donde vive y también en los diversos sectores situados alrededor. Con los ingresos que percibe de este negocio solventa los gastos familiares.

Santos se esfuerza diariamente en la labor que realiza para así poder sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente el estado accidentado de los caminos que suele frecuentar y el excesivo uso otorgado a su unidad movil han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda funcionar correctamente. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona trabajadora y que se esfuerza constantemente para poder sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le considera alguien honrado y tranquilo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 37 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the Pacanguilla sector of the District of Pacanga, Chepén Province, which is located in the region of La Libertad. This area is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Santos provides cargo and passenger transport services using his motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for transporting goods or people). He provides his services within his town and also in the neighboring sectors. With the income he generates from his business, Santos is able to pay for his family expenses.

He strives every day at his job so that his family can get ahead. Unfortunately, the poor condition of the roads and excessive use of his vehicle have resulted in problems with his motorcycle taxi that require urgent repairs necessary for it to operate properly. In order to take the appropriate action, Santos is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

He is a hardworking individual who constantly tries to move his family forward. In the area where he lives, Santos is considered by his neighbors and acquaintances to be someone who is honest and peaceful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Kossi Gakpo

texts.en: Monsieur Kossi S. works as a tailor at his shop, which is called Ets Godwin. He is an experienced tailor and has been working in this business since 1995. Monsieur S. is married to a hairdresser and they have two children. Kossi has experience taking loans with WAGES: this will be his third loan of 300,000 CFA, which he needs in order to purchase materials for his business such as fabrics and soles. He knows that this investment will help his production and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Carmelo; el tiene 34 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 Hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con la prestación de servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un automóvil y el trabaja todos los días de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m. El socio necesita el dinero para hacerle el mantenimiento a su auto y cambiarle algunos repuestos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su auto.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmelo belongs to the Virgen del Rosario del Cusco Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Carmelo is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He combines his daily activities with providing taxi service. He has an automobile, and he works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. He needs the money to provide maintenance to his vehicle and for some replacement parts. He is requesting the loan to invest in the maintenance of his automobile. He is grateful to the people who are part of this dream by providing the loan. He promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the maintenance of his automobile

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en: Tourn H., 49, is married and resides with his wife and a child in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. H. is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 7.5 per day. His wife sells fish and vegetables for an income of USD 12 per day. H. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike to attach to a tuk tuk to improve his transportation business. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motobike to attach to a tuk tuk

loans.name: Hoàng

texts.en:
M. Hoàng Thị (20209010007) is a 40 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, M. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  M. has been engaged in this business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, M. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  M. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  M. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  M. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

----------------------------------

M. Hoàng Thị (20209010007) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, M. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  M. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 18 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, M. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, M. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  M. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  M. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva M. is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Eva owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells dried-fish products including tamban and pinikas in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eva is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aljin

texts.en:
Aljin B. is from the village of P2 Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years of age and married to Felomino B., her business partner. They are blessed with three children. Aljin is presently engaged in buying and selling junk, particularly scrap metals, plastics and bottles. She and her husband have been engaged in this business for five years and earn approximately 4000 PHP a month from sales of their scrap metal, plastic and bottles.

In 2007, Aljin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4500 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to add to her capital for their recycling business. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for their recycling business

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som M., 67, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. The couple earns about $1.50 a day by running a farm, and receives help from its three children, two of whom work in garment factories while the third works in construction. Som M. has applied for a loan for US $700 to buy a motorbike that her children will use to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah rakhi lives in Multan, which is a historic city of Pakistan. It is located in Punjab province and is known for its history and handmade products. Allah rakhi lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area named Shamsabad. She has been living there for over 12 years with her family. 

Allah rakhi is a very caring and supportive lady. She supports her family by selling embroidered clothes. The embroidery business is considered very profitable because people of Multan like to wear embroidered clothes all the time. Allah rakhi specializes in handmade embroidery and is well known among her clients due to the quality of her work and timely delivery of dresses. 

She is married to P., who runs a dairy business. He operates his shop in the market where he sells milk and yogurt. Allah rakhi is the mother of 3 sons. All of them are illiterate because they couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial conditions of their parents. 

Allah rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan to buy unstitched clothes and embroidery items such as beads, colored thread and sketches to grow her business further. She is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her business, allowing her to serve her clients better and make more income. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Allah rakhi.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes and embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: El señor Manuel de Jesús V. G., tiene 59 años habita en el barrio Waspan Norte , es casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela primaria, él labora como mesero en un restaurante desde hace 16 años, actividad que se ha convertido en la fuente principal de ingresos de la familia, es para su hogar que solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto de su hijo mayor y poder ofrecerle mayor privacidad, ya que está creciendo y este le demanda esa condición, seria  para él un alivio el poder brindarla  su familia las condiciones optimas para su buen desarrollo social de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesús V. G. is 59 years old.  He lives in Waspan Norte neighborhood.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They have two dependent children who are in elementary school.  Manuel has worked as a waiter in a restaurant for 16 years.  This job is the main source of income for his family.  He is requesting this loan for his household so that he can build a room for his eldest son, so that he can offer him more privacy since he is growing and needs more privacy.  It would be a relief for him to be able to provide his family with optimum conditions for good social development.

loans.use: To build a room in his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fund a photography business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest in lubricants and filters, which she sells in her carwash business.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha de 24, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, vive con su hija de 8 años, se dedica a la venta de verduras este negocio lo inicio su madre cuando ella tenía 10 años, pero Martha decidió instalar otro negocio que fuera propio, lo atiende de 6 de la mañana a 4 de la tarde, este tipo de negocio la dificultad es que tiene que comprar cada día o cada dos días, porque la verdura se daña rápido y para realizar las respectivas compras solicita un préstamo.
Su propósito es aumentar la mercadería en el negocio para ofrecer a los clientes verdura fresca y contar con su preferencia, así espera que sus ventas sean mejores y poder cubrir todas las necesidades básicas. Sueña con ser gran Comerciante mayorista de verduras.
texts.en:
Martha is 24 years old, and she lives in the town of San Miguel with her 8-year-old daughter. She engages in selling vegetables: this activity was started by her mother when she was 10 years old, but Martha decided to open a shop of her own in which she works form 6 am to 4 pm. The most difficult part of this kind of activity is that she has to buy supplies every day or every two days, because vegetables rot rapidly, and it is to invest in these purchases that she is requesting a loan.
Her aim is to augment the products in her shop in order to offer fresh vegetables to her customers and so to count on them bestowing her preference. In this way she hopes her sales will improve and that she will be able to provide for all the basic necessities. She dreams of being and important wholesale vegetable trader.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Sairam

texts.en:
Sairam runs a small business selling men’s shoes and clothing. She is married, with two grown children. Sairam has been in this business for over 10 years and has partnered with IMON International for almost 4 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain a loyal clientele. Sairam would like to receive a loan for 7500 Somoni to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of clothing. High-quality, durable, and comfortable merchandise will sell well and will help Sairam's business grow, especially in the coming spring season.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase his business

loans.name: Abia

texts.en: Abia is a thirty-seven-year-old single mother of four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in produce for the last five years starting with 350,000 shillings working capital and she now has 2,500,000 shillings. Her hardship is price fluctuations and  her vision is to have a well-modernized store which can accommodate 1000 bags of agricultural produce. Abia needs money to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to hire a  vehicle to transport agricultural  produce.

loans.name: Luvina Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora Luvina Chávez es socia del banco comunal Luz y Vida, vive por el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es de clima frió, tiene hermosos lugares llenos de historia para visitar, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía que cautiva los paladares de propios y extraños, Cuenca es una ciudad de cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Luvina tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales tres de ellos son casados, dos de sus hijos casados viven en su casa y comparten gastos, cinco de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía de su hogar y sus tres últimos hijos  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la agricultura y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Luvina se dedica a la venta de productos como: papas, yuca, mellocos, ocas, queso, yogurt entre otros. Esta actividad  la realiza hace 30 años, tiene un puesto propio en el mercado donde vende solo los fines de semana y los demás días de la semana vende sus productos recorriendo la ciudad.

Este es el onceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de papas, yogurt, queso, mellocos, etc.
  
Su meta es tener un vehículo para poder trasladase más fácilmente con sus productos.
texts.en:
Luvina Chávez is a member of the 'Luz y Vida' (Light and Life) community bank.  She lives in Monay sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold climate city which has beautiful, historic places to visit.  It offers visitors a wide range of top-quality food which captivates both local and foreign palates.  Cuenca is a city of culture and traditions.

Luvina is 50 years old, married, and has 11 children, three of whom are married.  Two of her children live at home and share expenses.  Five of her children work and help with the household expenses and her three youngest children are attending school in the city.  Her husband works in agriculture and, through their joint efforts, they have managed to build their own home.

Luvina's business is selling products such as potatoes, cassava, okra, cheese, yoghurt, etc.  She has been in this business for 30 years.  Luvina has her own stall in the market where she sells her products on weekends.  During the rest of the week she sells her products throughout the city.

This is Luvina's eleventh loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying potatoes, yoghurt, cheese, mellocos (a native tuber) etc.  Her goal is to own a vehicle so that she can transport her products more easily.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, mellocos (a native tuber), okra, yoghurt, cheese, cassava etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, accesorios para el hogar y juguetes. Esta actividad la realiza para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, aunque su esposo es pensionado de EUA, ellos trabajan juntos para tener mejor calidad de vida. Este crédito que solicitan es para invertir en el negocio como compra de ropa y accesorios para ofrecer a sus clientes mejor calidad y variedad.
texts.en: For 11 years, Martina has been engaged in selling used clothes, household accessories, and toys for children.  She carries out this business in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  Though her husband receives a US pension, they work together in order to have a better life.  The loan she is applying for is for investing in her business by purchasing clothing and accessories in order to offer her customers better quality and variety.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and new toys to sell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a registered member of Faulu Kenya.  He runs Secret Salon to earn a living.  He has run his business for nine years.  He says he treats his clients well, and this has helped to create good customer relations.  

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his business because he has learned about financial management, which is one of the elements that has helped him to keep his business.  He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kes because he needs to buy a hair dryer, clippers and hair chemicals.  His dream is to run a beauty parlor in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, clippers and hair chemicals

loans.name: Maria Roxana

texts.es:
María  es una madre de familia, tiene 30 años de edad, ella es casada con 2  hijos.   Vive en casa propia,  en una  zona rural a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope cuenta con servicios de agua y luz,  el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Maria se dedica desde hace 6  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella suele criar ganado porcino(lechones), ovino(ovejas), pavos y patos; cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

María, está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para que pueda comprar aves menores para engorde con sus respectivos alimentos balanceados.

María es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 30 year-old mother.  She is married and has two children. She live in her own home which is located in a rural area, 15 minutes from Mórrope district.  Her home has piped water and electricity.  She lives in a small community of approximately 100 families.

For six years, María has been raising and selling animals.  She keeps her animals in pens which are located behind her home.  She usually raises piglets, sheep, turkeys and ducks.  When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the traders who are always visiting her area.

María is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy birds to fatten.  She will also buy feed for the birds.

María is a driven and hard-working person.  Her biggest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective balanced feeds

loans.name: Moonlight

texts.en: Moonlight is a married woman who hails from the Kyenjojo district. She is a Ugandan female, aged 43 years, who has owned a retail shop for fifteen years. A mother of four children, she dreams of educating her children to university level and setting up other income generating activities from which she can earn extra income. She acquired her initial capital from her husband. Moonlight needs a loan to purchase mattresses, beers, and sodas for resale.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses, beers, and soda for resale.

loans.name: Terimberemuhinzi No 30 Group

texts.fr: Aloys  est agri-éleveur  né  au Rwanda.et il est membre du groupe TERIMBEREMUHINZI NO 30. Il est marié, il  a 33 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 9 ans et deux enfants vont à l’école, et il n’a aucunes personnes en charge. Il  a six  ans des études primaires. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.
