Il va utiliser son crédit pour  acheter les engrais chimiquer pour felitiriser son champs et payer la main d'oeuvre.Il n’a aucun difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt.sa stratégie pour la croissance de son affaires est d'améliorer la qualité du riz  récolté. Sa vision c’est pour développer son business, et avoir l’intérêt plus élevé. Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants et le faire soigner.
texts.en: Aloys is a farmer-breeder who was born in Rwanda.  He is a member of the TERIMBEREMUHINZI NO 30 group.  He is married and 33 years old. He has 4 children between the ages of 1 and 9. Two children attend school.  He has no dependents.  He has had 6 years of primary education.  This is his first round of loans with ACB.    He will use the funds to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize his fields and pay laborers.  He does not expect to have any difficulty repaying the loan. His strategy for business growth is to avoid selling rice at a low price compared to the harvest.  His vision is to grow his business and to have the highest interest. For his family, he would like to pay the school fees of his children and to take care of them.

loans.use: achater les engrais chimiques  et payer la main d'oeuvre

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is is 29 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

For the past seven years Rona has had a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy parts to repair her motorcycle.

Rona would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Aikan's Group

texts.en:
Aikan is the leader of this group. She is 27 and married to a construction worker. The family lives in Nookat, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.

Aikan works as a tax inspector, and her monthly salary is 3,100 KES. In order to earn additional money to meet the household’s daily needs, the family breeds cattle.

Aikan applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to buy more cattle for breeding. She wants to save money to start building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 40 years old, sells groceries and offers loans to others to get interest with her husband. Their income is $7 per day. She has 4 children: three are studying and one is working in a factory earning $2 per day. Every month she has to spend $41 on food, $20 on rent, $10 on school fees and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to continue to provide loans to others to get interest. In the future she wants to enlarge her grocery store by buying more goods to sell to get more profit. In that way she can save some money to buy a plot of land to build a house to live in because, now, her family is living in a rented house.

loans.use: To provide loans to others to earn interest

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is a loving mother and housewife. Aside from her electrician husband who provides their needs, she makes sure to provide all the requirements of her three school-aged children from her rice-arming business. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of the rice crop she grows in their field. She is so patient in doing the business because farming has been the major source of income that her family relies on. 

She hopes to improve her income from farming to save the payments for her loan and future emergencies. Nelie is doing her best so that her income can be used to acquire some appliances in their house in addition to the savings she wants to keep if there is a chance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Chirima

texts.en:
Chirima is a married man with one child who doesn’t attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

Chirima has been operated a goatmeat selling business for the past twenty years, selling as wholesale to his neighbors and butcher operators. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
"Poverty is not a hindrance to success". Mario wants to provide a successful life for his family. He did not finish his college education due to lack of financial assistance from his parents. Mario doesn't want his children to suffer the same fate as he has experienced. He has three children and he wants to continuously send them to school and for them to have a degree someday.

Mario is 48 years old and he has been managing his farming business for 14 years. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. He earned P30,000 in the last cropping season of May.

He is now asking for a loan of P16,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides (pesticides for snails etc) used in farming. The income he generated last season was used to pay monthly electric bills, groceries for daily meals and school fees. Additional capital is needed in preparation for the next planting season.

In the future, he wants to have consistent profits to achieve his dream of educating all his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and molluscicides used in farming.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married and has a 12-year-old daughter. Natalya sells children's clothing in the central market in Novomoskovsk. She launched her start-up six years ago and presently has over 65,000 Grivnyas invested in the business. Today Natalya owns several vending kiosks in the same marketplace offering a variety of clothing.
 
Natalya is an experienced vendor. She knows what a customer wants and tries to meet the demand. Natalya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for this fall season. She is hoping to generate additional income and purchase new furniture for her apartment.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Step By Step Group

texts.en:
Calvin is 35 years old and married. He lives in Gweru with his wife and child, who is age 4. He also looks after 1 dependent. 

Calvin sells chickens and beef. He has been in this business for 2 years. His main challenges are lack of funds and infrastructure, which is big enough to keep a thousand chicks.

He has requested a loan of $400 to buy chicken feed. Additional income will enable him to build a bigger chicken run. In the future, he plans to have 6 chicken runs.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, D. 64 años, es una adorable abuelita; que hace algún tiempo perdió su compañero y amigo,”su esposo”; ahora ella vive con su nieta Lesli D. 16 años, a quien cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D. Huaracayo. A pesar D. su edad; su fuerza y vitalidad siguen siendo su mayor virtud; ya tiene 50 años D. experiencia en la agricultura; D. la que según sus propias palabras, es su mayor satisfacción.
Sembrar maíz, papa, col, arveja y habas; le han generado grandes utilidades y en todo el tiempo que trabajó con su asociación, pudo adquirir un pequeño local en el mercado central D. su ciudad, ahí venD. los días miércoles, viernes y domingo, los productos que cosecha en sus terrenos D. cultivo. También compra algunas cosechas a terceras personas, cuando venD. todos sus alimentos. Sabe que su fuerza y vitalidad disminuirán con el pasar del tiempo y pensando en el futuro D. su nieta; está planeando darle un mejor acabado a las 3 casas que logró adquirir con tanto esfuerzo; sus planes son arrendarlas y obtener un dinero extra, con lo que pueda vivir sin dificultad y brindarle lo mejor a su nieta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Vamos al futuro huaracaino” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el poyo que le brindan; “con su apoyo puD. vencer muchas dificultades”, asegura. Razón por lo que promete ser puntual con sus cuotas. Catalina D. recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. sacos D. fertilizantes naturales para su próximo sembrío D. maíz.
texts.en:
Catalina, 64, is an adorable grandmother who some time ago lost her partner and friend: her husband.  Now, she lives with her granddaughter, Lesli, 16, who she cares for and educates in her own house located in Huaracayo.  Despite her age, her strength and vitality continue to be her greatest virtue.  She has 50 years’ experience in agriculture which, according to her very own words, is her greatest satisfaction.

To plant corn, potatoes, cabbage, peas and lima beans has generated great profits and all the time she worked with her association she was able to acquire a small locale in her city’s central market where she sells every Wednesday, Friday and Sunday the product she grows in her fields.  She also buys some crops from others when she sells out all her food. 

She’s aware that her strength and vitality will diminish in time and thinking of her granddaughter’s future she’s planning to proviD. better finishing touches to the three houses she’s acquired with so much effort.  Her plan is to rent them out to earn extra income that she can use to live problem free and to proviD. the best for her granddaughter.

She belongs to the “Vamos al Futuro Huaracaino” communal bank and this is the 12th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s being given.  “With your support I was able to overcome many difficulties,” she states, and this is the reason why she promises to be punctual with her repayments.  If Catalina were to receive your support, she will invest the requested money in the purchase of sacks of natural fertilizer for her next corn planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гульбахор проживает в районе Джиликул. Она разведена. У нее четверо детей. Гульбахор уже 24 года как занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом фруктовых деревьев. Ей 42 года. Она берет кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in the Jilikul district.  She is divorced and has four children.  Gulbahor has been involved in growing vegetables and planting fruit trees for 24 years.  She is 42 years old.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 55 años, es una hombre bueno, amable y muy responsable. Está casado y es padre de dos hijos quienes son mayores e independiente y uno de ellos tiene ya familia. Tiene una nieta de 15 años quien vive a su lado y depende de él para darle educación y una buena crianza. Él tiene una casa propia en donde brindó lo mejor que tenia a sus hijos y ahora da todo por su nieta. El trabajo de Francisco, consiste en el transporte de carga y pasajeros en su mototaxi, trabajo que realiza dentro y fuera de la ciudad, dependiendo a donde quieren sus eventuales pasajeros. Lleva realizando éste trabajo ya por siete años, y cuando empezó le costo mucho esfuerzo pues no estaba acostumbrado a hacer este tipo de trabajo y tuvo muchos problemas con sus riñones, al pasar el tiempo encontró la manera de poder tener mejor condiciones y ahora es todo un experto. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite manejar su propio horario y darse él mismo descanso necesario cuando lo neccesita; además de poder tener un medio de transporte para su familia. Le esta yendo regular, pues el  negocio esta un poco bajo; pero tiene en mente poner una tienda de abarrotes en su hogar y así poder tener  ingresos adicionales. Este será el crédito número 7 con MFP, Esta muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Está muy contento con el grupo de trabajo que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y sobre todo solidarios entre ellos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará piezas para arreglar su mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que le realizará todos los trabajos, asimismo desea renovar el seguro a su vehículo.
texts.en: Francisco is 55 years old and is a good, kind and responsible man.  He is married and is the father of two grown and independent children, one of which already has his own family.  He has a 15 year old granddaughter who lives with him and depends on him to provide her an education and a good upbringing.  He owns his own house where he offered the best he had to his children and now he is giving everything for his granddaughter.  Francisco's work consists of transporting goods and passengers on his motorcycle taxi, a job that he has been doing for seven years.  When he first began, it was a lot of work for him, as he was not accustomed to doing that type of work.  As a result, he had many problems with his kidneys, but through time he found ways to be able to have better health and now he is an absolute expert.  What he likes about his work is that it allows him to manage his own schedule and to give himself the necessary rest when he needs it, as well as being able to have a way to get around for his family.  It is not going great, as business is a little slow, but he has an idea to put a grocery store in the front of his house and in that way have the ability to earn additional income.  This will be his seventh loan with MFP, and is very happy to know that he will have financial support since in that way he will feel more secure as he moves ahead with his work.  On the other hand he is committed to making his payments, as he has done with previous loans that he has had.  He is very happy with the work group to which he belongs since everyone is very responsible and unified with one another.  With the requested funds, he will purchase parts to repair his motorcycle taxi, as well as pay the mechanic who will complete the repairs.  He also hopes to renew the insurance for his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase parts and have repairs done by a mechanic, as well as renewing the insurance for his vehicle

loans.name: Ruth Miguelina

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja a Lima y compra de las tiendas grandes las ofertas y cierres de temporadas, también compra de las fabricas todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia tambien compra zapatos y zapatillas para niños y niñas; La socia esta muy contenta porque le esta yendo muy bien y esta teniendo buenos ingresos economicos que le permiten tener y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; La socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de ropa al por mayor ella suele viajar a laciudad de Lima con frecuencia y ahora esta planeando su viaje la semana que viene para traer ropa y novedades para esta epoca navideña. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en: This member continues with her business buying and selling clothes.  She travels to Lima and buys clothes which are on offer in large stores and seasonal closeout merchandise.  She also buys from factories.  She buys all types of ladies', mens' and children's clothes.  She also buys boys' and girls' shoes and sneakers.  She is very happy because her business is doing very well and she is making good income which allows her to enjoy, and provide her family with, a better quality of life.  The member would like to invest her loan in buying clothes wholesale.  She usually travels to the city of Lima frequently and now she is planning her trip for next week.  She will bring back clothes and new items for the Christmas period.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes and shoes

loans.name: Norma Noemi's Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma Noemi, tiene 30 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos menores D. edad, ellos son su motor para trabajar y lograr brindarles lo necesario para vivir tranquilos.
Ella tiene una bodega ubicada en su domicilio, desD. muy joven inició su negocio, llegó D. provincia a una zona que recien empezaba a poblarse, por lo que para que surja su negocio, para que cresca le costó mucho trabajo, pero gracias a su sacrificio y empeño a lograr sus metas hoy en día cuenta con casa propia y tiene otro terreno aparte.
Su próxima meta es poner una ferretería y aprovechar en usar el terreno vacío que tiene, opina que éste negocio le sería muy provechoso puesto que vive en una zona que recién está poblándose y muchos vecinos están empezando a cosntruir sus casas.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. abarrotes y bebeidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Norma Noemi is 30 years old and has two young children.  They are her engines for working and bringing them what they need to live happily.

She has a store located in her home.  She started this business when she was very young.  She came from the province to a zone that was just beginning to populate.  It was a lot of work for her to grow her business, but thanks to her hard work and sacrifice, she was able to achieve her goals and now has a home of her own.  She also has another plot of land.

Her next goal is to open a hardware store and take advantage of the empty land she has.  She feels that this business will be very beneficial because she lives in a zone that is just populating and many of her neighbors are beginning to build their homes.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in groceries and drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Nellie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 7 children. Nellie has operated a shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Nellie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nellie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Delcy Yamileth

texts.es:
Delcy Yamileth, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en Colonia la López, Choloma junto con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, de 13, 10, 7 y 3 años de edad, tres de ellos estudian.
Delcy, muy emprendedora, se dedica a vender mercadería desde hace 5 años, ella vende artículos para el hogar, plásticos, juegos de ollas, cremas, ropa, zapatos y todo lo que le pidan sus clientes. Con este préstamo ella va comprar mercadería que le han pedido sus clientes y surtir el negocio, como ropa, zapatos, artículos del hogar y cosméticos. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable y educar a sus hijos
texts.en:
Delcy Yamileth, 27, lives in Colonia la López, Choloma, with her husband and four children who are 13, 10, 7 and 3 years of age; three of them attend school.

Delcy is very enterprising.  She’s been selling merchandise for five years.  She sells assorted items for the home, plastics, cookware sets, creams, clothing, shoes; whatever her customers ask for.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise her customers have ordered and stock her business with such items as clothes, shoes, items for the home and cosmetics.  Her dream is to have a stable business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 31 years old, and married with two children who are currently going to school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Emely runs a snack foods vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Emely has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as curls, candy, bread, soft drink, etc.  In the future, Emely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Sok Loeurt

texts.en:
Sok Loeurt, 26, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been running a motor taxi for over two years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. His wife is a garment worker. 

In order to improve his family's living conditions, Sok Loeurt is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a TUK TUK to run a transportation service for tourists to generate more income. In the future, he would like to put up a grocery store for his wife and build a new wooden house.

loans.use: to purchase a TUK TUK (motorcycle taxi) to run a transportation service for tourists.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a poultry business, selling at the market to restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak, leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Austina

texts.en: She is a 46 years old woman with three (3) children and got the knowledge of the business through her two years training programme, before she finally open her own. She lives at Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She needs the loan for her business improve.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Angélica

texts.en:
Angelica is married and has four children, 26, 27, 28 and 30 years old. Four years ago she had serious health issues. She had arthritis and could not move. Someone recommended some natural products and they worked very well to alleviate her symptoms. Since then she has promoted them herself. She enjoys sales and her personal experience with them have helped her sell them. At this time Angelica has many orders and she is asking for a loan of $275 to buy products wholesale at a good discount. She promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. You can play an important role in the growth of this business and help improve this family's quality of life. Angelica sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

La señora Angélica es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, de 26, 27, 28 y 30 años de edad. Hace cuatro años, Angélica pasó por graves problemas de salud, tenía artritis y no podía moverse, le recomendaron unos productos naturales que le funcionaron muy bien y pudo aliar las molestias que sentía, desde entonces empezó a promoverlos con mucho éxito. El gusto por las ventas y su experiencia con estos productos le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas rápidamente.

En estos momentos Angélica tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y para poder surtirlos en mayoreo, para conseguir un buen descuento, solicita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 275 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, Angélica agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To buy natural health products..

loans.name: Angélica María

texts.en:
Angelica Maria Vasquez is 35 and runs the small sandal store "Variedades La Promesa". She started the business about six months ago with her sister. They have just a little stall in the center of town, but the stall is well stocked. They used to work for someone else, but they learned the business and decided to strike out on their own. They try to keep their pulse on the fashion trends, making sure they don't get stuck with old styles and can meet the needs of their customers.

Angelica is a member of the group "Mujeres D. Ánimo" and will use this loan to purchase more sandals for sale. In the past she was a member of another women's credit group, but the interest rates and payments were too high, so she's happy to be working with Friendship Bridge now.

She and her husband and two children still live with her father. Of course one of her dreams is to have a house of her own. She would also like to purchase a stove and sell hamburgers and tacos in the space outsiD. their shoe store.

Written by Randy Fay, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Purchase sandals to increase inventory

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị D., 50 years old, is a participating member of the "Quỹ Tình thương" fund since 10/1999. After 8 years, she now has enough confidence to request a big loan to invest into her business. Started from a small stand selling clothes, she now runs a clothing store that offers a lot of variety, especially children fashion wear. Her husband passed away due to illness in 2000. She was left with 2 kids to raise by her self. Her children are now all grown up: her son is married and is a state employee, her daughter is independent and has a stand selling goods in her home. Despite the facts that she doe not have to take care of her children anymore, Ms D. does not want to abandon her business, she does not want to depend on her children. With a revenue of 200 USD, Ms D. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy more clothes for her store

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị D., 50 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ tháng 10/1999. Qua 8 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn tăng dần mức vốn vay để đầu tư buôn bán. Từ 1 quầy hàng nhỏ, mặt hàng đơn điệu, đến nay chị đã mở rộng cửa hàng với nhiều loại sản phẩm đa dạng, phong phú, đặc biệt là thời trang trẻ em tại chợ Nỉ, Sóc Sơn. Chồng chị mắc bệnh qua đời năm 2000 để lại cho 2 con còn đang độ tuổi đi học, một mình chị đã cố gắng nuôi 2 con khôn lớn trưởng thành. Đến nay con trai chị đã xây dựng gia đình và hiện đang là cán bộ kiểm toán nhà nước tại Hà Nội. Con gái đang bán hàng tạp hóa tại nhà riêng. Mặc dù hai con đều có công ăn việc làm ổn định nhưng chị D. không có ý định bỏ công việc kinh doanh quen thuộc của mình để sống dựa vào con cái. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng 200 USD, chị đang xin vay 1200 USD để mua thêm quần áo tăng lượng hàng bán ra trong thời gian sắp tới.

loans.use: buy clothes for her shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tám, 51 years old, lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa. She has been a member of TYM for 4 years. The loans had been very helpful to her and her family because they had accumulated lots of debts previously. Now things are for the better. Her husband is a fisherman and he brings home a decent revenue. Their financial situation had much improved. Ms Tám is applying for a loan of 325 USD to buy new fish nets for her husband with hopes that it would help her husband catch more fishes then her family financial condition would be better.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva vonlunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tám, 51 tuổi, sống tại huyện Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa vào Quỹ được 4 năm. Việc vay vốn trả dần đã giúp chị Lê Thị Tám đã đỡ vất vả vì thời điểm trước gia đình chị còn nợ nhiều lắm. Chồng đi biển thu nhập khá, đến nay đời sống gia đình chị cũng đỡ vất vả. Vòng vốn này chị đề nghị vay 325 USD để đầu tư vào mua sắm lưới đi biển cho chồng. Hy vọng với bộ lưới mới năng suất thu được sẽ cao hơn nhiều, gia đình chị sễ khá lên trong thời gian tới.

loans.use: Buy fishing-net

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara is 40 years old, teaches at a secondary school and has three daughters. In order to give them wellbeing and security, she acquired two motocarros, light delivery vans with three wheels, a long time ago with the crucial help and support of her loving husband. Currently her greatest dream is to implement a general store and enlarge the structure of the store in order to open a commercial store and also offer traditional cuisine. Eulogio, her husband, supports her in all her activities and, above all, in the goals that she has proposed. Clara, who has shown her desire to improve and her immense desire to make progress, requests a loan to invest in the purchase of products and expansion of the structure in her home in order to set up and increase her new channels of business. She hopes for your unselfish help from your noble hearts.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Clara tiene 40 años, ella es profesora de educación secundaria y tiene tres hijas, y a fin de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad hace mucho tiempo ha adquirido dos motocarros con la importante ayuda y apoyo de su querido esposo. Actualmente su sueño máximo es implementar una bodega y aumentar la estructura del mismo para aperturar una tienda comercial de manera adicional también ofrece platos típicos. Eulogio, su esposo, la apoya en todas sus actividades y sobre todo en las metas que ella se ha propuesto. Clara nos muestra su esmero por mejorar y sus inmensas ganas de progresar, solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de productos y en la ampliación de la estructura de su hogar para instalar e incrementar sus nuevas líneas de acción. Ella espera por la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Buy more products for her general store, expansion of her house in order to establish a commercial store

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana N. sells both new and used shoes. She plans to construct a bigger house and purchase more shoes for re-sale with the business profits she hopes to earn from expanding her business.

She and her friends, Diana K., Juliet, Lydia, and Florence, will each receive a share of this loan to invest in their individual businesses. They will support each other in the timely repayment of the loan. Each is intent on improving the financial situation of her family and on helping her friends in their group to do likewise.

loans.use: To expand each of their individual businesses

loans.name: Arubaine Ca Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Sophia N.. She sells matooke and is requesting a loan to invest in her food business. Sophia is 30 years old and is married. Her husband sells dry foods. She has 5 children ranging from age 2 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Sophia makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and she hopes to use her loan to cater for the needs of the children and the home at largel. Sophia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 and the loan was paid back on time.

Also in Sophia's group are Sarah W., Hadija G., Saida A. and Fatuma K.. Sarah W. sells used clothes and wants to expand her business. Hadija G. sells yellow bananas and wants a loan to expand her business. Saida A. sells used clothes and wants to start up a shoe business. Fatuma K. currently runs a small hotel and is requesting a loan to buy more hotel equipment.

loans.use: To expand matooke food business

loans.name: Kamukamu C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Stella N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add more shelves and stock. Stella is 48 years old and married. She has 6 children ranging from age 14 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Stella makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Stella is joined in her small group by Beatrice A., Rehema N., Zaina K., and Jesca N.. Beatrice A. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase a fridge. Rehema N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to boost her business. Zaina K. operates a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Jesca N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy more utensils .

loans.use: To purchase more shop items like soap, salt and flour

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido is 30 years old and is married to Cristina Mendoza. They live in their own home, and have a seven-year-old son, who attends school.

When Wilfrido was very young, he went to Argentina in search of work. He worked there in a photocopying, printing and binding company. Five years ago he returned home to open his own business.

His company is in a strategic position, located in the city centre, where he also carries out typing and printing work. He is currently working with his cousin, whose education fees he covers. He needs this loan so that he can buy a colour photocopier.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Wilfrido tiene 30 años de edad, está casado con Cristina Mendoza, ellos viven en casa propia, tiene un hijo de 7 años quien va a la escuela.

Wilfrido cuando muy joven viajo a la Argnetina en busca de trabajo, trabajo en un negocio donde se realizaban fotocopias, impresiones y encuadernaciones, y hace cinco años volvió al país y abrió su propio local.

La ubicación de su negocio es estratégica, está en el centro de la ciudad, también realiza trabajos de tipeo e impresiones a computadora. Actualmente trabaja con él un sobrino, a quien le costea los gastos de sus estudios en la facultad.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una fotocopiadora a color.

loans.use: To buy a colour photocopier

loans.name: Maria's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Maria is 25 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 6 and 2 years old. Maria sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Sikujua, who sells charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence O. is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Benin City, in the state of Edo in Nigeria. Her business, which she has been in for five years, is selling frozen fish to people in her community and also to market women. Florence needs a loan of $875 to buy more fish to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish to sell

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Ms.Le Thi T. is 42 years old. She has 2 children that are school age. Before she joined the organization, her family worked in farming and had faced many difficulties. In 1998, she and her husband had decided to join the organization to seek a loan to invest into raising livestock. After seeing no success in the farm animals business, Ms. Le Thi T. and her husband decided to obtain another loan to start a new business. In the beginning, she used the new loan obtained to buy large amounts of manufactured goods to sell to the people in her village and began noticing the business success. After gaining experience with this type of business, she began selling a variety of fresh food products. She saw the demands for fresh food goods in her village and since been investing more into these goods. Everyday her husband buys wholesale and bulk merchandise for her to sell in her home. Ms. Le Thi T. is able to bring in more customers by offering reasonable prices on her merchandises. As a result, her business has been stable and growing. The income of her business is 4.000.000d/month. She is requesting a loan of 15.000.000d to invest into buying more food products and other goods. This will help increase her inventory, selling them to, and meeting the needs and demands of those in her in her village.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê thị T. năm nay 42 tuổi. Hiện gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị dựa vào làm ruộng và chăn nuôi nên gặp không ít khó khăn . Năm 1998 chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư thêm vào chăn nuôi. Sau một vòng vốn thu nhập của gia đình từ công việc chăn nuôi tăng lên không nhiều do đó anh chị đã quyết định vay thêm vốn và bắt đầu đầu tư vào kinh doanh. Ban đầu gia đình chị sử dụng vốn để mua một số mặt hàng tạp hóa về bán cho người dân địa phương thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Sau một thời gian làm quen với công việc kinh doanh do nắm bắt được nhu cầu tiêu thụ về các loại thực phẩm tươi tại địa phương gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn để kinh doanh thêm mặt hàng này. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua thực phẩm từ các đại lý về cho chị bán tại nhà. Do khéo léo trong việc bán hàng, với giá cả hợp lý nên khách hàng tìm đến cửa hàng của gia đình chị ngày càng nhiều hơn, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã dần ổn định và phát triển. Thu nhập của gia đình đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng Vòng vốn này gia đình chị mong muốn vay thêm 15.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vốn để mua thêm thực phẩm, hàng tạp hóa để phục vụ tốt hơn nhu cầu của người dân địa phương phát triển kinh doanh tăng thêm nhập cho gia đình.

loans.use: Food business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 50 years old. She is a divorced woman. She has owned and run a small shop since in 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more items (phone vouchers) for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Yueo

texts.en:
Yueo P., 25, is married and lives with three of her children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1997, she has been a rice farmer and makes around US$1.50 per day. Her husband, Sorn Lim, earns approximately US$2.00 raising ducks. Yueo said that farming requires a lot of labor and energy, but that she does not earn enough to support the family. Also, inflation has been difficult in the past year. Every single thing has increased in price since last year, fertilizer and insecticide included.

Yueo would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, of US$1000 to purchase a truck to provide services for extra profit. She sees this purchase as a good opportunity to increase her income.


CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a truck to provide services for extra profit

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere O., who is 28 years old and married with one child, operates a laundry business in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Opening her business very early everyday to attend to customers, Chinyere does the majority of her washing manually. Because this is time-consuming, she sometimes loses customers to other laundry services. She is therefore  requesting a loan of $850 to buy a laundry machine. This will help Chinyere to retain her customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy a laundry machine

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Курбонова Дилором проживает в городе Вхдат. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшую семью. Замужем и имеет одного сына. Занимается животноводством. Муж покупает молодых телят , она их откармливает , а затем ее муж выводит скот на рынок , где продает по более выгодной цене. Бизнес приносит доход. Но для развития дела они хотят получить кредит и купить нового бычка. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilorom Q. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is a housewife. Her husband and son make up their small family. Dilorom raises livestock. Her husband buys young calves, she fattens them, and then her husband takes the animals to market where they are sold at a profit. The business brings in income. To expand their work, they want to recieve a loan for purchase of a new bull calf. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull calf

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor is an excellent father of three children, and farmer who is dedicated to his work.  His goal is to better his farming techniques.  This way, he fulfills the needs within his home, especially for his three children.  

He sows wheat, corn and different kinds of vegetables with the help of his wife, who is pictured in the photo as Mukhtor himself was absent on the day of our visit.  He travels daily, without delay, to his agricultural lands and is aware of every change that occurs.  Due to high demand for his products - because of their excellent quality, size and flavor - Mukhtor has decided to plant more, and apply for a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers that will contribute to an excellent harvest. 

With this, Mukhtor will be able to increase his sales, earn more, and meet the needs of his dearest children.  Your support will really help him.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. K. is a nurse in Chebunyo, Kenya (near Nakuru). He is married to a teacher and has four children, all of whom are in school. He started the Chebunyo Medical Clinic in Chebunyo in 1990.

Charles received his nursing certificate in 1982 and began working in a mission hospital in town. Eight years later, he saw a need for a local health facility, as at the time all medical facilities were located very far from his community. The Chebunyo Medical Clinic is a four-room facility that provides curative services, medical counseling, out patient care, pre and post-natal care, and family planning services to children and adults in the rural area.

Charles has recently been trained by the Kisumu Medical and Education Trust to provide post-abortion care to women who are suffering from having received poorly performed, illicit abortions. In order to provide the post abortion care services, Charles will need to purchase the appropriate medical instruments and a sterilizer. Charles is requesting a loan of 90,000 Kenya Schillings (1,200 USD) in order to buy these items, as well as to purchase a patient examination couch and improve his clinic with renovations that will add extra space to the facility.

In the future, Charles would like to add a maternity ward to the clinic and grow into a small hospital.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment, a patient examination couch, and to complete renovations.

loans.name: Kienthi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Kiên, năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị Kiên đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con nhỏ tại huyện Quảng Xương tỉnh Thanh Hoá. Năm 2003 chị thma gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào nghề dệt chiếu truyền thống của địa phương. Hiện tịa đây cũng là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 8.000.000, để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu gia tăng sản xuất.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kien Thi P. is a 35 years old woman. She is living with her husband and one small child in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. In 2003, she joined the TYM fund and borrowed money to invest in the local traditional job, producing sedge mats. At the moment, sales of sedge mats bring in income of about 3,000,000 VND per month. Mrs. P. plans to make the next loan of 8,000,000 VND to buy more raw material for the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy material to produce sedge mat

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
"Emma", as he is popularly called is forty-eight years old. He is married with two kids and very hard-working. Emmanuel is a dealer in electrical goods such as assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screw drivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

Emmanuel is requesting the loan to enable him to procure increased stocks of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase his savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support. He has been in this business for the past eight years and has a lot of experience and a wide market share in his business area. He belongs to the community group called Miracle Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure electrical goods for re-sale

loans.name: Zephaniah

texts.en: Zephaniah is 35 years old and single. He sells second-hand clothes. He needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Leody

texts.en:
Mr. Leody C. is a responsible father to his three children and all are in school. He is 41 years old and resides at P-5, Talairon, Oroquieta City. His wife stays home and takes care of their “sari-sari” store (general store) for income.

Mr. C. bought a motorcycle to be used as public vehicle. He believes this will help their family with added income. 

Recently, he joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to obtain additional working capital for his sari-sari store as well as to buy spare parts and tires for his motorcycle that was damaged. 

In the future, he will be happy enough if all his children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional commodities for sale and major repair of motorcycle

loans.name: Golibjon

texts.ru: Назаров Голибджон проживаюший в городе Куляб в возросте 38 лет женат имеет 4-ёх детей, образование среднее.Клиент занимается услукой, такси в городе Куляб, этим видом деятельности занимается уже более трех лет.У него имеется собственная автомашина марки OPEL ASTRA. На полученные  деньги, клиент хочет отремонтировать свою автомвшину.Занимаясь этим видом деятельности клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Golibjon N. lives in the town of Kulob. He is 38 years old, married and has four children. He has a secondary school education. Golibjon provides taxi service in Kulob, and has done so for the past three years. He has his own car, an Opel Astra. With the money he will receive, Golibjon wants to repair his automobile. By engaging in this sort of work, he is able to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repairs

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace un años tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, comenzó con poca mercadería, y en la actualidad está manejando muchos más productos con los que abastece las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes. Este es un negocio familiar, ya que su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan cuando es necesario, y el trabajo en unión familiar la anima a seguir con este negocio que le permite estar con los suyos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ella fue invitada a formar parte del banco comunal que actualmente integra, y por su parte estuvo investigado acerca de la dinámica de trabajo en este grupo, y con toda seguridad asume plenamente la responsabilidad de cumplir con las actividades convenidas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para comprar más mercadería en verduras y carnes, que son los productos que más solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For a few years she has run a grocery store in her home. At first it had very little merchandise but currently it is stocked with many products needed by her neighbors and customers. The store is a family business, her husband and children help her when necessary, and this family effort encourages her to keep the business so that she can be with them while working. This is Teresa's first loan with MFP; she was invited to become part of the community bank after being evaluated in regards to the group dynamics, and she confidently and fully took on the responsibility of fulfilling the requirements that were agreed upon. The money that Teresa requests is to buy more vegetables and meat, which are the products her customers request the most.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase store merchandise

loans.name: Baseliza Mey

texts.es:
La señora Baseliza Mey C. R. tiene 37 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Superior Técnica, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Baseliza  tiene como negocio principal su salón de belleza  lugar en el cual también ofrece sus productos de belleza. Con el crédito otorgado la empresaria inicio con la venta de productos de belleza, luego con la venta de productos lácteos (queso, manjarblanco) logrando más adelante equipar su salón de belleza. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de lacas, tijeras, cepillos y líquidos (accesorios para el salón de belleza).
Baseliza tiene como sueño poner una peluquería y vender sus productos de belleza en un lugar más céntrico.
texts.en:
Baseliza Mey C. R., 37, lives in the Casa Grande district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Perú. She attended a technical college. She has two dependent children. Her main business is her beauty salon where she also sells beauty products. With a loan she started selling beauty products. Then, she started selling dairy products like cheese and manjar blanco (a dessert made from milk and sugar). She was able to move forward in equipping her beauty salon. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, she bought beauty products. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy hairspray, scissors, brushes, and solutions (supplies for the beauty salon). Baseliza’s dream is to establish a beauty salon and sell her beauty products in a more central location.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hairspray, scissors, brushes, and solutions

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Rosalinda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase medication, vitamins and feed for the borrower's livestock. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Rosalinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medication, vitamins and feed for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty is married mother with one child. Currently her child is in school in the community where they live. She works very hard to help her husband in taking care of the home. She has been married for five years now. Gifty’s business is the sale of corn dough. Corn dough is used to prepare banku or kenkey and it can also be used for the preparation of porridge. She has been selling corn dough for the last two years now. She says selling of corn dough is lucrative because its moves very fast. She started this business with the support of her husband. The working capital she has is not enough to buy more bags of maize for the corn dough. She decided to look elsewhere for assistance and her friend, who is a beneficiary of the loan, introduced her to Sinapi. She is therefore requesting a loan which she believes would enable her to buy more bags of maize, from the villages, to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Mmoa’, meaning God’s Help.

loans.use: To buy more maize for the preparation of corn dough.

loans.name: Enjeh

texts.en: F. is married with two children. She originally joined GHAPE and got her first empowerment credit in 2007 and, since that time, she and her husband have enjoyed the benefits of GHAPE empowerment credits on two other occasions. Things have been very difficult for F. since she took her last loan of 200,000 frs, since thieves broke into her poultry house and stole all her fowls. As if that was not enough, the cold hands of death took away her first-born due to an accident, a son she had in mind to be very supportive of her. Before her first two loans, F. had only a little to start frying Accra beans (a mixture of ground beans) and used the profits. Throughout the years, F. has suffered the consequences of poor health and of her husband refusing to supply the needs of the children. Besides that, she and her family have simply suffered the results of poverty and the accompanying challenges of life that has brought them. F., however, has the beginnings of a solid business. She has a prime location for her poultry farm and she plans to reinforce it by buying planks and steel doors. She is well known throughout the community as being trustworthy with her customers. She also has years of experience already in running a poultry and a vegetable farm, which has helped her. With her third GHAPE loan, F. intends to invest in the poultry farm in offering chickens for sale, By expanding her business like this, she will also be able to offer manure for sale to fertilize local farms and gardens, and will also provide such essentials as oil, salt and Maggi (a soup mix) for the family. With the profits of this business, F. will be able to afford the school fees of her other children, and will be able to continue providing good healthful medications for them. She will be able to feed her family, provide them with clothes and will have the opportunity to save for the future as well. F. came to GHAPE because of the training scheme the organization offers, because of the terms of the loans, and because the method of repayment is “comfortable and convenient”. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, fertilizer, feed, pay rent of the farmland and renovate the poultry house

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn P. is from the village of Sebucao, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old. Erlyn is married. To make a living, Erlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Erlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery.

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Zahara is a member of the Ipogolo D in Ruaha,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother f 2 children,Her children are aged 8 and 3 years.

Zahara started her own business selling local beer 5 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zahara`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for her business,

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zahara hopes to save money and expand her business.

Yolanda is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her shop business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business

loans.name: Alatin

texts.fr: H. Alatin est née en 1972 à Adjarra. Alatin est mariée et est mère de trois (03) enfants tous scolarisés. C’est de l’huile rouge de palme que Alatin vend. Grâce à cette activité, Alatin aide son mari à faire face aux charges familiales. Alatin vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs pour diversifier ses sources de revenus. Malgré la passion que  Alatin a pour son activité elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds pour mener à bien son activité et se faire plus de revenus à la hauteur de ses charges. Pour ce fait, Alatin sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part de se constituer une épargne.
texts.en:
H. Alatin was born in 1972 in Adjarra. She is married and the mother of three children who are all in school. Red palm oil is what Alatin sells. Thanks to this business, she is helping her husband to cope with family expenses. She also sells cornmeal porridge to diversify her revenue sources. Despite her passion for her business, Alatin doesn't have enough funds for carrying out her work and for earning more income to meet her responsibilities. Given this fact, she's requesting a loan for bolstering her working capital to deal with her various expenses on the one hand and with establishing some savings on the other hand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil

loans.name: Marie Nyumah Group

texts.en:
'Marie N.' group is a group of 5 borrowers led by Marie N. ,41 years old, married with 4 children aged 11-29 years old. Their educational levels are 4th grade - university graduate. She also cares for siblings.

Marie lives in Clara town, Bushrod Island, a commercial community north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia. Bricks and soap production is Marie's business, and she has been running this business for 20 years. Selling good products and wonderful human relations have brought her this far.

Marie started this business with Ld$4,000 her husband gave her; she now operates for more than that amount. She is hoping to turn her little business into a factory through hard work and good management. 

Marie needs this loan in order to purchase more raw materials for production. She dreams of giving her children better education and health care.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for production

loans.name: Benon's Group

texts.en: Benon Korusherura is 45 years old and married with eight children, ranging in age from 20 years to 5 years. All of his kids are enrolled in school. Benon has been a fisherman for over 20 years and has recently opened up a grocery store to sell his catch and other food products. He would like to use the loan to expand his fishing operation. He hopes that with his continued hard work he will one day be able educate all of his children to the university level.

loans.use: To expand his fishing operation

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa K. is 41 years old and is married with four children aged 3 through 14. He and his family live in the Musanze district in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Issa has been an entrepreneur for five years in selling beans,rice,maize,sorghum in his local community. He employs 3 people in his business and his shop is open early every day, starting from 5 in the morning to 6 in the evening.

Issa is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to have sufficient capital to purchase more foodstuff for his shop which he thinks will attract more customers. With this loan he hopes to increase his business and build a more secure future for himself and his young family.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Jamilya's Group

texts.en:
Jamilya is the leader of this group. She is fifty-one years old. Jamilya has raised four children and has been divorced for some years. Her children have already grown up. Her eldest daughter, 31, is married. Her eldest and middle sons, 23 and 21 respectively, are both married. Jamilya’s youngest daughter is 17. Her sons and her daughter live with her. To make a living, Jamilya and her sons are trade in cattle. Being an experienced business-woman, Jamilya has been saving her earnings in order to find something in which to invest. Seven years ago, Jamilya was able to buy a calf with her savings, and she began a breeding business. Since that time, she has been able to increase her cattle population. She has started trading these cattle. As her sons grew up, she involved them in her business and they have become her partners. Her $95 investment, seven years ago, has brought an income of $190 per month. They recently were able to buy a car, Audi 100, for her eldest son. Jamilya needs a loan to invest in purchasing calves for feeding. Once she earns the money from selling these calves, she plans to make a repair at her house.
Despite her age, Jamilya is full of energy to keep working. She wants to build a big shed for her cattle and to help her son purchase accommodation as capital investment. 
 
Jamilya’s partners are: Ulan, Nazira and Elmira.

Ulan, 26, is single. His occupation is animal husbandry and he trades in hay. Ulan has been quite successful in this business as he has been able to start building himself a house. He has applied for this loan to purchase some cattle. 

Nazira, 26, has two children. She breeds poultry: geese, ducks and hens. During one year, she has experience and a stable income. Nazira hopes to get this loan in order to purchase laying hens and broilers. 

Elmira, 44, is a mother of three children. With her husband, she brings calves from pastures and sells them in cattle market. Elmira needs this loan to buy calves.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy calves for feeding and later resale.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  She is 29 years old.  Emily is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the primary source of income for the business comes from selling charcoal in the local community.  Emily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.  

In 2008, Emily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emily is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business.  This loan will her second loan from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 47, is married and has four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim, in the western region of Ghana. Rose works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in onions, supplying to retailers and food vendors in her community as well as nearby communities.  In business for  over 20 years, Rose is now requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy onions

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem U. is a villager in Kor village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectar field of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living.

With her farming she now has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy these items.

Her husband, Mr. Vong Chek, is a construction worker. Mrs. Noem U. is a mother of two children; one is employed in a garment factory and the other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel to support her field.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 39 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 8 enfants en charge et 1 neveu de plus qu'on lui a confié. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, une activité qui lui procure de revenus qui lui permette de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 39 year-old married woman with eight children of her own and a nephew in her care. She rears and fattens sheep for a living; this brings in revenue so that she can look after her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her ability to finance herself

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es: El señor Pedro
texts.en:
Pedro is a gentleman dedicated to his work and above all to the well-being of his family, which includes his wife and two school-aged children. They live in the Chinandega area. He is asking for this loan in order to pay for his children’s education expenses, such as tuition, school supplies and uniforms. In this way Pedro can see to it that his children will grow up to be successful professionals and contribute to the betterment of the nation.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for children's education expenses

loans.name: Bojjo

texts.en:
Bojjo K is currently in the business of selling groundnuts paste and onions in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and groundnuts to sell. Bojjo is 38 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more onions and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita C. is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Burgos St., Barangay IV, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married and has four adult children.

Anita owns and operates a sari sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately Php 6,000 a month.

Anita joined NWTF in 2000 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of Php 19,500 from NWTF.

Anita is now requesting a new loan of Php 19,500 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 14th from NWTF. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cristina's Group

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 30 years old. Cristina is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cristina is married and has 3 school-aged children. Cristina owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products. Cristina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops like passion fruit and also poultry to sell

loans.name: Heyling Judith

texts.es:
La señora Heyling Judith C. C., es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$7,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de varios electrodomésticos y perfumen que le encargaron ya la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargos.

Es  casada sin hijos, de ella solo dependen sus padres con los que vive actualmente. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como docente de primaria.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
La señora Heyling Judith C. C., es una persona emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$7,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de varios electrodomésticos y perfumen que le encargaron ya la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargos. Es casada sin hijos, de ella solo dependen sus padres con los que vive actualmente. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como docente de primaria. Lleva 7 créditos en CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para  invertir en la compra de mercadería como: perfumen y electrodomésticos.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Arrieros.
Gladis es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo, Gladis viaja a las diferentes ferias en donde vende abarrotes en general y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales, productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Gladis son tener casa propia y aumentar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the communal bank "Arrieros." She is 29 years old, and lives with a partner and a son. Gladis travels to the different markets in the area where she sells groceries and buys cheese, cereals and products that she later sells in the city of Ayacucho. Gladis needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Gladis dreams of having her own home and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeun M. is 56 years old and a villager who lives in Pring village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot to cultivate rice. She is also a grocery seller and a pig breeder, earning a small income through her pig breeding at home to support her family. 

To support her pig breeding and farming, Mrs. Hoeun M. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a laborer to plow her farm; to buy fertilizer to support her crop; and to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. 

Mrs. Hoeun M. is a widow with five children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other two are students who also support their mother's business.

loans.use: To pay for a laborer to plow her farm and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime T. C. tiene 56 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y 5 hijos, Carmen (17), Jaime (12), Fabián (10), Cristina (8) y Beatriz (6), en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
 
Jaime es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del Canton de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Jaime se dedica la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de su familia. Lo que mas siembra es maíz. Hace las compras en el mercado de San Pablo (a media hora de San Miguel) y las ventas a los comerciantes en el terreno.

Jaime solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y fertilizantes y  cerdos. Piensa que el préstamo le ayudará a comprar mejores fertilizantes.  Su sueño es comprar un terreno y remodelar la casa. Los desafíos que el enfrenta son enfermedades en los cultivos y el clima que afecto a dichos sembrios.

A Jaime le gustan las fiestas de San Pedro y San Pablo (pueblos cercanos de San Miguel), que se celebran con la familia y amigos.
texts.en:
Jaime T. C. is 56 years old, he is married and he lives in the canton of San Miguel, located in the Bolívar county, with his wife and his 5 children: Carmen (17), Jaime (12), Fabián (10), Cristina (8) and Beatriz (6). Jaime is a member of the Santiagopamba communal bank, located in San Pablo, half an hour away from the canton of San Miguel. The communal bank is composed of people dedicating themselves mainly to agriculture as a source of income for the family. Jaime dedicates himself to agriculture as a source of income for his family. He mainly sows corn: he buys seed in the market of San Pablo (half an hour away from San Miguel) and sells his products to merchants directly from the field. The loan Jaime is requesting will be used to buy manures, fertilizers and pigs. He thinks the loan will help him buy better fertilizers. He dreams of buying some land and restructure his house. Crop illnesses and the bad climate affecting these same sown fields are the main challenges he has to face. Jaimes likes the festivals taking place in the towns of San Pedro and San Pablo (two villages close to San Miguel), that he attends to with his family and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manures, fertilizers and pigs.

loans.name: Help The Poor Group

texts.en:
Setting W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Help The Poor". She is 49 years old, married and has eight children who range in age from 12 to 34 years old.
