She was not able to attend school due to poverty. For 4 years, she has been selling rice and oil at the Duazon Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She describes herself as a good woman.

Setting plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil. Her goal is to grow her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and gallons of oil

loans.name: Kisa Kya Maria Womens Group- Kayunga

texts.en: S. David William is married with a family of four. He has been operating a retail shop in Ntenjeru, Kayunga where he has been selling mostly general merchandise for over three years. He has been trading in a variety of products commonly used for domestic use like sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, paraffin and much more merchandise, earning him a profit of 70,000 Ugandan shillings per week. S. was encouraged by his brother-in-law to join the business. He began by selling agricultural produce. This hard working gentleman also earns extra profits from banana sales, milk sales and a rental business. Ever since he began operating his retail shop, he says he has faced the problem of a limited stock of products in his shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demands. Therefore, David is looking forward to increasing the retail stock in his business when he gets this loan and expanding into a wholesale shop. This, he says, will help him earn more revenue and live within the means of his business as he envisions improving his family’s standard of living and further educating his children.

loans.use: To buy more retail stock for his business

loans.name: Pouch

texts.en: Pouch S. is a 30-year-old married man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is blessed with two young kids who are not enrolled in school. He is a security guard who works in a public garden. Pouch started his job more than three years ago. His wife works as a cleaner and also spends time at home to take care of the kids and do household work. This family does not have a comfortable standard of living because their house does not currently have access to the local water system. Pouch hopes to connect his house to the water supply but he needs to pay the fee. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan from Kiva in order to do so.

loans.use: To pay the fee for a water connection

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, Provincia del Cusco y Departamento Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; el tiene 69. Años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, el socio es casado;  El socio alterna sus actividades con la atención de su cafetín que está situado frente a la facultad de enfermería en la universidad nacional; El socio atiende todos los días su cafetín en el cual vende pasteles, sándwich, hamburguesas, gaseosas, bebidas calientes, y ahora el necesita implementar y comprar mercadería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su local, como gaseosas, papas, panes, galletas, carne, pollo.

El socio agradece y valora esté préstamo el cual le permite crecer en su negocio, El socio se compromete a cumplir el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Progreso (Progress) communal bank. The bank is located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Cusco Department. The member is Feliciano; he is 69 years old, is married and has four children. He divides his time between other activities and working in his little cafe, which is located in front of the nursing school at the national university. He works in his cafe every day, selling cakes, sandwiches, hamburgers, soft drinks, hot drinks, and now he needs to expand and buy merchandise. The member is asking for the loan to buy merchandise for his shop, like sodas, potato chips, bread, cookies, meat and chicken. The member is grateful for and values this loan, which will allow him to reach his goals. He promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Macario

texts.es:
El Señor Macario A. S. tiene 27 años es soltero y  tiene 2 hijos; el trabaja actualmente el trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato“2 de Agosto”  en el cual esta hace mas de 3 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es  la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuentemente mejorar su calidad de vida.
El señor Macario A. S. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le  comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución, el tiene la vision de poder hacer estudiar a sus hijos, pues despues de la migracion de la madre de sus hijos a España, ellos quedaron casi desamparados.
texts.en:
Sr. Macario A. S. is 27 years old, single, and has two children. He currently works as a motorcycle taxi driver for the August 2nd union, of which he has been an active member for more than three years. His business is profitable because of the high quality of customers who request his service since it is convenient, quick, and efficient. The union assigns stops and routes for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama where people go out of their way to request taxi services.

This is the first time Macario is requesting a loan from CIDRE. He plans to buy a new motorcycle so that he can perform his work and provide better service to his customers. As a result, his income will improve as well as his quality of life.

Sr. Macario A. S. applied for a loan from CIDRE after his co-workers told him about the good credit terms one can receive by working with the Institution. He has the vision to provide his children with an education since they were left almost helpless after their mother migrated to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dulamragchaa

texts.en:
Dulamragchaa D. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two teenage sons in their ger (a traditional housing tent) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Both sons, ages 16 and 14, attend a local high school. His wife has been operating a construction business specializing in interior decorating since 1990 and has built a stable operation. 

From 2000 to 2009, Dulamragchaa operated a taxi service using his own car. In 2009, based on his wife's experience, he started selling plumbing supplies in a small pavilion. In the future, he plans to open his own construction store. He is a very hardworking man. He is requesting a 1,050,000 MNT loan to purchase a large number of plumbing supplies.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing supplies

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita V., age 41, is from the village of Mandih. Carlita and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Carlita makes and sells food. She sells dried goods in the local community. Carlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Carlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Carlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carlita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Carlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mr. Lay P., age 40, is a villager who lives in Lekh Pir village in Kandal province. He is a motorbike "tuk tuk" taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. Noun Mom, is 40 years old and works as a fish vender in the local market. With both their occupations, they are able to earn a good income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve the family's living conditions, and in order to enlarge his wife's business, P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish to resell. This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda M. is thirty-eight years old and married. Her husband is a fishmonger and they have three children aged between twelve and six years old. Her business is located at Khayega in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya and is well known for its sugar cane production and as the sugar belt region.

She sells groceries, a business she has done for fourteen years now, and has two employees. Her major customers are local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is when the business goes down because of lack of rain, since in this area the farmers depend on rain to grow crops. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more vegetables to boost her business. She hopes to grow her business and diversify to a taxi business. She describes herself as a focussed and determined lady.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “27 de Mayo Panamericana” es uno de los grupos más antiguos del Centro focal de Panamericana, cuenta con 24 ciclos, es decir doce años.  Las señoras fundadoras están llenas recuerdos, han  podido observar el crecimiento de la institución y de su grupo, durante este tiempo algunas han descansado y luego han regresado nuevamente. Esta banca comunal cuenta con la participación de diez integrantes.  La mesa directiva para este ciclo tiene como presidenta a la señora Loida, como tesorera a la señora Simona y como secretaria de actas a la señora Giovanna. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de carne, atención de tienda de consumo, artesanía en yeso, venta de haba, venta de golosinas, venta de artesanías.  

La señora Loida, presidenta de la banca comunal “27 de Mayo Panamericana” es una de las  fundadoras  del grupo.  Actualmente está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  Con respecto a su negocio  ella  tiene un puesto de venta en la Fería 16 de Julio, la feria más grande de la Ciudad de El Alto.  En este puesta vende refrescos, galletas, dulces y similares.  La feria se desarrolla los días jueves y domingo, días en los que recibe la ayuda de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “27 de Mayo Panamericana” communal bank is one of the oldest groups of the ProMujer regional hub of Panamericana. They have completed 24 loan cycles over 12 years. The founding members have many memories of the growth of the institution and of their group. They have watched some of the members retire for a while and then return. 

Now, the communal bank has ten members. The board of directors for this loan cycle has Loida as president, Simona as treasurer, and Giovanna as secretary. The members have various businesses, including food sales, clothing sales, produce sales, meat sales, general store, plaster handicrafts, bean sales, cookie sales, and handicraft sales.

Loida, president of the communal bank, is one of the founders of the group. She is married and has four children. She has a stall at the “Feria 16 de Julio,” the largest market in the city of El Alto. She sells soft drinks, cookies, candy, etc. The market is open on Thursdays and Sundays and Loida receives help from her children.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for market stall - soft drinks, cookies, candy, etc

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is thirty-eight years old.  She lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone, primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise cattle or other animals.  Mercedes owns her home and shares it with her two children.  She is a single mother.

Out of her home, Mercedes operates a small juice and fruit selling business.  She can be found in the door of her home each day offering a wide range of juices to passersby, workers on break or other members of the community.  She is well known in the region for the high quality of her products.  In addition, Mercedes raises fowl in corrals behind her home.  She raises ducks, chickens and turkeys.

Mercedes plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional fruit, supplies and equipment to improve her business.  She hopes this will attract additional clients and further improve the quality of her service.  This will be her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to obtain credit at a reduced interest rate as a result of the Kiva support.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruit, supplies and equipment to improve her business.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag D. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His one child attends a local school while his son helps him with the business. He operates a car repair service out of his fence. Ganhuyag started this business in 1996 and has built a stable operation since then. Over the many years of operation, he has gained a lot of experience as a repairer who is specialized in repairing diesel engines. He is teaching his skills to his son. Ganhuyag is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more machinery parts for his car repair service.

loans.use: To purchase more machinery parts

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel  de 57 años de edad es casado,tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores y con su propia familia, labora para el MINED desde hace 25 año como docente en una escuela de Tecolostote. Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de continuar mejorando su casa, esta vez construyendo la division de los cuartos, ya que actualmente es de playwood y esta en mal estado.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 57 years old, and he is married. He has 3 older children who have their own families. Luis Manuel has been working for MINED for the last 25 years as a teacher in a school in Tecolostote. He is requesting his 9th loan with the objective of continuing to renovate his house. This time he is constructing the divisions between the rooms, since presently the divisions are made of plywood and are in a bad state.

loans.use: Room repair

loans.name: Asociacion De Mujeres Agroindustriales De San Pedro Group

texts.es:
La Asociación de Mujeres Agroindustriales de San Pedro de TR. se funda en Marzo de 1997 adquiriendo una finca del Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario, la cual cancelaron en un período de 10 años. El grupo está conformada por 6 mujeres que se dedican a la siembra en invernadero de hortalizas tales como tomate, vainica, chile dulce además de tener producción de café en su finca. El objetivo del grupo es obtener un ingreso adicional, por medio de el fomento de actividades agroindustriales y además beneficiar a las familias de la comunidad con proyectos productivos acordes con los conceptos de conservación y uso racional de los recursos.

Entre las principales actividades de la Asociación están: 

1.	Coordinar con el Ministerio de Agricultura, el Instituto de Desarrollo Agrario y otras instituciones públicas de Costa Rica para obtener el servicio de asistencia técnica, que estas instituciones brindan.
2.	Producción de chile dulce, tomate, almacigo de chile, vainicas y otros productos, producidos bajo medio controlado (invernadero) para la comercialización y generación de ingresos.
3.	Mantenimiento de una finca de café, propiedad de la Asociación, la cual representa un ingreso anual fijo.


Su principal prioridad fue conseguir un lugar donde poder desarrollar agricultura orgánica, ellas cuentan con una finca en la zona de San Pedro de Valverde Vega, cantón de la provincia de Alajuela, ubicada en el Valle Central de Costa Rica, en las faldas del Volcán Poas. Incentivando a la mujer en su desarrollo como empresaria. 

Además de la finca de café poseen un área de invernaderos los cuales se vieron afectados por los vientos del mes de Diciembre del 2010, ocasionando la destrucción parcial del techo de uno de ellos; razón por la cual requieren de 228000 colones para completar la reparación del mismo, ellas cuenta con un capital de 200000 colones, producto de la venta de vainicas, las cuales estaban produciendo en los invernaderos.

 Misión:
La Asociación busca su propio desarrollo sostenible, el de las asociadas y sus familias, utilizando para ello la diversificación agroindustrial, nuevas tecnologías de producción, para ofrecer al mercado comprador diversos productos de calidad, logrando así nuevos mercados y oportunidades de desarrollo.

Visión:
Ser una organización autogestionaria de mujeres que por medio de la diversificación de actividades agroindustriales, genera oportunidades para el desarrollo socio-económico de sus familias.

Una vez realizado el estudio de crédito y verificado las diferentes actividades a las que se dedica el grupo,   demuestra la capacidad  para cubrir la cuota en el plazo establecido. Además con esta inversión se va a reparar el invernadero fortaleciendo así la producción de hortalizas del grupo.




 La Asociación es propietaria de la finca y la infraestructura de invernaderos con la que cuentas, tienen jornadas de trabajo entre sus socias, las cuales pueden apoyar el proyecto y al mismo tiempo atender a sus familias, genera un ingreso complementario a su hogar y permite apoyar el estudio de sus hijos y mejora la calidad de vida de sus integrantes. Al mismo tiempo en temporada de recolección de café genera empleo a los habitantes de la zona.
texts.en:
La Asociación de Mujeres Agroindustriales de San Pedro de TR. [The Agro-industrial Women's Association of San Pedro de TR.] was formed in March 1997  when they acquired a farm from the Agrarian Development Institute, which they paid off over a period of 10 years. The group is made up of 6 women who grow greenhouse vegetables such as tomatoes, string beans, and sweet peppers, as well as producing coffee on their farm. The goal of the group is to gain additional income through promoting agribusiness activities as well as to benefit families in their community with profitable projects which are in accordance with the concepts of conservation and rational use of resources. 

Some of the main activities of the Association are:

1.	Coordinate with the Ministry of Agriculture, the Agrarian Development Institute and other Costa Rican public institutions to receive the technical assistance these institutions provide.
2.	Produce sweet peppers, tomatoes, chile seeds, string beans and other products, through controlled methods (greenhouses) for marketing and the generation of income. 
3.	Maintain a coffee plantation, owned by the Association, which provides a fixed annual income. 

Their first priority was to obtain a place where they could develop organic agriculture, encouraging women in their development as businesswomen. They have a farm in the San Pedro de Valverde Vega region in Alajuela province, located in Costa Rica's Central Valley, on the slopes of the Poas volcano.  

In addition to the coffee plantation, they own an area of greenhouses. These were damaged by strong winds in December 2010, including the partial destruction of one of the roofs. For this reason, they are requesting 228000 colones ($475) to complete these repairs, to supplement their own capital of 200000 colones from the sale of string beans which were produced in the greenhouses.

Mission:
The Association seeks sustainable development for itself, its members, and their families, through agribusiness diversification and new production technology, in order to offer diverse quality products in the marketplace, thereby securing new markets and opportunities for development.

Vision:
To be a self-governed organization of women who, by means of diversifying agribusiness activities, generate opportunities for the socio-economic development of their families. 

Once the loan is granted and the different activities the group does are verified, they will demonstrate their ability to repay the amount in the specified timeframe. With this investment, they will repair the greenhouse, thereby strengthening the group's vegetable production as well.

The Association owns the farm and the greenhouse infrastructure. They split work shifts among the members, so they can support the project and at the same time tend to their families. It generates supplemental household income and allows members to support their children's education and improve their quality of life. At the same time, the coffee harvest generates seasonal employment for the region's people.

loans.use: Reconstruction of greenhouses damaged by wind.

location.town: Alajuela, San Pedro de Valverde Vega

loans.name: Sylver

texts.en:
Sylver is 31 years old and married, with two children who are between 3 and 7 years old.  Sylver is in the business of transportation, which he has been doing for three years. His business is well organized.

Sylver plans to use his loan to buy another motorcycle and material for a motorcycle. He hopes to make enough profit to renovate his house and to save money for his family.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle and material for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Atusparias del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zona urbana marginal que carecen de servicios básicos.

Olga cuenta una mototaxi la cual alquila  a otra persona  para que brinde servicio de transporte público de pasajeros de la ruta Chiclayo – José Leonardo Ortiz y alrededores. Ella tiene tres años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos personales y de su familia.

Olga desea dar mantenimiento a su vehículo de esta manera seguir brindando un buen servicio, además tiene pensado más adelante tener una flota de 5 mototaxis realizando el mismo servicio así podrá incrementar sus ingresos y por consiguiente mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Olga is 34 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the sector of Atusparias in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz. It is one of the most populated districts in the region of Lambayeque, which is characterized by its high rate of poverty and by the people who live on the periphery of the city and lack basic necessities.

Olga relies on her mototaxi which she rents from another person so she can offer public transportation for passengers on the route from Chiclayo to José Leonardo Ortiz and the surrounding areas. She has been doing this work for three years and thanks to this, she is able to pay her personal expenses and those of her family.

Olga wants to maintain her vehicle in order to continue offering good service. She is also thinking of the future when she would like to have a fleet of 5 mototaxis doing the same work in order to increase her income and improve her way of life. She has therefore decided to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To maintain her vehicle.

loans.name: Dolis Esther

texts.es: Dolis C. es una mujer muy valiente, emprendedora y madre de tres hijos en las edades de 17 y 18 años, por los cuales cada día se levanta y trabaja fuertemente con tal de verlos con bienestar y cumpliendo cada uno su sueños. Su experiencia de negocios data desde hace 6 años, cuando empezó vendiendo ropa entre sus amigas y posteriormente tomando pedidos de calzado cosmético, perfumes y gran variedad de productos que le solicitan clientes rentables y referidos por estos. De esta manera Dolis realiza su negocio y otorga créditos y aunque tiene una alta competencia, en las líneas de productos que ofrece, siempre está en la búsqueda de buenos precios y en darle respuesta oportuna a sus clientes y esto es su gran desafío, porque con su pequeño capital invertido en este negocio, para responderles debe esperar la recuperación de su cartera. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa, calzado, perfumes y variedades de artículos de temporada escolar, para mantener su rentabilidad de un 33% y lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo en función de apoyar la educación futura  de sus hijos con el aumento gradual en sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Dolis C. is a very courageous, enterprising mother of three children aged 17 and 18.  Every day she gets up and works hard for her children in order to take care of their well-being and ensure that they can fulfil every one of their dreams.  Dolis' business experience dates back 6 years which is when she started out selling clothes to her friends.  She then started taking orders for shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and a large variety of other products, from existing customers and people to whom she had been recommended.

This is how Dolis runs her business.  Although she faces stiff competition on the lines of products that she offers, she is always seeking out good prices and responding to her customers' needs in a timely manner.  Her big challenge is that the small amount of capital that she has is invested in her business so in order to meet her customers' demands she must wait until her money is freed up again.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan which will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy clothes, footwear, perfumes and a variety of school supplies for the upcoming school year in order to keep her profitability at 33% and increase her working capital in order to support the future education of her children by gradually increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, perfumes and a variety of school supplies

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es: Martha tiene 22 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en el caserío San Pablo Hualtaco II en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Cuenta con el básico servicio de luz, pero aun no tiene acceso a agua potable. Martha se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y porcino. Realiza esta actividad en algunos corrales ubicados fuera de su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Adicionalmente, para generar ingresos adicionales, trabaja en una fábrica de mango. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimentos balanceados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, Martha puede ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como agricultor, con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in her own home in the village of San Pablo Hualtaco II in the District of Tambogrande. This farming district is situated in Piura region and located more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. Martha receives basic services such as electricity, but she does not have access to potable water.

She raises sheep and pigs and keeps the animals in pens located outside of her home. When the animals have reached the proper level of development, she offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where she lives. Martha is well-known in her area and has an established customer base. In addition, she works at a mango processing plant to earn extra income.

Martha wants to expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. With her earnings, she will be able to help her husband, who works as a farmer, with the family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Cariñositos Group

texts.es: La banca D. emprendimiento CARIÑOSITOS esta en su primera secuencia, contando con 6 integrantes mujeres y 2 varones, esta banca se caracteriza por vivir en la misma zona Periférica que queda a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. La Paz, la Presidenta es La Señora Edelmira con 37 años D. edad, ella obtuvo el crédito con la finalidad D. aumentar y equipar su salón D. belleza la misma que atienD. desD. hace mucho tiempo, es una persona muy responsable por este motivo fue elegida como presidenta del grupo, por su solidaridad con sus compañeras, con el dinero del crédito comprara material D. peluquería como tintes tijeras, champó, etc. La  Sra. Edelmira es una persona con ganas D. superación siempre velando por el bienestar D. su familia su deseo es el D. mejorar la calidad d evida D. toda su familia. Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cariñositos” is in its first loan cycle with a membership consisting of six women and two men.  The members of this bank live in the same area called Periférica, which is 20 minutes from La Paz.  Sra. Edelmira, age 37, serves as the president.  She is receiving a loan so that she can expand and equip her beauty salon which she has managed for a long time.  Edelmira is a very responsible person, which is why she was elected to be president of the group.  The money from her loan will be used to buy beauty supplies such as dyes, scissors, shampoos, and other items.   Edelmira is a woman who wants to get ahead and is always looking out for her family. Her desire is to improve the quality of life for her family. 

All of the members are responsible and hardworking people.  They are grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: To purchase dyes, scissors, shampoos, and other items.

loans.name: Grp 110 Gbenonkpo Ab Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Grp 110 GBENONKPO AB" est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent toutes à la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Virginie, est celle dont le doigt est levé sur la photo. Ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. 
Virginie est mariée à un certain Bernard. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Virginie habite au quartier Adjégounlè à Cotonou (Capitale économique du Bénin) avec ses enfants et son mari depuis une vingtaine d’année. Le couple se partage les diverses charges familiales. Virginie  n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près de vingt cinq ans que Virginie prépare de la bouille faite à base d’amidon de maïs (« Akpan » et « Tapioca ») près de chez elle. De façon secondaire, Virginie  vend des fruits  qu’elle achète à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Virginie désire obtenir un crédit avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group "Grp 110 Gbenonkpo AB" is made up of three people who all come from the same family.  The representative of the group, named Virginie, is the one whose finger is raised in the photo.  The group is seeking ALIDé's financial support in order to raise their level of business.  Virginie is married to a man named Bernard.  The couple has six children, all educated, of which three are in their care.  Virginie has lived in the Adjégounlè in Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) with her children and husband for some twenty years.  The couple shares the various familial responsibilities.  Virginie never went to school.  For almost 25 years, Virginie has prepared porridge, with corn starch as the base ("corn patties" and "tapioca"), near her home.  As a secondary business, Virginie sells fruit that she buys in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  With the goal of increasing her stock of products and better responding to the demand of her customer base, Virginie would like to receive a loan, along with the other members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, manioc flour, and tapioca.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 menores hijos. Su casa esta ubicada en el distrito de Olmos, en un pequeño caserío llamado Las Norias.   

Moisés trabaja como obrero dependiente, el cual trabaja para el proyecto especial olmos con un tiempo aproximado de mas de 6 meses,  y además como actividad complementaria realiza labores de agricultura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace mas de 8 años en su caserío, aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. 

Moisés está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para algunos gastos de construccion en su vivienda, para que de esta manera moises pueda contar con seguridad y comodidad en su hogar.

Moisés es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, y se le conoce como una persona puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Moisés is a 39-year-old father who lives in his own home with his wife and two young children. Their house is located in a small village called Las Norias in the District of Olmos.

Moisés is an employed worker who is currently assigned to a special project in Olmos that will last for more than six months. In addition to this job, he has been farming in his village for more than eight years. He learned how to farm from his father and is known for being a perfectionist.

Moisés is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to pay for some of the expenses related to the construction of his house. This will allow his family to have a safe and comfortable home.

Moisés is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa who is known for being a punctual and responsible person.

loans.use: to pay for home construction expenses.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 23 года. Не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. Ее отец занимается растениеводством, а мама у нее домохозяйка. Сама Фируза имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она преподает в средней школе. Кроме того в свободное от работы время она занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Firuza lives in Hamadoni. She is 23 years old and single.  She lives with her parents. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a housewife.  Firuza has a higher education in pedagogy. She teaches high school. Additionally, in her free time she works in animal husbandry.  She raises cattle for sale.  She has been doing this work for ten years.  She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elvis Deibys

texts.es:
Elvis es un joven trabajador y pujante de 23 años de edad que vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad en vías de desarrollo perteneciente al distrito de Chepén – La Libertad.

Elvis se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería en un puesto ubicado frente a uno de los mercados más concurridos de su comunidad. Él tiene este negocio desde hace 4 años y las ganancias obtenidas le permiten darle comodidades a su familia. Es por ello que Elvis desea invertir en su actividad.

Elvis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles, para comprar mercadería que su puesto necesita y que sus clientes requieren. Además utilizará otra parte del préstamo para usos personales.

Elvis solo ha trabajado con nuestra institución y cuenta con un excelente récord de pagos. Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito.
texts.en:
Elvis is a hardworking and vigorous young man. He is 23 years old, and lives with his parents in a developing community in the district of Chepén, La Libertad. 

Elvis sells hardware in a stand located in one of the busiest markets in his community. He has had this business for 4 years, and the income he earns permit his to provide comforts to his family. Because of this, Elvis wants to invest in his business.

Elvis requests this loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy merchandise that his clients need. Additionally, he will use part of the loan for personal uses.  

Elvis has only worked with this institution and has an excellent repayment record. He is very thankful to be granted this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and personal goods

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en: Tungalag is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Tuv province of Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker in a private company, earning a monthly salary of 300,000 MNT. Tungalag manages a ger item making business in her town. She started her business in 2000, developing a business group that included 5 members. Being a business group helped them to stabilize their business, and they now have a good relationship with their partners and customers. Tungalag used her business earnings to begin constructing a house on her plot of land. She is planning to increase her business sales in order to save some money. Tungalag is a hardworking lady who says, "I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pump and a water tank.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Merlinda has a beauty shop that provides hair dressing services, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for five years. Merlinda has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the beauty parlor. She has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her eldest son is a mechanic and works at a bus station and the second one works in a factory. The next three are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

Her husband also a mechanic at a bus station and she helps him support the family financially by selling sheep and goats. She purchases them from the animal market and sells to butchers and people for the EID (important Muslim occasion) after raising them.

EID season is near and Rukhsana wants to buy some goats to sell. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 

She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and hopes that an investment will bring good profits to her and she will be able to send her youngest son to school for education. 

She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her business growth.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has no other dependents. He owns a semi-permanent house where he lives with 8 people in Hioma, Uganda. His family goal is to make sure his children attain a good education. For 10 years he has been running a bar, amidst the challenge of high costs of operation. His dream is to have a wholesale shop. Antonio intends to use the loan facility to renovate his bar.

loans.use: to renovate his bar.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny is a 33-year-old lady who is married to Josua who works for a private company. In their marriage, they are blessed with 4 children: Reven (16) is in third grade of senior high school, Jose (10) and Stevani (8) are both at elementary school and Tasya (5) goes to kindergarten.

Even though Josua earns income on a regular basis, Henny is willing to earn more income by running a used clothing business. Henny is grateful that she can assist her husband in generating more money for her family. From the income she can cover her family's daily needs. Moreover, her children are growing up and all of them are at school now so Henny and Josua have to finance their education.  

Fortunately Henny is assisted by her sister, who lives in Batam, who buys good quality used clothing for Henny. Henny can resell them at a fair price. She usually sells door to door, particularly to her regular customers, as she can sell out quickly.

Currently Henny plans to improve her business by purchasing more used clothing from Batam but, unfortunately, she does not have enough capital. She is seeking a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to buy more stock. She is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
As a married mother with two children, Lisa works hard to support her family. She runs a tricycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling salt. Lisa has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF.

Lisa is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase equipment and pay for tricycle repairs. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and pay for tricycle repairs

loans.name: Martha Janed

texts.es:
En el municipio de Puerto Berrío, situado en el departamento de Antioquia vive Martha Janed, una microempresaria que desde muy pequeña ha trabajado para sacar a su familia adelante, pues a los 16 años ya tenia un hijo por quien responder, y aunque al comienzo contaba con el apoyo de sus esposo, hoy con 4 hijos y a sus 40 años es una mujer separada.  Martha tiene su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que es el sustento para su familia y aunque no son muchos los ingresos que genera, ella se levanta día a día con la ilusión de ver progresar su negocio.

Martha ve la necesidad de surtir la tienda en mayor cantidad, ya que así las utilidades se aumentarán, las ventas mejorarán y proporcionalmente su calidad de vida ira mejorando poco a poco.
texts.en:
In the town of Puerto Berrío, in the Department of Antioquia, lives Martha Janed.  She is a small-businesswoman who has worked since she was very young to be able to move her family ahead in life, as at 16 years old she had a son for whom she was responsible.  Although she had the support of her husband at the beginning, today she has four children and at 40 years old, is separated from him.

Martha has her own business, a grocery store, which is the source of income for her family.  Although the income she earns is not very much, she gets up every morning with the hope of seeing her business progress.

Martha sees the need to stock up her store with more products, as in this way her profits were grow, her sales will improve, and correspondingly her quality of life will improve little by little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up her store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 47 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida José. Margarita ha logrado establecer una tortillería en su hogar de residencia la cual día a día atiende con mucho amor y dedicación. Para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con las ricas e higiénicas tortillas que ella prepara para la hora del almuerzo y cena. Posee mucha clientela ya que ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, responsable y dedicada a su trabajo. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio de tal manera que sus ingresos se vean aumentados y logre mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Es por esta razón que tomo la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de insumos necesarios tales como: maíz, gas propano, cal, agua, etc. Para suplir la demanda que sus clientes hacen y consecuentemente su nivel de ingresos mejoren y calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Margarita, 47, lives in her own house with her life’s companion, José.  Margarita has managed to establish a tortilla shop at home that she tends to lovingly and with much dedication every day.  For her, the most important thing is that her customers are satisfied with the delicious and hygienic tortillas she makes for lunch and dinner.  She has a large clientele because she’s noted for being an honest, responsible woman who is dedicated to her work.  Her dream is to see her business flourish in such a way that her income increases and she attains a better quality of life for her family. For this reason she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy larger amounts of the ingredients, like corn, propane, lime powder, water, etc. needed to meet customer demand and consequently increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane, lime powder, water, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married and has five children. Erlinda is 61 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Erlinda sells crabs and prawns to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to purchase more crabs and prawns for her retailing business.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs and prawns for her retailing business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn is 41 years old and married with two children. She does rice farming and also raises pigs to earn additional income. She has been a farmer for 15 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. Horn requested a loan to buy a water pump for her rice field. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and feed her pigs to be healthy and fat. She hopes to have some savings for future family expenses and also to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Santos Elias

texts.es:
Santos, necesita otro crédito, porque lo invertirá en su negocio y comprara: leña, maíz, el propósito D. ella es que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable y mantener siempre a sus clientes. 
Los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron a mejorar su estilo D. vida ya que los ingresos son diarios, esto le permitió que su familia viva en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en: Santos needs another loan because she’ll invest it in her business.  She will buy firewood and corn. Her goal is that he business is always stable and to retain her customers.  Previous loans helped her improve her standard of living because income is daily.  This allowed her family to live in conditions that are better than they were before.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 41 years old and has one child who is age 17. Her child is currently in school. She sells spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles in a store that she has run for eight years. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to be available for sale in her store. The extra profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle and motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Abiodoun

texts.fr: Abiodoun est âgé de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Abiodoun est marié à une marchande du nom de Jeanne. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Abiodoun a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge.Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Abiodoun exerce depuis quatorze ans le métier d’ajusteur. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Abiodoun contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Abiodoun sollicite pour une deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement par Abiodoun a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Abiodoun is 36 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a shopkeeper called Jeanne. The couple has four children who all attend school. Abiodoun left school after primary level. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child in their care. The children live with their parents. The couple see to the family's needs together. In order to cater to his family's needs, Abiodoun has worked as a building fitter for fourteen years. Thanks to the money that he generates he is able to meet the family's needs. In order to meet his customers' demands, Abiodoun is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. All previous loans have been successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase tools for building fitting (drill, iron and taps)

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.   Mary Ann has a shop that retails rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy rice to resell

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith, es soltera y tiene 38 años de edad,  tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, ella sigue siendo secretaria en una institucion privada y sigue teneiendo un negocio de cafetin,ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de cafetin . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar sillas,mesas y productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.
 
La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Edith, is 38, and single.  She has a 12 year-old daughter. She continues to work as a secretary in a private institute, and continues to have a small café. 

She is open from 8:00am to 6:00pm. Her dream is to expand and improve her business. She is applying for the loan to buy chairs, tables, and cooking ingredients, such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

The borrower values and appreciates the loan she has been granted, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and cooking ingredients such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Kuruthumu is in her early sixties and single. She has been selling chicken and chips for ten years. She works from 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kuruthumu’s eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to add more stock to her business. She has repaid all of her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her stock of chicken and potatoes. Kuruthumu’s dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Kuruthumu will share this loan with her loan group, "Huruma", which consists of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back the loans.

loans.use: to  increase her stock of chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married to Sylvester, and they have been blessed with two children. She has been buying and selling maize for last three years, earning a monthly income of Kes 3000.

She is borrowing her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 10,000 which she intends to use to purchase more maize for sale. She plans to pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profit from the business.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and to purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: To add more stock to the business.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes, 22, has been farming for the past 5 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not doing comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. 

That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Bornes could increase her profits by satisfying the demand. Bornes believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the market's demand for cereals. Bornes also believes that the extra income she earns will enable a permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Bornes to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Auntie Lizzy sells palm oil in her community. She prepares the oil and sells to her customers. The cost of preparing is very high. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 to enable her to buy more palm fruits.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Maritza started her business with the help of her ex-inlaws who provided her with money to start the business.

Maritza will use the loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of merchandise and thereby to improve her income. She has confidence that her business will grow.

Maritza is 24 years old, and separated. She has 3 children, two of which go to school. Life as a single mother has not been easy for Maritza. She has to work very hard to be able to afford her children's education and housing. She hopes that this loan will improve the quality of life for her family and that it will allow her to save money to give her children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza empezó su negocio con la ayuda de sus ex suegros quienes le facilitaron el dinero para que emprendiera el negocio. .

Maritza usará el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercadería al por mayor y así poder tener mejores ingresos. Ella tiene la confianza que su negocio crecerá.

Maritza tiene 24 años, esta separada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos están en la escuela. Para Maritza la vida no ha sido fácil como madre soltera tiene que trabajar muy duro para ayudar a sus hijos con la educación y vivienda. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy wholesale merchandize

loans.name: Vidalia

texts.en: Vidalia P. A., 26, weaves and sells traditional fabric handicraft items. She's a member of a group of women that collaboratively sell their goods to Spanish language schools for foreigners in Quetzaltenango, which is about a 2-hour bus ride away. Vidalia is in her first credit cycle with Friendship Bridge, but her group used another credit provider (at a higher interest rate) in the past. Vidalia is married to husband Felipe and has a 9-month-old daughter, but they still live with her father. She had six years of schooling and speaks Spanish in addition to her first language, Cakchiquel.  She has a small plot of land, or milpa, on which she can grow corn, but it doesn't suffice for the family. Her dream is to build her own house and provide successfully for her children's education, so that her kids don't have to suffer through some of the things she's had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase yarn and other material to continue working

loans.name: Anadeli

texts.es:
Anadeli is 23 years old and has one child. In order to help her spouse out with the household costs, Anadeli sells clothes and prepares food typical to her region. She sells these items out of her mother-in-law’s house who also helps her with these sales. Anadeli belongs to the group Compañerismo 5 together with Ms. Pascuala Lopez Perez (who sells food) and Maria Luisa Caballero Silva (who also sells food). With this loan they hope to implement their businesses buying utensils for the kitchen and improve the condition of the places where they sell their food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ANADELI TIENE 23 AÑOS UN HIJO Y PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR , VENDE ROPA Y PREPARA COMIDA TIPICA DE LA ZONA Y LA VENDE EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRA QUIEN TAMBIEN LA APOYA EN LA VENTA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO COMPAÑERISMO 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA PASCUALA LOPEZ PEREZ ( VENTA DE COMIDA) Y MARIA LUISA CABALLERO SILVA (VENTA DE COMIDA). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN IMPLEMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO UTENSILIOS DE COCINA Y CONDICIONAR MEJOR LOS LUGARES DONDE VENDEN SU COMIDA .

loans.use: Sale of food typical to the region

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: Mrs. Mat S., aged 45, works with her husband rearing fish and milling rice crops to sell to the market-wholesaler, earning around $4.80 each day. They have seven children, two who are students and five who work in Malaysia. To take advantage of bulk purchase discounts, she would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a greater inventory of rice crops to mill. She also plans to use the loan to fund an electric machine to produce sugar cane juice to sell for an additional income stream. She plans to used the increased income to fund her children’s education and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops to mill and an electric machine to produce sugar cane juice.

loans.name: Ana Nieves

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the Las Activas community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali. She's 37 years old and a single mother of 4 children. Ana's income doesn't cover her family's expenses so she decided, with her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100), to set up a small general store. She now depends on the store and her sales of retail groceries. The business is lcoated in her house so she needn't leave her children by themselves. She gets up very early to make breakfast before then tending to the store.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,800 (about US$603), to be repaid in 5 months, she will supply the store with 4 cases of milk; 4 sacks of rice; 2 sacks of sugar; 3 packages of pasta; 3 cases of large-sized cooking oil; 2 cases of small-sized cooking oil; 2 cases of tuna; 1 case of soap;1 packet of detergent; 2 boxes of disposable diapers; and other inventory.

Ana is pleased to watch her business prosper because it's been a very important goal for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal las Activas, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa - Jr. San Pedro Mz. C Lt. 32, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para los gastos de la casa, es así que Ana, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (US$100.00) decide poner una pequeña bodega. para la venta de abarrotes al por menor. En la actualidad cuenta con su pequeña bodega donde vende abarrotes al por menor. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, lo que le permite atender a sus hijos sin tener que ausentarse. Se levanta muy temprano para hacer el desayuno y después de dedica a la bodega.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,800, (US$ 603.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 5 meses, implementará su negocio con 04 cajas de leche, 04 sacos de arroz, 02 sacos de azúcar, 03 paquetes de fideos, 03 cajas de aceite grande, 02 cajas de aceite chico, 02 cajas de atunes, 01 caja de jabón, 1 paquete de detergente, 02 megas de pampers, 01 caja de panteón y 12 cubetas de huevo.

Ana está muy contenta al ver que su negocio prospera, ya que es un logro muy importante para ella.

loans.use: Buy general merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: Aisha, the group leader, is a market vendor. She sells fresh matooke. She intends to buy a plot of land and construct a house with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To stock more matooke

loans.name: Marach B(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this group is R. Ismail. She is currently in the business of new shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock. R. is 23 years old and is married with a husband who sells shoes. She has 2 children aged two-and-a-half and four and they both go to school.

Each week, R. makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to construct a house. R. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

R. is joined in her small group by Fatuma S., Farida S. and Zaina N.. Fatuma S. has a business in shoe sales that she wants to expand. Farida S. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to purchase more clothes for S.. Zaina N. operates a business of dry fish and wants to expand her fish business.

loans.use: To expand shoe business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 50 years old, is currently in the 3rd year with TYM of Hung Nguyen. She is living with her husband and their youngest child who is in his last year of high school. Their first 4 children all has their own family or are currently working far away from home. Just like the majority of the people in this rural area, her main sources of earning are from the rice-paddy and cattle-breeding. Since joining TYM, Mrs. T. has always been able to repay the loan and gain some profit. The main reason for these success has always been her careful planning taking into account her ability and resources. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow another 450 USD to buy cows. Her family current income is about 130 USD per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T., 50 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 3 của Quỹ Tình thương khu vực Hưng Nguyên. Chị sống cùng chồng và người con út đang học năm cuối phổ thông. 4 người con đầu của chị T. đều đã có gia đình riêng hoặc đi làm xa. Cũng như phần lớn người dân nông thôn, công việc chính của chị là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay năm nào chị T. cũng thu được những khoản lợi nhuận từ vốn vay. Một trong những điều mang lại kết quả trên là chị thường lựa chọn những mức vốn phù hợp với khả năng hoàn trả của mình. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450USD mua bò về nuôi. Thu nhâp hàng tháng của gia đình là 130USD.

loans.use: Buy beeves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of different items

loans.name: Rose's Mamboleo Group

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and is a married woman with a 3-year-old child. Rose owns a small salon that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $62 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwajuma and Aisha, who sell clothing and food.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genera is a producer of milk. Her product is sold to the Delicia company (a company that makes icecream). She also farms a small plantation. She is married and her husband works in Argentina as a tailor. They have four children. They live in the Palomar community (two and a half hours from the city of La Paz).

The funds from the loan will be invested in purchasing a cow with the purpose of increasing the production of milk to generate a greater income.

This is her first credit throught Impro. The assessment conducted qualified her for the approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Genara es productora de leche de vaca, su producto es comercializado a la empresa Delicia (compañía productora de helados). Asimismo, se desenvuelve como pequeña agricultora de hortalizas, tiene un esposo el cual trabaja en la República de Argentina como costurero y unos cuatro hijos. Su domicilio es en la comunidad de Palomar (a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz). El monto del crédito será invertido en la compra de una vaca de mediana calidad, el propósito es incrementar su producción de leche y generar mayores ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Buth S., 30, grows rice and vegetable crops in Kampong Cham where she lives with her husband, Enn Yoeun, and their two young children. She typically makes US$ 1.20 each day, while her husband works as a firewood salesman, making US$ 2 each day. Their children are still dependent upon the family, as one is a student in the local school and the other is still too young to attend school.

Buth S. has asked for a loan of US$ 200 to expand her farm through the purchase of more vegetable seeds and fertilizer for her crops. She believes this will be an investment that allows her to increase her income through a greater harvest of her crops and a chance to improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her farm even further, through the purchase of more land, so that she can increase her amount of crops. A future land purchase would also be a great long-term investment, because the price of land in Cambodia has been rising rapidly lately.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Greetings from Gasabo in Rwanda! Beatrice is 37 years old, married with three children and one adopted child from the 1994 Genocide.

In  2002, Beatrice started a business selling bed sheets and covers with only $40 as her starting capital. Owing to her commitment and hard work, her capital has grown to $350, and she currently earns about $120 every month.  Beatrice is now requesting a loan of $375 to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Kosar M. Akram Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is the wife of M. Akram and lives in a city named Pakpattan, which is famous for its historical and pious places. Kosar Baji has been living in this city for the last 10 years. Kosar Baji completed her education to the 8th standard. She is the mother of five children: one son and four daughters. Her son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). All of her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Kosar Baji's husband drives a tractor for loading and earns a profit. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Kosar Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah and now she is applying for a loan to change the wheels on her husband's tractor.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. ZulaiK. Baji wants a loan to buy rice to resell. Nooran Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw. Hanifan Baji wants a loan to buy wheels for a tractor. Rani Baji wants a loan to buy a rope machine to make cots.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To change the wheels of a tractor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet O. is 35 years old and married with two children. She lives in Ajambadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells hair extensions called weavons and is also a hair stylist. She has been in this business since 1998.

Juliet has been the leader of a LAPO Microfinance lending group for the past three years. She needs a loan for $1200 to buy more weavons and other hair extensions to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Tété Célestine

texts.fr: Née le 25 Juillet 1983 à Hozin, un village situé dans le département de l'OUEME au sud-est du BENIN, dame H. Tété Célestine est mariée à Monsieur AGOUA Eusèbe (commerçant) et a à sa charge sept personnes dont Jeannot, Sylvie, Jacques et Roland sont ses enfants. Les trois autres personnes sont ses neveux. Elle vit avec son mari à Finangnon, un quartier de Cotonou. Elle est ambulante et vend aussi à son domicile il y a bientôt 5 ans des condiments. Elle s'approvisionne au marché Dantokpa, le plus grand marché de Cotonou. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa marge bénéficiaire, elle voudrait expérimenter la vente du riz et du maïs. Ainsi, ses clients pourront acheter le Kilogramme de riz ou de maïs qu'ils voudront.
texts.en:
Born on July 25, 1983 in Hozin, a village located in the Oueme Province in the south-east of Benin, Mrs. Tété H. is married to Mr. Eusèbe Agoua (merchant) and is responsible for 7 people, of whom Jeannot, Sylvie, Jacques and Roland are her children. The three other people are her nephews. She lives with her husband in Finangnon, a district of Cotonou.

Mrs. H. is an ambulant salesperson who has also been selling condiments out of her house for almost 5 years. She stocks up in the Dantokpa market, the biggest open-air market in Cotonou. With a view to boosting her business and raising her profit margin, she wants to try out selling rice and maize (corn). Thus, her customers will be able to buy a kilo of rice or of corn, as they choose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a 50-kg sack of rice, a 50-kg sack of maize, and half a basket of condiments

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
M. Malik is 48 years old and living with his wife and three children.  He has grown vegetables and wheat for more than 17 years, which he fertilizes and waters every morning.  

His small plots are close to his home, which helps him to care for them patiently.  This work takes all day, but because it is close to his home, it is not too difficult to care for them.  This pleases him because he has more time to spend with his family and his children.  The hard part is transporting the products into the cities because of the scarcity of buses that get to his community.  

Malik gets most of his enthusiasm and will to keep going from his family.  He will invest the money in the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer in order to increase his production and, therefore, his income.  With your help, Malik will get ahead.  He is counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing wheat and seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N. is a 40 years old businesswoman. She is married with six children, four of whom are working. This lady has been operating a bar and restaurant in Kyengera for over four years to date. She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing more beers, wines, and spirits. Her greatest dream is to own rental houses in one of the Kampala suburbs, a dream she hopes to achieve by saving some of the profit from the business.

loans.use: To purchase more beers, wines, and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Face

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Face M. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of 2 months and 10 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them.

Face M. has been running a shop since 2008. This client’s business is selling cloth such as vitambaa (fabric), vitenga (traditional African cloth with wax print) and kanga (wraps bearing a Swahili proverb). She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Face M. currently earns about US$ 185 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to add more fabrics. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Face thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for making clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a 49-year-old businesswoman. She is divorced with three kids who are in school. She sells students’ foam mattress and pillows. She obtains her supplies from the manufacturers and sells at retail prices. She wants to use the loan to buy more foam mattresses and pillows to increase her stock. Her dream is to expand her business to include additional stock like door mats, bedspreads, curtains, etc., to meet the needs of her customers and make increased income.

Christiana aspires to give her children the best education. She is a member of the community group called Miracle Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To procure students’ mattresses, pillows, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Married with two children who are currently in school, Doris T. is 26 years old. She sells food, such as eggs, maize and maize flour in the local market of Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana where she lives. She boils the eggs and sells them by the road side in the lorry station with pepper. She uses maize flour to prepare banku (corn paste) and kenkey (corn dumplings).

She started selling  several years ago and she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Doris is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future careers. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more maize to prepare maize flour and eggs to serve her customers. Doris belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hope to receive GH¢600 to improve business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more maize, eggs and cassava flour

loans.name: Hodonou Jacob

texts.fr:
Y. Hodonou Jacob est vers 1974 à Ganvié. Y. Hodonou Jacob est marié et père de trois enfants dont les deux premiers sont scolarisés. Y. Hodonou Jacob a commencé à aller à la pêche avec son père depuis qu'il était tout-petit. Aujourd'hui, c'est la même pêche qui nourrit Hodonou Jacob avec toute sa famille. Hodonou Jacob a déjà deux crédits avec ALIDé. Quand Hodonou Jacob compare le niveau actuel de son activité à sa situation initiale avant qu'il ne commence par bénéficier de prêt à ALIDé, Hodonou Jacob trouve qu'il y a une nette amélioration. Hodonou Jacob a pour but d'acheter de nouveaux filets. C'est pourquoi Hodonou Jacob sollicite un troisième crédit. Y. Hodonou Jacob aimerait pour cette cette année, ce doter de différents types de filets pour mieux  rentabiliser son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Hodonou Jacob Y. was born circa 1974 in Ganvié. He's married and the father of three children, out of which the two elder ones attend school. When he was a little boy, he started going fishing with his father. Today, his fishing business enables him to provide for himself and his entire family. Hodonou Jacob already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner Alidé. When Hodonou Jacob compares his current living standard with his situation before he obtained the loans, he sees a clear improvement. With this third loan, he plans to buy new fishnets. In the course of the year, he would like to buy various kinds of fishnets in order to make his business more profitable.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2.5 rolls of fishnets with all fishing accessories

loans.name: Saloma

texts.en:
Saloma M., 45, is married with four children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and to the public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately 120 USD).

Saloma has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Saloma’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy more tools and some garden spray to expand her plantation

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor  es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”, en el distrito de Mazo- Cruz, provincia del Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, ella es conviviente, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ya 03 años, su primer préstamo fue  de S/300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en su puesto de golosinas (chocolates, galletas, dulces).

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual incrementará su capital y comprará calzado en diferentes tallas y modelos.  Ella manifiesta que tiene su tienda en la ciudad de Tacna, trabaja solo a pedidos entrega en Puno y en Juliaca, su mayor deseo es abrir más mercado a nivel nacional.
