Manifiesta que le gusta mucholas reuniones de su Banco Comunal, donde también recibe capacitación en temas de género.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the "God is Love" Community Bank in the district of Mazo-Cruz, Collao provine, department of Puno, Peru. She is 32 years old, has one son, lives with her partner and has a high school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past three years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her snack stand. She is currently requesting a loan of 3000 soles to increase her capital and to purchase footwear in different styles and models. She says that she has her store in the city of Tacna and she works only with orders delivered from Puno and Juliaca. Her biggest wish is to reach a market on the national level. She adds that she really enjoys meetings with her community bank, where she receives training.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase footwear in different styles and models

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 8 hijos, vive en el Barrio Villa Esperanza y cuenta con estudios de 1er grado de primaria.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 años e inició su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para la venta de frutas y gaseosas.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de 1500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de frutas, gaseosas, mana (cereal) y así poder agrandar su negocio.
Su mayor deseo es tener su triciclo donde pueda exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Manuela Ramos Communal Bank located in the Mazocruz district found in the Callao province in the state of Puno. She is 57 years old, married and has eight children. She lives in Barrio Villa Esperanza and has a first grade education. Elena has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years and her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and allowed her to increase her capital in order to sell fruits and soft drinks. Now she requires a loan for 1,500 soles that will allow her to buy a larger quantity of fruits, soft drinks and cereal and in that way grow her business. Her biggest desire is to have a tricycle she can use to show her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Unelyn

texts.en:
Unelyn M. is from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin,Misamis Occidenta. She is 30 years old. Unelyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Unelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Unelyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Unelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Unelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Unelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Unelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Aminah's Group

texts.en:
N. Aminah has had a retail shop as her business for eight years. She is 29 years old and married with three children aged 10, 8, and 6 in primary 3, 2 and 1 respectively.

She had a challenge of lack of enough capital but, now that she can access loans, the problem is somewhat solved. She can use her loans to restock her shop with more products hence making more profits of about UGX 60,000 a week. She hopes her shop will grow much bigger so that she is able to buy her own house in the future. She needs a new loan to help restock her shop.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Transito Emérita

texts.es: Transito Emérita C. D. B. vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, Don Benjamín el esposo D. Transito trabaja como seguridad en una empresa privada y aporta a la familia 200$ mensuales; Transito posee una tienda en su casa donD. además D. vender productos D. consumo también comercializa ropa y zapatos, Transito solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y así aumentar su ganancias por medio D. que sus ventas crezcan con más variedad D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Transito Emérita C. D. B. lives in the district of Ahuachapan with her husband and three kids. Transito's husband, Don Benjamin, works as a security guard for a private sector firm and supports his family with $200 a month. Transito has a small shop in her house where, as well as selling groceries, she also sells clothes and shoes. Transito would like a loan to invest in her business and thereby increase her earnings as her sales will increase with a larger range of merchandise.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business/Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
56-year-old Norlinda J. is growing rice to support her children. She was previously a mid-wife. But because she is old for the job, she ventured to the rice farming business to help support the needs of her family. 

Currently she has a 4-hectare farm. However, she needs additional capital to manage it well. She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and chemicals.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides their clients like Norlinda with not just loans but education to run their business as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase containers for keeping milk and mineral food

loans.name: Seba

texts.en:
Seba is a member of the Idunda East borrower group in Kihesa,iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 18(twins) and 16 years.she also cares for other 3 dependents.

Seba started her own business selling local beer 12 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Seba`s first loan from BRAC_ Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Seba hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  more maize for  local beer

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a married woman with five strong and lovely children. All her children are in school in the community where they live. She is an achiever and works hard and earnestly to contribute to the family. She is a food vendor, selling rice and gravy stew by the roadside in the community where she lives. She has been in this business for the last four years.

It is important to Rebeca to help her husband provide for the family. With her help they are able to support the children in school, maintain their good health and pay the bills. Rebeca says the demand for her food is high, but she does not have enough money to increase her inventory in order to meet the demand.

She requests a loan to buy rice, spices, vegetables and other supplies. She takes delivery of goods from Dwinase, which is a nearby market where she can buy what she needs for her business. She would grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her stew

loans.name: Gelgi De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Gelgi V., de 43 años de edad, vive en el barrio campo bruce, tiene tres hijos, madre soltera, es una mujer que ha sobresalido con su negocio para ayudar  a sus hijos que estudien y sean personas de bien. Es costurera desde hace muchos años, hace vestido al estilo del cliente  y  ropa para vender, en estos últimos meses ha tenido pedido y por falta de tela, no ha producido lo que es, es por eso que con el crédito que esta solicitando, comprara telas bordados, botones, Ciper y otros para hacer los vestidos. Como sabanas, manteles, cortinas. Es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic y se siente contenta por que gracia al financiamiento que le ha dado ha logrado poder aumentar sus ventas, como aumentar la clientela por sus trabajos de costura.

loans.use: Comprar tela, bordados, botones, hilos y otros para producir la confeccion de sus vestidos

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 51 years old and married with three children. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers, and is determined to pull her business and family out of poverty. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kerosene to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Alihuseyn

texts.en: Alihuseyn lives in Baku city. He was born in 1987 and is single. Alihuseyn not only has a business selling computers, but he also repairs them. He has been in this business for two years. Now he is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn B. is from the village of San Isidro,  Talakag Bukidnon. She is 30 years old. Arlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. Arlyn runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita A. is from the village of Aurora. She is 28 years old. Angelita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Angelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Sophia is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, rice, beans, etc. She buys from nearby communities and treks to sell in nearby towns. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals for trade

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marlith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Marlith, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, es una mujer que poco a poco, fue incrementando su negocio y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes. Las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados. En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Vende sus productos de belleza de la línea Esika y se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,800.00, comprará productos de belleza para aumentar su stock como: perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos. 

Marlith, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Marlith is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martín. She is 35 years old, married, and has 3 dependent children.

Marlith sells cosmetics and is a woman who, little by little, has developed her business and made herself well-known by her customers. Her desire to get ahead has had good results, and she tells us that her business is currently doing very well. She sells Esika brand beauty products and is very satisfied with her work.

She will use this loan of 2,800 Peruvian nuevos soles to increase her stock of beauty products. These products will include perfumes, colognes, lotions, compact powders, lipsticks, and fingernail polishes. She will also purchase another case to display her merchandise.

Marlith provides a good example for other woman, as she has started her own business and persevered to achieve her dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and for helping other women grow into entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes D. is presently residing at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She is married, 43 years old, and a mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes raise pigs and sells them to the local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for about seven years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 per two months.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 10,000 from PMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She will use the loan for the purchase of feeds and vitamins for her piglets. This will be the third loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Her other future plan is for her children to finish their studies and hopefully establish their own careers.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: María Del Socorro

texts.es:
María del Socorro C. es mayor de edad, madre soltera de una niña de 5 años de edad, ella trabaja para la alcaldía municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 12 años donde se desempeña en el cargo de secretaria de dirección de obras públicas, pero además es Lic. En Español y se desempeña como docente los días sábados en la universidad UACH de Chinandega. 
Trabaja con Ceprodel desde hace 3 años y donde se le han otorgado 3 créditos, los cuales le han sido de mucha ayuda para hacer mejoras en su hogar y este ultimo que es para suplir gastos de medicina.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro C. is a single mother of a little girl who is 5 years of age. She has been working for Chichigalpa City Hall for 12 years, where she serves oas the Secretary for the Department of Public Works, but she is also licensed in Spanish, and serves as a teacher on Saturdays at the University of UACH in Chinandega. Maria has worked with Ceprodel for 3 years during which she has been granted three loans. These loans have been very helpful to her in making home improvements, and in meeting medical expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Realizar gastos personales.  Gastos médicos y compra de medicina.  (to help with personal and medical expenses)

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
K. Sareth, 35, sells brooms at the local market of Takeo province. On average, she makes around $3 each day.  Her husband stays at home and helps her make brooms to sell. They have been making and selling brooms since 2000. 

Brooms are made of long grass which grows in the forest. 

They have three children living at home to support.  K. Sareth told a loan officer that she needs to spend around $45 on food and $5 on utility each month.  K. is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to transport brooms to sell at the market.  This will help reduce their transportation expenses.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea B. has been working in the Ministry of the Interior since he was single. Besides this work, he also helps his wife sell a few groceries from home. From this, the family is able to make over $5 per day to solve the family’s financial crisis. This couple was married many years ago, but they don’t have a child.

Chea B. need a loan to repair and decorate his house that frequently has problems.

loans.use: To repair and decorate his house

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haydee S. de 60 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar en la universidad, lo cual llena de mucho orgullo y esperanza a Maria, ya que todos sus esfuerzos se ven reflejados en el bienestar de sus hijas las cuales se están forjando un futuro mejor. Maria posee una venta de ropa, la cual esta ubicada en el segundo nivel del mercado Sagrado Corazón, uno de los mercados con mayor afluencia de personas por estar ubicado en el centro de la capital salvadoreña. Desde hace 15 años que ella se dedica a este tipo de trabajo, razón por la cual cuenta con muchos clientes los cuales le hacen pedidos bastante grandes de ropa, para poder surtir negocios más pequeños como tiendas y otros. Es de esta manera como a través de los años Maria ha logrado sostener a sus dos hijas, las cuales han salido adelante gracias a los enormes esfuerzos de su madre, la cual siempre ha estado dispuesta  a sacrificarse por ellas. Con el deseo de poder mejorar su negocio, Maria solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el fin de poder surtir el negocio con faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa para niños y adultos en muchos estilos. Todo esto lo hace con la esperanza de mejorar las ventas lo cual le traiga consigo muchos beneficios tanto para ella como para sus hijas.
texts.en:
Maria Haydee S. is 60 years old and lives in Soyapango City, located in San Salvador department. She lives together with her 2 daughters, who are studying at university. This fills Maria with pride and hope, as all her hard efforts can be seen in the well-being of her daughters, who are forging a better future. Maria has a clothing sale business, which is located on the second floor of the Sagrado Corazón market, a market frequented by affluent people due to its location in the centre of the Salvadorean capital. Maria has worked doing this for 15 years. She has many clients who request a large amount of clothes, to stock smaller businesses such as shops and others. It is this way that through the years Maria has been able to support her daughters, who have been able to move forward thanks to the enormous efforts of their mother, who has always sacrificed herself for them. With the wish of improving her business, Maria is seeking a loan from Integral, to be able to stock her shop with skirts, blouses, trousers, and children's and adult's clothing in many styles. Maria does all this in the hope of generating better sales, which bring as many benefits for her as they do to her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantity of clothes

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios owns and operates a business buying and selling chickens in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a week. In 2007, she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Remedios is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. Having this loan will provide a chance to reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, a good life and the financial means to support her family and fund her grandchildren's college education.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La  Señora. MERCEDES G. Labora como Conserje en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El  tiene cuatro hijo a su cargo, y estos se  encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos y perlines para el techo de su casa ya que viene la temporada de lluvia.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
La Señora. MERCEDES G. Labora como Conserje en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. El tiene cuatro hijo a su cargo, y estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos y perlines para el techo de su casa ya que viene la temporada de lluvia. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Yoni

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. YONNY,  ella tiene 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 18 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella vende ropa de forma ambulatoria, y también vende muebles en la plaza tupac amaru todos los sábados ella tiene un pequeño stand en el cual exhibe sus muebles todos los sábados y también hace a pedidos, muebles de sala comedor y de oficina. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el material de trabajo para la fabricación de muebles.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yonny belongs to the communal bank "Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II." She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. Yonny, who is 39, is married and has a son who is 18 years old. She alternates her activities in the home with her retail business. She sells clothing in the street, and also sells furniture in the Tupac Amaru plaza every Saturday. She has a small stand where she displays her furniture each Saturday, and she also takes orders for living room, dining room and office furniture. She requests a loan to invest in raw materials to product furniture. She appreciates and values the support provided through these means, and pledges to fulfill her payment obligations in accordance with the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in materials used to make furniture

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
In his late 50's, it's hard to imagine that N. Victor, who has been running an agricultural enterprise for over fifteen years, is still at his best and proving to fellow businessmen that he can make it. 

Having been a professional teacher for quite some time, Victor got a vision to start up a banana-selling business as his side-income enterprise. His main drawback is harvesting poor qualities and therefore, with this loan, he will be able to purchase mulches and manure for his plantation. This will make it possible for him to earn more revenue and cater for his family's needs from the sale of high-quality produce.

loans.use: To buy mulches and manure for his plantation

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly,  de 29 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos queridos hijos, Junior de 11 y Noelia de 6 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Nelly ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos. Todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano a regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de café. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual ha logrado poner con mucho esfuerzo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo préstamo de Nelly con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá tanto en sus cafetales, comprando fertilizantes y en abastecer su bodega con diversos productos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old. She is a single mother, who is responsible and very hardworking. She lives in her own house with her two children - Junior (11) and Noelia (6) - to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. She gets up very early every morning to water and look after her coffee plants. She also has a shop, which she succeeded in opening through considerable effort. What she likes most about her job is working for herself on her own land. She has been growing crops for ten years. What she finds most difficult is working the land. In time, she would like to purchase more land and increase the amount she grows. This is the second loan Nelly has requested from MFP. She knows the loan will help her alot in developing her business and, for this reason, is committed to making all her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal group, which cares for her greatly. The two thousand soles that she has requested will be invested in looking after her coffee plants, buying fertilisers and stocking her shop with various products.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers for her coffee plants and products for her shop

loans.name: Shalom 2 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group 'Shalom', and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally--many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Dominga is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling yucca (a potato-like root that is a Dominican staple) and plantains by purchasing more of both. She will use the profit to purchase notebooks for her children and to cover basic necessities. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: yucca and plantains for resale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem P., 55, is a widowed farmer who lives with one of her married children in Takeo province. Besides farming, she also sell vegetables and rice at the local market. She typically makes about $5 each day and would like to increase her profits. 

The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sem P. included. She is asking for a loan of $500 to reinvest in her vegetable stand.

loans.use: Reinvest in her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20211020035) is a 23 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 6 member group, which has requested a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

T. is married and has one infant-aged child. To making a living, T. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will also be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị Huê (0) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

2. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

4. Nghiêm Thị O. (0) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Nguyễn Thị (20211020035) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của C. việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các dO. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện C. việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị Huê (0) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Nguyễn Thị Ánh (0) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành C. việc kinh dO. chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5. Nghiêm Thị O. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành C. việc kinh dO. may mặc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ C. các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Pora, se conformó en fecha mayo de 2.006, en Hohenau y se encuentran trabajando dentro del  15 ciclo, con 15 integrantes. 

Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo, al comercio, manualidades, modista, entre otros. 
El comité es uno de los más antiguos de la oficina, por lo que ya tienen desarrollado el espíritu solidario entre las compañeras, además de destacarse por el orden en sus finanzas internas. 
Son disciplinadas con el pago, ya que pagan puntualmente sus créditos en todos los ciclos. 

Otra característica de las integrantes es que, son consientes a la hora de solicitar el préstamo y eso va acompañado con la conducta de pago, es decir, que no por tener una línea alta de crédito, retiran el máximo monto, sino, que solicitan el monto cuya cuota van a poder cubrir con sus actividades correspondientes. 

La Sra. Jacinta C. tiene 45 años de edad, es modista y su marido Esteban Florentin (sastre) tienen 3 hijos.

Doña Jacinta tiene un objetivo principal: Ayudar a su hija a terminar sus estudios universitarios, ya que actualmente está estudiando Licenciatura en Contabilidad.
La intención de sus padres es que, gracias al sacrificio que están realizando al solventar a su hija universitaria, el día de mañana ella cubra los estudios de su hermana menor que esta en 8vo grado.

Desean incrementar sus ingresos para adquirir  materiales para ampliar el negocio mediante la fabricación de más variedades de prendas de vestir, teniendo en cuenta la clientela formada y la demanda que posee.
texts.en:
This Committee of Women is called Kuña Pora and was established in May 2006 in Hohenau. The group is working in its 15th loan cycle with 15 members.

These ladies engage in different businesses such as retail, handicrafts, dressmaking, and other activities. This committee is one of the oldest at its branch office. A spirit of solidarity has already developed among its members and the group has succeeded in keeping its internal finances in order. The members are disciplined with their payments and have always paid on time in each of their loan cycles.

Another characteristic of the members is that they are always conscientious when requesting their loans, and as a result they adjust their payment behavior accordingly. Since they do not have a large line of credit, they always request the maximum amount because they claim it will help cover their corresponding business activities.

Sra. Jacinta C. is 45 years old and works as a seamstress. Her husband Esteban Florentin works as a tailor. They have three children.

Doña Jacinta has one main objective – to help her daughter finish her university studies. She is currently earning her degree in Accounting. Being a parent, Jacinta intends to make sacrifices in order to cover her daughter’s education. In the future, she plans to cover the studies of her other daughter who is in eighth grade.

Jacinta wants to increase her income by acquiring materials to expand her business. She plans to produce more varieties of clothing based on the size of her customer base and the level of demand that exists.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Vii

texts.en:
Vii T. is 74 and married with 10 children. She owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. Vii has four years of experience in this business  and  needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

Vii joined SPBD in 2008 and this is her third loan. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou N. lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a good housewife stays at home and takes care her children. Her husband has a business operating a moto-taxi, and he is able to make about $7 US in revenue each day. This couple has three children; one is in school, while the other two are too young to attend. Bou N. is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband's moto-taxi business.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike with trailer for use as a taxi

loans.name: Uvumilivu Group

texts.en:
Judith G. is in her late twenties and is married with two children, aged seven and three. Judith has been operating her own hair and beauty salon for the past three years. The salon is open between 7:30 am and 9 pm daily and earns Judith a good monthly profit. 

This will be Judith's 3rd Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. 

Judith used her previous loans to expand her salon, loans which she has successfully repaid. She will use the new loan to buy another steaming machine and another dryer. Judith's dream is to expand her business to also include a large CD and DVD library. 

Judith will share this loan with her loan group, Uvumilivu, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for paying back the loans. 

In the picture, Judith is seen in the front row, second from right.

loans.use: To buy a steam machine and a dryer

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel M. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. He is 40 years old. Noel is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Noel owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies with a specialty in chicken "siopao" (steamed buns) in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Zuura

texts.en:
Zuura K. is a 64-year-old pensioner with six children. She lives in the village of Kara-Too, in the north of Kyrgyzstan.

For 30 years, Zuura worked as a school teacher in a nearby area. As a teacher, she was characterized by her colleagues as a very positive and open-hearted person. Currently, her pension is too low to support her family, which is why Zuura began to breed livestock. She began her business using a small amount of capital (600 KGS) and, over time, managed to generate a profit of 2,500 KGS per month. Zuura was able to establish a farm, which is in need of development. For this reason, Zuura is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS ($1,300) because she would like to buy two cows. With the expected revenues generated as a result of the loan, she plans to expand her business.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the area's especially vulnerable population of people. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas, which in turn leads to increased employment and meets the needs of its clients and lenders.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol N. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Mirasol is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mirasol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mirasol from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a hardworking lady, age 30, married with three children ages 10, 5 and 2 years old. She has been selling secondhand shoes for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Mary learned about KADET through a marketing awareness campaign and she is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to purchase more shoes to sell during the festive season. She has no history with any other MFI and she believes that, with this loan, her business will pick up well. Mary hopes to grow her business and become the leading local investor in Eldoret, Kenya. She wants to see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector San Pedro de Sasape del distrito de Illimo,una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, la localidad está situada a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora (una bebida típica del país que se prepara desde épocas remotas en base a un tipo especial de harina de maíz), ella prepara esta bebida en su domicilio y la ofrece en venta en su domicilio. El negocio tiene buena acogida ya que estas bebidas son bastante consumidas en la zona, sobretodo en diversas celebraciones y festividades. Además los trabajadores de su localidad tienen por costumbre consumir chicha antes de iniciar sus actividades ya que creen que la bebida les ofrece energía y vigor. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Francisca desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más insumos para seguir preparando Chicha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and one of their children in the San Pedro de Sasape sector of the district of Illimo, an agricultural region located in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

Her business is to make and sells 'chicha de jora', a national drink that has been enjoyed from age of old, made from a special corn flour. She prepares the drink in her home but she also sells from her home. The business counts on a good client base especially because this type of drink is very sought out in the region, especially during festivities and celebrations. 

The workers in the neighborhood are accustomed to start their day with a drink of chicha because they believe the drink gives them more energy. Aside from this, she also raises and sells livestock. The profits that she earns from her businesses help her to contribute with her husband to the family's finances. 

Francisca wishes to expand her business by acquiring more ingredients needed to prepare chicha. She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles which will help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make chicha.

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Urtnasan

texts.en:
Urtnasan B. is a very hard working woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 21, attends university. Urtnasan operates a clothes making business with help of her husband. She started her business in 2002 by renting equipments to make a variety of uniforms out of her home. After many years of successful operation, she was able to expand her business by purchasing 4 sewing machines and 2 zig zag machines for her sewing business. Her business earnings have enabled her to move her own workplace where she produces a variety of clothing items for her customers. 

Today her working capital exceeds a 1,000,000 MNT and her net profit is approximately 800,000 MNT. Urtnasan is a very open minded and hardworking man and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment and tools for her clothes producing business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment and tools

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Noemy, ella tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos, cuatro ya son  mayores de edad y el menor tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio, solo la última hija vive con ella y una nieta que esta pequeñita que es como su hija. Su esposo es comerciante.

Se dedica junto a su esposo a la venta de mariscos, su forma de venta es ir bien en la mañana hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego transportarlo en su carro a otras ciudades y campos hasta donde llevan a vender sus productos, ellos entregan al por mayor y también al menudeo, trabajan cuatro días a la semana durante cinco a seis horas al día o hasta que se termine lo que compraron.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón y otras variedades de mariscos para llevar a sus clientes lo mejor. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos en relación a otras instituciones de crédito. Sus sueños son tener otro carro en mejor estado.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Community Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

In this place we meet Noemy. She is 48 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has five children, four of whom are grown, and the youngest is 15 years old and goes to school. Only the youngest daughter lives with her, as well as a granddaughter who is little and is like a daughter. Her husband is a merchant.

She works with her husband selling shellfish. The business method is to go out early in the morning to the beaches to buy the best fish and later take them by car to other cities and towns where they sell their their products. They make deliveries mostly, and also sell retail. They work four days a week for five or six hours a day or until they finish selling what they bought.

This loan is to purchase fish, shrimp, and other varieties of shellfish to give their customers the best. She is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the interest rates are very low compared to other credit organizations. Her dream is to have another car that is in better condition.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and more shellfish

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: SOLICITANTE TIENE 24 AÑOS ES SOLTERO VIE EN CASA FAMILIAR DE SU MAMA ACTUALMENTE ESTA ESTUDIANDO LA CARRERA DE ABOGADO POR LAS NOCHES Y SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE DURANTE EL DIA NO TIENE EXPERIENCIA CREDITICIA CUENTA CON REGULAR ACUMULACION DE BIENES Y BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA INVERTIRLO EN GASTOS PERSONALES EN SU VIVIENDA YA QUE DESEA ACONDICIONAR SU CUARTO EN LA SEGUNDA PLANTA DE SU CASA SE LE PROPONE CREDITO POR CONTAR CON CAPACIDAD Y VOLUNTAD DE PAGO
texts.en: This loan applicant is 24 years old and single.  He lives with his mother and is currently studying at night to become a lawyer.  He operates a taxi service during the day but has no credit history.  He has an income and good character references.  He is requesting the loan to cover personal expenses and to make home improvements.  He plans to renovate his upstairs bedroom.  He is being proposed for a loan because of ability and committment to paying it back on time.

loans.use: For personal expenses

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 29 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 5 years old. His business is well organized and is open from 6 am until 9 pm every day. He employs two people to help him. He has two years' experience.

Theoneste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sugar, rice, and bread. With this loan, Theoneste will expand his business by buying more producst to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, rice, and bread

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Doña Ana D. 53 años D. edad, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, se dedica a vender comida y pupusas, vive con sus dos hijos Milton D. 24 años y su hija Idalia D. 17 años D. edad, también un nieto D. 5 años. Doña Ana tiene el puesto D. venta en el mercado municipal, lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana y su hija le ayuda a atender a los clientes.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar una plancha para hacer pupusas y materiales para preparar los alimentos que venD.. Con la compra D. esta herramienta ella pueD. darle salida a una mayor cantidad D. producción, desarrollándose en el negocio y abarcando a más personas.
Su objetivo es continuar innovando en el negocio, atraer nuevos clientes y ofrecer un mejor futuro a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 and lives in San Francisco Gotera with her two children, Milton, 24 and Idalia, 17 and a 5-year old grandson.  Ana sells prepared food and pupusas (thick cornmeal stuffed with cheese, pork, or beans) in a stand in the municipal market.  She works there daily, along with her daughter who helps her with the customers.
She is requesting a loan to buy a griddle to make the pupusas, and ingredients for the food that she sells.  With the purchase of this griddle, she will be able to increase the quantity of food, develop her business and handle more people.
Her goal is to continue innovations with her business, to attract new customers and to offer her children and grandchildren a better future.

loans.use: To buy a griddle to make pupusas (thick cornmeal stuffed with cheese, pork, or beans)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of plastic products for retail

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee B. is from the village of Taguanao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Imee is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Imee owns & operates a business offering tricycle transport services. Imee has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Imee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Imee is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Imee from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Dilcia Jackeline

texts.es:
la joven Dilcia Jackeline M. P. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la colonia 27 de mayo de el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de pollo frito con chismol y tortillas. Dilcia es una joven emprendedora  y su negocio esta ubicado en la plaza civica de el Triunfo.
Dilcia es soltera pero muy dedicada a su negocio,  cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana para la preparacion del pollo, muchas personas la prefieren ya que le da un buen sabor al pollo.
Dilcia vive en la casa de sus padres que tambien le acompañan en su negocio.
Dilcia aporta economicamente para cubrir los gastos de la casa de sus padres.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica  para visitar la iglesia.
su sueño es tener una familia bonita y con hijos sanos.
texts.en:
Young Dilcia Jackeline M. P. is 25 years old. She lives in the 27 de Mayo neighborhood of El Triunfo in Choluteca. She works selling fried chicken with chismol (an Honduran salsa) and tortillas. 
Dilcia is an enterprising young woman. Her business is located in El Triunfo’s civic square.
Dilcia is single but very dedicated to her business. Her sister helps her prepare her chicken. Many people prefer her food because her chicken has a good flavor.
Dilcia lives in her parents’ house. They also help her with her business.
Dilcia contributes money to help cover the expenses in her parents’ home.
In her free time she goes to church.
Her dream is to have a happy family with healthy children.

loans.use: To buy chicken, lard, cabbage, tomatoes, green chile, onions, garlic, salt, lemon, tortillas, soft drinks, disposable plates, and bags.

loans.name: Olger Augusto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Olger; es casado; la socia tiene 70 años de edad; la socia tiene 5 hijos el socio alterna sus diferentes actividades, el socio tiene terrenos de cultivo y en los cuales el siembra maíz, papa, el luego vende el choclo al por mayor, el socio también se dedica a críar animales y tiene ganados vacas lecheras, el socio invierte en la alimentación y vitaminas de los mismos para obtener mejor resultado en cuanto a la producción de leche de vaca, el socio vende la leche de vaca al por mayor a una entidad llamada el “Prona”, ellos dan leche a los comedores escolares nacionales; el socio desea invertir el crédito en la compra de semillas para una nueva temporada de siembra de maíz y papa. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para sembrar maíz y papa.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Olger is a member of the Communal Bank “Ollantay de Wayracpuncu” which is located in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 70 years old, married, and has five children. Olger divides his time among various activities. He has land on which he grows corn and potatoes. The corn kernels are eventually sold in bulk. He also raises animals and has dairy cows. Olger invests in feed and vitamins for his cows in order to obtain good results with the milk they produce. He sells the milk in bulk to an entity called “Prona” which distributes it to school cafeterias all over the country. Olger wants to invest this loan in the purchase of seeds for a new season of planting corn and potatoes. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy the seeds for planting these crops.

He is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting corn and potatoes.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 51 years old and married with 6 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has been running an office and school supplies business for 4 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading.

Ma. Lourdes has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. Ma. Lourdes hopes to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky sells sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions. She is 40 years old, married and has 6 children. Vicky took out a loan to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice and onions to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina Cheah, who was born in 1951, is married to Mr. Zachus Ashi and blessed with six children, all over the age of 15. They live in a 2-room apartment in the Tumuku quarter of the Belo subdivision in Cameroon. In 2009, hardship and tough times led Regina to become a member of GHAPE. She got her first loan of 50,000 XAF and embarked on the buying and selling of goats, earning enough to move on with life.

Regina is requesting her second loan in order to buy goats for 60,000 XAF, beans for 20,000 XAF and to pay workers on her farm 20,000 XAF. She knows she is going to succeed because she has been keeping goats for a long time and had been farming long before she got to GHAPE. Her trade is actually helping the community since she offers door-to-door service. Regina has faced challenges in life when her daughter had an accident and was hospitalized and when one of her son's hands was cut off. The profit from Regina's loan will be used to take care of her and her children's health and to invest in her agriculture. Regina prefers GHAPE because she can repay in bits.
  
About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Yan, 31, is a homemaker who stays at home to care for her kid and does her daily routine as well. Her husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a policeman and makes a profit of about $6 a day to use for family’s needs. Recently, the family had a problem with their living conditions as their house is getting old and it needs to be repaired but they don’t have sufficient money to do the work. Therefore, Yan has decided to apply for a Kiva loan in an amount of $1,200 to be used to repair her old house.

loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya, 27, has been a hair dresser for 10 years and always works hard to improve her business by purchasing products with special offers most of the time and providing her customers, who are relatives, neighbors, and friends, with car service. Inaya works from her house because she couldn't afford shop rent when she began this enterprise; since that time, customers have gotten used to and enjoy visiting her at home, so she has kept the business there.

Inaya is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva in order to do necessary painting in her business-home and increase her beauty cosmetics capital. She will also help her fiance in their wedding expenses. An honest woman who provides good customer service, Inaya hopes to expand her business and continue providing beauty services to her customers.

loans.use: to do  decorations necessary for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells candies, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods and more beverages to sell. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase calves to raise for resale.

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUDEGBE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Juliette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliette est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Abel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Juliette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Juliette vend du pain sucré depuis six ans environs.  Juliette s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Juliette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDEGBE, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group JESUDEGBE is comprised of four persons who are all in the same district. The group’s representative, by the name of Juliette, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and is married to a merchant by the name of Abel, and they have four children, who are all in their care. Some of the children are attending school. The children live together with their parents.

Juliette never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has been selling sugared breads for about six years. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the others in her group JESUDEGBE are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have both been repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets of bread

loans.name: Tuvshintungalag

texts.en: Tuvshintungalag is 23 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her husband transports goods in the countryside and also brings goods from China. Her family just moved into a new ger. She started selling clothes after her sister provided her with start-up goods and money in 2009. She sells clothes at Baldanzasag market. Her husband supports and helps her business. She is planning to expand her business. Her family bought a 3.5 million MNT new car which eventually will be a taxi for her husband. She is a diligent woman who says "I want to expand my business and increase my family income with my new car and my business." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts for the car and buy clothes from China.

loans.use: To buy clothes from China

loans.name: Swasembada Group

texts.en: Riana is 33 years old. She is pictured in the middle of the photo. She is married with one child. For the past 7 years she has been selling coconuts in front of her house to help provide more income for her family. She wants to now start selling children's clothing as a second business and she will use the loan for this. She hopes that, with this loan, she can have her own children's clothing store. She also hopes that over time her business will grow and that some day her family will have enough savings to go on a pilgrimage to Mecca(Hajj).

loans.use: to pay for children's clothes to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her bazaar.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Fatima provides habal-habal (motorcycle) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 2 years. Fatima has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and gasoline for motorcycle maintenance. Fatima is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 45 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells second hand clothes. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of second hand clothes from the market, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and provide for his family. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to continue to work with BRAC and Kiva to expand his business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Rufina has a retail shop that sells wood charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed in making charcoal.

Rufina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rufina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making charcoal.

loans.name: Marlin Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlin del Socorro su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, desde hace más de 6 años que tiene esta actividad. Ella tiene 2 hijos de los cuales solamente 1 está bajo su cargo. El reto de Marlin de vender sus productos cada día para ofrecerle a su familia el pan de cada día es muy difícil pero ella no se desanima a seguir luchando. Es por eso que realiza este crédito para la compra de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts, camisetas y algunas tallas de prendas de vestir extra grande que algunos clientes le solicitan.
texts.en: Marlin del Socorro has sold used clothing for six years. She has two children, of whom only one is under her care. Marlin's challenge is to sell her products every day in order to provide her family's daily bread. This is very difficult, but she is not discouraged and keeps fighting. For this reason, she is taking out a loan for the purchase of pants, skirts, dresses, suits, shorts, shirts, and some extra-large items which some of her customers request.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, dresses, dresses, shorts, and shirts.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosalinda comenta que como tiene que caminar largas distancias diariamente para ir a comprar los artículos que necesita para surtir su negocio de comida. Para Ella ya es muy necesario un carro y así poder realizar estas tareas diarias sin ningún problema.
Este negocio de venta de comida lo tiene desde hace cinco años, su esposo trabaja de auxiliar de un taller mecánico y entre los dos solventan los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosalinda says that she has to walk long distances every day to go and buy the items that she needs to stock her food business.  She very much needs a car so that she can carry out these daily tasks without problems.

Rosalinda has had her food sales business for five years.  Her husband works as an assistant in an auto repair shop and, between the two of them, they cover their family expenses and the education expenses of their son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a car to use in her business

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa de su padre que es teniente gobernador de la comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Y cuenta con luz eléctrica.

María se dedica a la crianza de ovinos como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado ovino y 15 cabras. Esta actividad la realiza junto a su familia, con quienes se apoyan mutuamente. También se dedica a la venta por catálogo de productos de belleza. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María desea mejorar los corrales que posee con la compra de javas y mallas. Asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado, todo esto con la finalidad de mejorar la crianza de sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer responsable y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y de ese modo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 32 year old, single mother of 1 child. She lives in the home of her father, who is lieutenant governor of the community located in the district of Tambogrande, belonging to the Piura Region, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque. And it has electricity.

María raises sheep as her main activity as she has 6 sheep and 15 goats. She does this activity along with her family, who are mutually supportive. She also sells a catalog of beauty products. With this activity, she helps support her family financially.

María wants to improve the pens she owns with the purchase of java and mesh. She also wants to buy feed, all with the goal of improving the breeding of animals and higher income for her sales. She has therefore been seen as fit to request a loan of 800 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa with which she plans to achieve her goal.

María is a responsible woman and like the work she does. Her desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur and thereby improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Emelita has a habal-habal (a motorcycle to transport people), which is driven by her husband. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

Emelita became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Emelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish  is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Irish  is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy tools & gasoline for the services.

Irish  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Irish hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has two children. Josephine is a food vendor; a business she started three years with her savings. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk.

The main challenges Josephine faces are the customers not paying on time and the high inflation. Despite all this, she looks forward to opening a hotel. The extra income from the loan will help educate Josephine’s children.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk.

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es: Bismarck Antonio se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad desde hace 9 años, el ha sido un hombre  trabajador, responsable que le encanta el progreso, poco a poco a mejorado sus condiciones de vida y de su familia, en sus dias libre aprovecha su tiempo cultivando la tierra , sembrando raices y tuberculos y asi obtener un ingreso mas para ayudar a su familia.
