Solicita su  crèdito para comprar bloques y asi poco a poco ir mejorando su vivienda ubicada en la colonia Naciones. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, gozar de salud y estabilidad laboral
texts.en: Bismarck has been working as a Security Guard for 9 years. He is a responsible and hardworking man who loves progressing and who has been improving his family’s standard of living as well as his own, doing so a little by little. He takes advantage of his free time to till the land, sowing roots and tubers in order to gain some extra money to help his family. He is requesting a loan to buy blocks in order to keep on making improvements to his house, located in the Naciones neighborhood. He dreams of improving the infrastructure of his house, and of enjoying good health and working stability.

loans.use: To buy blocks.

loans.name: Felicita's Group

texts.en:
Felicita has nine children, Donaldo has two and Jenaro has four. They all live in the outskirts of El Paraíso in Santa María Tiltepec in the State of Oaxaca in Mexico. Eventhough their community has just installed electricity access, their homes are too far away from the electricity posts and they continue to rely on candles during the night to carry out their work activities, studies and domestic chores. 

In Jenaro’s words: “Candles cost us 50 pesos (4 USD) each month and do not allow my children to study well”. Jenaro is 38 years old and has a small space in his home where he works as a carpenter during the day. At 6 p.m. he must stop working because he cannot see well anymore. A loan for a solar home system will not only provide better studying conditions for his children, it will allow him to have 4 additional hours of quality lighting to work, have more income in times of the year with more demand, and allow him to charge his mobile phone in order to communicate with his clients.

loans.use: Jenaro, Felícita and Donaldo to each purchase a solar system for their homes and carpentry shops to stop relying on candles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de medicina, pago de consultas médicas, pasajes.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José is 65 years old. He is married and has 4 children. He lives in Tambogrande Piura, Perú and grows organic mangoes.
Jose needs US$ 1000 as loan for fertilizing his fields and increasing his organic mango production. With the additional income, he will improve his family’s house.

loans.use: for manuring the fields and increase the organic mango production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Silvia would like to buy hair weaves, wigs,barids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Fonofili

texts.en: Fonofili T. of Tufuiopa is the one of the oldest members of the center. She is married with seven children. She sells handicrafts such as fine mats, kava, Samoan bags and some general goods (clothes, perfumes, shoes) at her flea market stall. Fonofili earns $250.00-$300.00 from her sales for the day but she opens five days a week. She was the one who started the center at the village of Tufuiopa in 2004. This is her sixth loan, which tells you how well she is doing with her business and that her trust and faith in the program have increased tremendously. When she received a $1750.00 loan, she used it to purchase other accessories for her business and to fix the family car that she uses every day to deliver her goods to the market.

loans.use: To purchase 10 Samoan bags.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of four, with three undergoing their ‘O’ levels, and one in primary school. She started her business in 1997 with capital from her brothers’ contributions. Her business is located at the border, thus her customers are mostly people from across the border. Her business is doing well and has enabled her to educate her children.

Agnes has been happy with her first loan. She was able to beef up her shop with things that she didn't have, yet they are in demand. Agnes has cleared her first loan and intends to get a relatively larger loan, so that she may expand her business further. She would like to borrow $300 more from People Microcredit Investment Bureau to increase the inventory in her shop.

loans.use: Boost the shop inventory

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino V. started working as a mechanic at age 16 helping others in their auto repair shops. By 24 years old, after attending a vocational school, he started his own mechanic shop. 

Albino is now 32 years old, a husband and a father of three daughters, age 12, 10, and 5. His wife stays at home to watch over their children. He works six days a week from Monday to Saturday. His hours are usually from 7 am to 6 pm. However, some nights he works as late as 11 pm. 

Albino has many clients that seek his service. He needs a loan of US$300 to buy more equipment to fix cars.

loans.use: Purchase equipment to fix cars.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en: Tamam A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Fizuli region. She settled with her family in Baku city in 1993. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. She began her business with $400 loan from Normicro in 2002 and rented the place to use as bathroom for IDPs. The second time she borrowed $600 and she used it to buy bathroom tile and other equipment and did some renovation. The loans were paid back timely. Now, Tamam would like to receive $800 loan to buy a water pump for the bathroom. She thinks that this investment will increase her business turnover which eventually help her to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: I am Kalsoom B. from Lahore, a large metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of six: two daughters and four sons. I have been sewing clothes on order from my neighborhood clientele for the last ten years. My husband is a rickshaw driver. He used to drive a rented rickshaw, but last year he bought a rickshaw with the loan we took from Asasah, a microfinance institution. The income rose significantly and we repaid the installments on time. I also managed to send my younger kids to school. Now my eldest son has also learned how to drive a rickshaw, and he wants to help us with our daily household expenses. Please lend me US$500 to buy my son a rickshaw. I will repay your loan on time with due responsibility.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: My name is Kaneez B.. I am married and a mother of two children. I live with my family in Lahore, a big metropolis. I am a textile designer and I embroider clothes, whereas my husband is a livestock dealer. My son is very enterprising and he operates a used clothing business. He now wants to operate at a bit bigger scale and buy these used clothes in bulk. For this purpose we require a loan of $350.

loans.use: Expand used clothing business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en: Mariam, the Group Leader, is married with four children. She works in a beauty salon. With the extra profits from the business, she intends to pay school fees for the children and build a house.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Ljeposava

texts.en:
Ljeposava is 40 years old woman and she is not married. She lives in the small town of Derventa with her 10 year old child who goes to primary school. She owns a flower- shop, but she does not have her own place 
(She rents a place for the flower shop).  She intends to use her loan in the amount of $775 for purchasing goods for the shop.  Her wish is to improve offerings in her flower shop. Ljeposava hopes that she will increase her income and secure a good future for her son.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for the shop.

loans.name: Bhyanti

texts.en:
Bhyanti M. is a 55-year-old widow living in Thecho, Lalitpur son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. Her husband, Ram M., died four years ago.

Bhyanti's daughter-in-law works in a garment factory and her grandchild is in primary school. Bhyanti and her son make different types of traditional icons. They have five years of experience, and make the icons according to the orders they receive.

Bhyanti is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials like wax and metal. In Nepal the cost of education is very high, and Bhyanti is planning on saving her income for her grandchild’s education.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her work

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mr. Dy S., 61, and his wife, Ouk Chea, 60, are farmers in Thmor Village, Kampong Cham Province, where they grow mushrooms. They both earn about $10 per day and have five children, two married and three single. One is a grocer in Siem Reap, while another is a motorbike taxi driver. The other three children are students. 

Mr. S. seeks a $1,100 loan to expand his mushroom growing business. He hopes this investment will improve his family’s financial stability and pay for his children’s education. S., Chea, and their child are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To expand his mushroom growing business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 25-year-old Lucy A.. She is single and has 2 children aged 3 and 8. She also has 2 dependents. In 2000 Lucy established a poultry business, selling eggs. Lucy requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of eggs in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of eggs in bulk for resale

loans.name: Martires

texts.es:
Martires C. is a native of the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega. His principal economic activity is in the livestock and agricultural sector. He is the father of two children, and his duty is to offer them the education they deserve being that they are still minors.

Today, Martires has a cattle ranch in his home where he houses his animals for their development. To improve the condition of his business, he has begun the remodeling of this area with the goal of having his livestock develop with no problems. To do this, he has turned to Ceprodel for support in obtaining a loan that will enable him to purchase barbed wire to enclose his ranch and have better conditions for his livestock. This loan will benefit him as much as his family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Martires C. es originario del municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su actividad económica es el sector agropecuario. Es padre de dos hijos cuyo deber es brindarle los estudios que estos se merecen por ser menores de edad.

Hoy en día el señor Martires C. posee un potrero en su casa de habitación donde aloja a sus animales para su desarrollo. Para mejorar las condiciones de su actividad ha iniciado a remodelar esta área con el propósito de que sus animales alcancen sin ningún problema. Para ello ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de alambre para rodear la cerca y tener mejores condicione para su ganado. Con este crédito es beneficiado tanto él como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase barbed wire to place around his cattle ranch.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothy U., 40, and her husband, Mr. Yong Aum,45, live on an Island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, and have been married for twenty years. They have seven children: three sons and four daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Two of her children are in school and two other children weave silk at home.

Mrs. Sothy has been a silk weaver since she was fourteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother, while Mr. Yong does farming and raises cows. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Sothy is requesting a loan of US600 to purchase silk material to continue her family’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Nassab

texts.en: Nassab is 57 years old, married with two children, and lives in a small village located in the suburbs of Aley. She is a seamstress and also sells clothes. Her enthusiasm and willpower have helped her business grow every day. She now needs $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine. This is the second time that Nassab has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida bjai is the wife of M. S. and lives in an area named Yadgar (a famous historical place) in Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in Yadgar for the last 4 years. She has five children: three girls and two boys. Her elder son is married. Her younger son has a milk shop where he sells milk from his own buffaloes. Her daughters completed their education until the 10th standard. Now they are in an age of marriage.

Zahida baji's husband sells plastic utensils in different areas of Lahore. Zahida baji has a livestock business. She takes care of her buffaloes as if they were her own children. She gets up early in the morning to milk them and to give them food. Her monthly income is $394. Zahida baji is very happy because last week one of her buffalo gave birth to a calf. She is applying for a loan to expand her livestock business and to expand her son's milk business.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo to expand milk production

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo Y. is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells provisions and ogogoro (local gin) in her shop along Igbelerin in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Iyabo is a LAPO Microfinance client. She is requesting a loan for $700 to buy more provisions to sell. She thanks all the Kiva lenders and LAPO for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Нарзуллоев Диловар житель города Душанбе. Работает на стройке . Холост. Живет с родителями. Не смотря на то , что он не женат , он один обеспечивает семью. Хочет получить кредит для покупки компьютера. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев. Приобретение компьютера даст возможность работать на дому , а так же получать образование.
texts.en:
Dilovar N. lives in Dushanbe. He works at a construction site. He is single and lives with his parents; however, he is the sole provider for his family. He wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase a computer. He will repay the loan within 12 months. Purchasing a computer will enable Dilovar to work from home and to obtain education.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is 47 years old and married with a child. Mary sells sarongs and shoes. Mary started this business in 2006. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell. Mary says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and shoes to sell

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.en:
Noriniso has a successful business selling clothing for children at the market in Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She is married with two sons. Difficult living conditions forced her husband to leave for Russia to earn a living.

Therefore, Noriniso has to work hard to help provide for her family. She decided to start her own business about 12 years ago. With the busy winter season approaching, Noriniso has requested a loan to help purchase a new supply of winter clothing for children to sell in her business. Noriniso is counting on your generous heart.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. History of note includes: it was once a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki; and the birthplace of the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have a viable business proposition when they request a loan. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and IMON will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purcahse children's clothing

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Kiên năm nay 29 tuổi.  Chị đang sống cùng chồng là cán bộ xã và hai con nhỏ. Năm 2003 chị  tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào  nghề dệt chiếu của gia đình. Hiện tại  bên cạnh nguồn thu từ việc dệt chiếu gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu từ lương của chồng với tổng thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn vay 9.000.000 để mua thêm nguyên vật liệu dệt  chiếu tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Kiên, 29 years old, has two young children. Her husband works for their commune as a civil servant. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in her family’s business weaving straw mats. Between this business and her husband’s salary, the total income of her family is about 3,000,000 VND (175 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to buy more raw materials for producing straw mats, and so to raise the income of her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving straw mats

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une femme mariée. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son commerce de divers produits alimentaires : mil, maïs, arachide. Son objectif est d’acquérir des biens personnels et d’appuyer financièrement sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a married woman. She wants to use this loan for boosting her commerce in various foods: millet, corn, and peanuts. Her objective is to acquire some personal assets and to support her family financially.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, corn, and peanuts from wholesalers for retail sale

loans.name: Ameena M. Saleem Group

texts.en:
Ameena baji is a 40-year-old married woman and a citizen of a Borewala, Pakistan for the past 26 years. Her husband's name is M. S., and he has a business selling seasonal vegetables. He has been selling vegetables for the past 10 years. Ameena baji is the mother of two sons. Her sons are getting an education from a school that is located near their house. Ameena baji is a midwife. She learned this art from her mother. Ameena baji is applying for a loan to buy medicine for her work. 

She is the group leader of more women in this area. Sugran baji would like a loan to buy clothes for her clothing sales business. Abida baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. RaZ. baji would like a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. NaZ. baji would like a loan to buy perfumes for her perfume shop. Gulzaran baji would like a loan to buy spare parts for motorbikes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one anothers' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Toshpulat

texts.ru: Эшболтаев Тошпулот проживает в районе Джилликуль. Возраст 32 года. Женат , но детей не имеет. Живет в очень большой семье. Живет с рождителями и семьей брата. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим бизнесом уже шесть лет.В данный момент планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Toshpulat A. lives in Jilikul. He is 32 years old. He is married but has no children. He lives with a very big family. He lives with his parents and brother’s family. He works in animal husbandry. He raises cattle. He has been doing this work for six years. At present, he plans to take out a loan to increase the number of cattle he has. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Senglay Kroeung, 45, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1990 and have two daughters. One of them is in school and the other one assists her mother in their grocery business.

Sophal has been a silk weaver and selling groceries for ten years. She buys grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale in a local market. Her husband assists his wife in selling grocery items; he used to be a policeman as well. Sophal is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase more grocery items for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: Virginia del Carmen C. D. Martí resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su hija D. 15 años y su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista. Virginia posee un negocio D. plásticos como vasos desechables, platos entre otros más. Dicho negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Cojutepeque y ya cuenta con 7 años D. tenerlo. Virginia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos desechables, D. manera que pueda surtir más su negocio, ya que uno D. los mayores sueños D. Virginia es poder ver su negocio bastante surtido y establecido en el lugar D. manera que sea el preferido por los clientes que visitan el lugar, ya que esto contribuirá a que ella pueda colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y permitirá a que ella y su familia obtengan una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen C. D. Martí lives in Cojutepeque along with her 15 year old daughter and her husband who works as a driver. Virginia has a plastics business such as disposable cups and plates among other things. Said business is located in the municipal market of Cojutepeque and she has had the business for 7 years. Virginia is asking for a loan with which she will buy more disposable products, and in this way she can secure more business. One of Virginia's biggest dreams is to see her business better supplied and established in a space in the way that is preferred by the customers that visit the shops as this will help her to assist her husband with household expenses and to allow her and her family have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic products for resale

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Marbelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Marbelly es casada, de 30 años de edad, trabajadora del Centro Social SOS Juigalpa como coordinadora administrativa desde hace 5 años, tiene una niña en nivel pre-escolar, su esposo tiene un negocio en Santo Tomas Chontales y es quien asume los gastos del hogar, ella con su salario paga la cuota mensual de su casa y este caso ahora pagara la cuota del credito. Esta solicitando su 1er credito, el cual utilizara para la ampliacion de su vivienda y construira un anexo que sera destinado para utilizarlo como cocina y comedor y darle mas privacidad a su familia, pues estan utilizando la sala como cocina y comedor.  Es conocida como una persona responsable y con alto espiritu de superacion, ya que despues de trabajar de lunes a viernes, los sabados ayuda al esposo en el negocio y los domingos estudia.
texts.en:
Marbelly is married, 30 years old, and has worked as an administrative coordinator in the Centro Social SOS Juigalpa for five years. She has a daughter who's in preschool. Her husband has a business in Santo Tomás Chontales and he's the one that takes care of household expenses. With her salary she pays the monthly house payment and now will also make the loan payment. She is requesting her first loan that will be used to increase the size of her home by constructing an annex that will be used as a kitchen an dining area and give her family more privacy because they are currently using the living room as the kitchen and dining room. She is known as a responsible person with a strong spirit and desire to get ahead because, after working Monday through Friday, on Saturdays she helps her husband with his business and on Sundays she studies.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kitchen and dining area

loans.name: Ouyètiè 4 Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 4 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 32 ans et au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 4 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 4 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 4 is a group of married women from the village of Nitabogoro of the town of Koutiala, Sikasso region (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional families and are on average 32 with at least 4 children. They mainly excel in cultivating peanuts and millet.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Ouyètiè 4 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After having correctly reimbursed their first loan, they are on their second rural loan.

The present loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut and millet seeds, other small necessities for farming, and entrants for these crops, in the big market of Koutiala. After the rainy season, the harvests are stocked for a certain period so that they have more value before being sold at the big market of Koutiala and in the surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash to a clientele mostly coming from the big towns.

Each of the members of the Ouyètiè 4 group expects, after their crops are sold, to make an average profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of entrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Edisa's Group

texts.en: N. Edisa is a friendly and hard working lady with a business of selling fresh produce, like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, from her home in Kisoga. She is a widow with 5 children aged 2-14 years. She pays their school fees herself with the help of loans. She buys her goods from farmers in the villages (in addition to the vegetable she gets from her farm) and she sells from her stall. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy more cabbages, pineapples, carrots, onions, and tomatoes to sell. She has been able to develop herself and her home with the loans by buying more household items. With this share of the loan, Edisa needs to buy more fresh produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Akinsade

texts.en: J. sells garri (roast cassava grain) in bags and she also grinds pepper, and sells beans and tomatoes. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. J. is 52 years old, which she thinks is old, but she is very determined to pull her family out of poverty and to expand her business. She has 5 children and she requests a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more garri to sell. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri in bags to sell

loans.name: Basdy

texts.en:
This woman is a mother with two children. She was born in 1973. Basdy is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region. She has settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Zargar village.

Basdy has ten years of experience in her business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the foodstuffs for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Melania Aurora

texts.es: La señora Melania Méndez de 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, se dedica  ala venta de ropa  y variedades como, aretes, pulseras, prensapelos entre otros, los cuales vende a costos accesibles, lleva tres años administrando sus ventas, vende por encargo, da al crédito de la quincena, este negocio lo inicio con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos y para poder tener mejores posibilidades económica para apoyar  a su hijo, que junto a su esposo han logrado a que sea una persona de buenas relaciones sociales como educativas. Este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un muro al frente de su casa para reguardar la seguridad de su familia. Sus planes es poder agrandar su negocio, tener una tienda de variedades que espera a corto plazo alcanzar. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad del financiamiento para lograr hacer mejoras a su vivienda y lograr tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
La señora Melania Méndez is 37 years old and resides in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city Managua. She sells clothes and an assortment of goods including earrings, bracelets, and hairclips, which she sells at reasonable prices. She has run this business for 3 years, selling on order, and giving her customers credit up to 15 days. She started this business with the desire to support her husband with the expenses, and because she and her husband wish to give better economic opportunities to their son, so that he can become an educated person of good social standing. This is her second lending cycle with AFODENIC. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to make a wall around her house order to increase the security of her family. Her plan is to enlarge her business and to soon have a store. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain financing to improve her house so that she can have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción Rodríguez C. tiene 58 años. Tiene 8 hijos con 8 hijos con su pareja actualmente ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella. Su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con capital propio por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Lamentablemente con los pocos estudios que Concepción recibió ha logrado establecer su propio negocio en su vivienda. Con el crédito comprara la materia prima que necesita para la elaboración de sus nacatamales. Ella desea para un futuro que su negocio se mantenga estable para que sus ingresos proporcionen lo básico.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, is married to Serah, and has one son and two daughters. Peter is an orphan and he helped in educating his siblings so that they are now self-reliant. He can be described as a hardworking man and delivers clients’ work on time.

Peter came to know about KADET through market outreach in Juja town. He is applying for his 3rd loan with KADET.

Peter does carpentry work - he makes chairs, beds etc. He is planning to expand his business through the purchase of timber and fabric to satisfy his clients’ needs.

Peter intends to buy his own wood processing tools since he has to outsource. His future hopes and dreams are to open a big timber workshop and to hire many young people whom he can train in carpentry work.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website:  www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase timber and fabric for his carpentry business

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
M. is married but not living with her husband. She has two children. She lives in mile 2 of Nkwen-Cameroon.  M. and her entire family are living in a house with five rooms. M. has had to overcome some challenges in life, such as caring for her children, especially as she is separated from her husband. She is the one to pay school fees for her children. She has also had to cope with the death of her father and ill health.

M. sells drinks and food. She plans to invest this loan in the purchase of drinks, crates, pots, dishes, groundnuts and plantains.  

This will be M.'s fifth time to receive a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2003. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business and her reasonable prices.  Also with experience, she is now experiencing good profits from her business.  Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, to buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick; she will invest the rest of her profits in her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Top purchase drinks, crates, plates, spoons and trays

loans.name: Mrs. Sokly Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people who all live in the village of Khnar Thum in Takeo Province make up the group that is requesting this village bank loan. Mrs. Sokly P. is a village bank president who has selected the members, and they all will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokly P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. She is a 41-year-old widow with a child who is a weaver. Mrs. Sokly P. is requesting a loan to buy more raw materials for her child, while her child's business is going well.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her child's weaving business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Nothing is impossible when you believe in yourself and you are wiling to work hard, courageously persevere and love what you do. This is what Elsie M. is doing to attain her dreams with the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon. Elsie is 40 years old, and married to Leonilo, who helps her run their scrap business. They have 4 children who are between 10 and 18 years old. 2 are in college and the younger 2 are in high school and grade school. The family lives in Prk. Kulitis, Barrio Dos Hermanas, Talisay City, Negros Occidental. It is one of Elsie's most cherished dreams that her children be able to finish college and have their own stable and comfortable livelihoods when they grow up. Concerned for her children's future, Elsie joined NWTF Project Dungganon in 2002 so that she could increase her capital in their scrap business. With the added buying capability, she was able to buy back more recyclables like scrap iron, bottles, plastic, etc. Now she is earning approximately PHP 30,000 per month from her business operations. From this she was able to buy a motorcycle and a small pickup truck for faster delivery of her scrap materials. She has also happily set aside some amount for her children's education. Elsie's previous loan of PHP 15,000 was used as revolving capital for her scrap business and now that she's paid that off, she is borrowing the same amount so that she could continue maintaining her scrap buyback levels and be able to sell the scrap in volume, earning a neat profit. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon(a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Isak

texts.en:
Isak T. is 48 years old and married with three children. Isak sells dried fruits in the local central market. He has had this business for 5 years already. Dried fruits are very popular in Tajikistan. Any hostess has some in store for serving, in case guests arrive at the house. In addition, dried fruits are, as a rule, served during all important family occasions, such as wedding parties, birthday parties and the like. Considering the constant demand for his goods, Isak's business is quite successful and brings in a stable income for his family. Isak has a large and friendly family, who always try to help each other. Now, he wants to increase his stock of goods so as to be able to better meet the demands of his buyers. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1,500. He will spend the loan on the purchase of dried fruits in order to increase the range he has for sale. Isak has already demonstrated himself to be a good client and has a positive credit history. He would like to thank everyone for their support, and promises to pay back the loan on time.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.


IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more dried fruits

loans.name: Narsumbe

texts.en:
Narsumbe is 26 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two young daughters both attend kindergarten. 

Narsumbe and his wife sell cosmetics in their town. He sells a variety of cosmetic from a rented stall in a local goods market. Narsumbe started his business in 2005. At first, he conducted his business from a small, rented stand at the market, but he used his earnings to buy a working space at a trading center that is located in the market. Today, his business operates at a stable level and he has a good reputation among his customers and suppliers. With his earnings he was able to buy a car and is planning to buy an apartment soon. 

In the future, Narsumbe hopes to continue to expand his business and earnings. He says, "My wish is to educate my children and expand my business." He is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1050 USD) loan to purchase cosmetics from Ulaanbaatar to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen N., 31, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. N. is in the business of selling handmade brooms in the city, earning an income of US$3 per day. She has been with this business since 2000. Her husband sells brooms as well in his village, earning US$3 per day.

N. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, N. is requesting a loan of US$1200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the expected loan to buy more materials to produce brooms for sale. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy more materials to produce handmade brooms for sale

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora María Magdalena T. P. se dedica a venta de ropa, zapatos, prendas  de plata por encargo, es casada su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica, La señora no tiene tramo fijo pero sale  a ofrecer su producto a la casa de sus clientes, tiene 4 hijos, sus dos hijos varones le ayudan en el taller a su papa y sus dos hijas mujeres le ayudan a ella a regar su mercadería.

Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel, a pesar que tiene la ayuda de su esposo le gusta depender por sí misma y tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
María Magdalena T. P. works selling clothes, shoes and silver jewelry in response to customer orders. She is married, and her husband has a mechanic's workshop. María does not have a fixed sales route, but she goes out to her customers' homes to offer her products. She has 4 children; her two sons help their father in his workshop, while her two daughters help her prepare her merchandise. This is her second loan with Ceprodel; although she receives help from her husband, she likes to be self-sufficient and run her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Mastula Nalukenge' S Group

texts.en:
Mastula is 27 years of age, married with one child.  Her family rents a one room house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and piped water at home and they eat three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses are utilities, school fees for children, medication, feeding the family and rent for her business and residence. 

Mastula owns a stall selling all types of food in Nakulabye, one of the city suburbs.  Mastula sells bananas, cassavas and sweet potatoes.  On average she receives 20 customers a day and has been in business for over two years.  

She sells on a retail basis only and has been with MCDT for over seven years servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas, sacks of cassava and sweet potatoes.  She aspires to see her business grow bigger.
.

loans.use: Buy more bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina N. is 45 years old and lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. To support her crop cultivation, she owns a plowing machine. Her husband, Mr. Tha Parnh, owns a rice mill and uses it to earn a small income to support his family. The couple has four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, one of whom is a construction worker, while the youngest attends the public school.
In order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mrs. Sina N. is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from Kiva partner, AMK. She will use this loan to buy a cow for breeding and, with the rest of the loan, repair her plowing machine.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married and has 1 infant.  Aljane owns & operates a motor transportation service. Aljane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Aljane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aljane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Aljane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Julio Francisco

texts.es: Julio Francisco tiene 37 años,  anteriormente él había tenido la experiencia de obtener financiamiento por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda. La actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que comenzó con la ayuda de su Mama. Por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y busca la forma de hacerse cargo de su negocio. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Su deseo es seguir trabajando mientras tenga vida.
texts.en:
Julio Francisco, 37, has had previous loans that have been of great use to him. He has sold general merchandise for over 16 years; he started out with help from his mother. Now, he has two children under his care and he seeks ways to tend to his business He is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise; his wish is to continue working for as long as he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mao Pai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people who live in Samar village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Mao P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer, who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

However, she has a problem because her rice field is infertile. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, Mrs. Srey Mao P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Socheat Rous, owns a plow machine, and she has three children who are all enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn M. wishes to grow her “bangus” (milk fisk- national fish) fry (fingerlings) buying and selling business to increase its earnings and augment her husband’s small and sporadic income as a hired laborer. This way, she will be able to enhance her capacity to supporting the needs of her four children whose age range is from five to 16 years old, especially their education. Presently, Medelyn’s eldest and second child have stopped studying because she and her husband didn’t have enough income to support them. 

With Medelyn’s  “bangus fry” buying and selling business, given a large amount of loan for working capital, she hopes to purchase a large volume to accommodate the increasing demand of her customers who culture “bangus” for selling. 'Bangus' is one of the kinds of fish Filipinos most love, and it is served in most restaurants. For Medelyn, this business has been a great source of income for her family and has been providing them with many things they need in life.  Through its proceeds, she hopes that someday life for her and her family may be easy and enjoyable.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of "bangus fry" to sell

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira K. is the leader of this group; she is 68. Her husband is a pensioner. They have five daughters and three sons. All the children are married and lives separately with their families, except the youngest son. Sabira and her husband have been breeding cattle for twenty years. Their youngest son helps them in this activity. In this way they make money to improve their living conditions. With money received from this loan, Sabira will purchase one cow for breeding. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle.

Aigul A. is 47; she is a widow. She has raised four daughters and two sons. The sons work in Bishkek as mechanics; the older daughter is a nurse and the second daughter works in a sewing workshop. The other children study at school. Aigul breeds cattle; she has been doing for four years. Now she has applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase one cow in order to increase their number.

Aishabubu A. is 61; she is a widow. She has a son and two daughters. The daughters are married and live separately with their families. The son lives with his mom, and he helps her with housework. Aishabubu has been breeding cattle and cultivating fruits and vegetables for 16 years. She wants to get a loan to purchase 150 litters of fuel, which is needed for the sowing process in the summer season.

Anarbubu AA. is the treasurer of the group. She is 54 and married. She has a son and a daughter. The daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Anarbubu and her husband have been breeding and selling cattle for six years. They started with an initial investment of 10000 soms ($217.6) and now they make 5000 soms ($108.8) per month. Anarbubu needs a loan to purchase cattle and sell it at higher price after fattening.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es:
Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer y durante este tiempo los préstamos le ayudaron mucho en su negocio.
Nancy es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Nancy trabaja en una institución como secretaria y estudia contabilidad, Nancy junto a su esposo tienen 2 carros que viajan a la provincia de Vilcas Huaman, cuenta con la ayuda de un chofer. Además Nancy tiene una tienda en Vilcashuaman que esta administrada por hermana, ella le envía la mercadería semanalmente. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para la reparación de su carro.
Nancy sueña con comprar otro carro y terminar de estudiar su carrera.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Florecer Comunal Bank. The loans she has received through her membership have helped her a great deal with her business. Nancy is married and has two children. She works as a secretary in a company and studies accounting. Nancy and her husband have two cars and travel to the province of Vilcas Huaman with the help of a driver. In addition, Nancy has a store in Vilcas Huaman which her sister manages. She sends her merchandise weekly. Her loan will be used to buy rice and sugar, and to repair her car. Nancy dreams of buying another car and completing her university courses.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar and repair her car.

loans.name: Marta De La Cruz

texts.es: Marta De La Cruz tiene 50 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 que tiene este medio de vida. Su esfuerzo por salir adelante fue creciendo, pues tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijas que actualmente laboran de manera independiente. Pues su negocio inicio fue creciendo por sus clientes que día a día llegan a su pulpería en busca de los diferentes productos que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como detergentes, granos básicos, golosinas y productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Marta De La Cruz is 50 years old. Her business is a small grocery shop. She has had this livelihood for more than 4 years. Her efforts to get ahead increased because she had to support her three daughters who currently work independently. Since her business began it has grown because each day her customers come to her shop looking for the different products that she offers. The financing she is applying for is for the purchase of basic materials such as detergents, bulk grains, sweets, and household products.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna B. is from the town of Talibon. She is 32 years old. Meraluna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Meraluna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed in the market. She wishes to have a healthy family and for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

In 2008, Meraluna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Meraluna is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment used for gathering seaweed. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Meraluna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase equipment used for gathering seaweeds.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona T. is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Hinaplanon outside of Iligan City, a municipality on the island of Luzon. To make a living, Chona provides and sells cell phone electronic load-ups from different networks in the local community. Chona has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Chona joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI that she used to expand the business. Chona is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will give her additional working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Chona from HSPFI. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To have additional working capital

location.town: Hinaplanon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Aida Mercedes

texts.en:
Aida Mercedes Y. C. is 41 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has seven children, ages 4 to 23 years. 

Aida is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Aida also works in agriculture and has been raising farm animals for the past 15 years. She does the buying and selling of her products in the town of Matilde Esther. 

She plans to use the loan to buy agricultural supplies. Her dream is to build a house. 

In her free time she likes to spend time at home. She enjoys the festivals of San Jose.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her crops

loans.name: Karla Vannesa

texts.es:
La   Sra. Karla A. A., trabaja como   Trabaja como Secretaria en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.                                                      
Es madre de familia de un  niño  y este se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para el pago de trámites de Diploma de su graduación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla A. A. is employed as a Secretary by the Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She is the mother of a school age son. She is asking for funds to pay for diploma and graduation expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for diploma and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 4 and 7 years. Her business is located at Juja in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. 

She sells fruits and vegetables, including oranges and pineapples. She also sells sweet potatoes and arrow roots. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers; hence, customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruits and vegetables to meet customer demand. In the future, she hopes to own her own premises from where she will be running her business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Augustine B.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the St. Joseph Vocational Institute, Magburaka. This institute was established in 1985 by the Roman Catholics to improve the education of girl children in Magburaka and its surroundings. 

Augustine B. M. who is pictured on the left is the leader of this group. Augustine was born in Kamabai village. He is fifty-two years old, married with six children – three in secondary school and three in primary school.  Augustine has been in the teaching profession for eight years now. Augustine will use part of his share of the loan to pay school fees and other school charges for his children. He will invest the rest of the loan in agriculture.

loans.use: pay school fees and invest the rest in agriculture

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima lives in a city called Gujranwala with her family in a small house. Gujranwala is famous in Pakistan for its dairy industry.  She is a housewife who stays at home and fulfills her household responsibilities. She is a mother of three sons. Her eldest son is 9 years old and studying in 5th class. The next to him reads in 4th class and the youngest has not started to attend school yet. 

Saima's husband is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. He provides transport services to his passengers. He starts work around 9am and ends at 7pm. In this way, he drives for ten hours continuously. He has been in this business for the past five years. He is the only breadwinner of his family and that makes him more serious about his responsibilities. 

Saima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy a new rickshaw because the old rickshaw has become rough and never allows him to drive maximum hours which is affecting his earnings as well. 

Saima is hoping that with the new rickshaw he will be able to double his income and provide transport services to many more passengers. She is a new loan user of Asasah and she hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Sughran Muhammad Ilyas' Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a resident of Gujranwala where she lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in an area named Faqirpura. She has been living here for over 30 years. Gujranwala is an industrial city also known for its rice crop.
Sughran supports her family by doing embroidery work for her neighboring customers. She has a vast knowledge of her business and keeps up to date about the latest trends in fashion. She is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her daughters help her in completing embroidery orders on time and her son works in a factory earning a meager income.
Sughran is married to M. I., a cobbler. He receives orders from different factories and shoe shops and provides them with finished goods to earn an income.
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread, fabric and sketches that will help her to finish orders on time and offer more variety to her customers. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.
Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called the Asasah passbook) in her hands is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean L. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 29 years old. Jean is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling AVON products such as lotion, deodorant and perfumes in the local community. Jean has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Jean joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jean from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kelly Merly

texts.es:
Kelly tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega situada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años y durante este tiempo se ha hecho bastante conocida entre los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su negocio porqye prefieren la calidad de productos y el buen trato que ofrece.

Kelly desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio, en especial durante la temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda suele aumentar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Kelly is32 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Olmos District, an area with much commercialized movement and is located an hour and 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small store in her home where she sells groceries. She has been selling for more than 5 years and now she is well known by the neighbors in her area that prefer to go to her store since she offers quality products and good service.

Kelly wishes to supply her store some more especially during the Christmas season when demand tends to increase. This is why she has requested from Edpyme Alternative a 1500 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to supply and expand her store.

loans.name: Juan Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria de 33 años de edad, su esposo labora para el IPADE, el la ayuda con los gastos del hogar y con los compromisos adquiridos, ella trabaja para el ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 24 años como docente de primaria, donde se desempeña con mucho esmero y dedicacion, es una persona humilde y esforzada a venido obteniendo sos propios bienes con mucho sacrificio realizando creditos a nuestra Institucion y de esta manera sacar a delante a su Familia.  

Solicita su  decimo credito para construir una habitaciòn para su hijo mayor, el cual espera ser beneficiada con Kiva para poder realizar este pequeño protecto. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a tener su casa muy bonita y que sus hijos gocen de buena salud
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 33 years old.  Her husband works for IPADE and helps her with their household expenses and financial commitments.  Juana Maria has worked as an elementary school teacher for the Ministry of Education for 24 years and she does her work with a lot of care and commitment.  She is a humble and hard-working person who has accumulated her own assets through a lot of sacrifices, taking loans from our institution and getting her family ahead.

Juana Maria is requesting her tenth loan in order to build a room for her eldest son who hopes to receive a Kiva loan so that they can carry out this little project.

Juana Maria's greatest dream in life is to have her house looking really nice and for her children to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying maize for selling

loans.name: Mercedes Marien

texts.es:
Mercedes de 44 años,  es una mujer trabajadora que no está casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Tiene un negocio de venta de pollos hace ya 6 años atrás ya que su mama siempre le enseño a criar pollos y gallinas en su niñez. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso ha estado trabajando durante años vendiendo pollos listo para prepara y cocinar desde las 05h00pm que abre el puesto hasta las 12h00 que se le terminan los pollos. Tiene muchas aspiración para el futuro por eso quiere continuar con su trabajo para asegurar su fututo. Con el préstamo espera comprar balanceado para pollos ya que no solo vende los pollos sino que primero los cría y después los mata para la venta.  

En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio en otra zona para tener mas cliente y si es posible en un mercado
texts.en:
Mercedes, 44, is a hard worker who is unmarried with 3 grown children.  She has had her business selling chickens for 6 years, with her mother teaching her to raise them during her childhood.

She lives in a suburban area called Paraiso and has works selling chickens ready to cook from 5:00am when she opens to noon.  She has many aspirations for the future and so wants to continue with her work in order to fulfill them.  With the loan she wants to buy chicken feed since she not only sells the chickens but raises and slaughters them first.

In the future she wants to improve her business in another area in order to have more clientele and if possible sell from a market.

loans.use: Chicken feed

loans.name: Segundo Teodoro

texts.es:
Segundo es una padre de familia de 53 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en una de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega instalada en su casa a sus vecinos y personas que llegan a la zona.  Asimismo de dedica a la  crianza y venta de aves de corral. Él cría gallinas en su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y alimento balanceado y cuando estas han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente él desea adquirir más alimento para sus gallinas y así  poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 53-year old father who lives together with his wife and son in one of the communities that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region that is primarily known for its fruit products, especially mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He sells general merchandise from a small store installed in his house. He sells to his neighbors and to people in the region. He also raises and sells chickens. He raises chickens at home, feeding them basic grains and balanced feed. When they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income, which is why he always tries to manage it in the best way possible. 

He needs to purchases more feed for his chickens in order to increase his sales and his earnings. IN order to reach his objective he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced chicken feed.

loans.name: C2912 Tuzamuke Group

texts.en:
Dancille is 49 years old and is married. Dancille's business is well organized. Her business is open from 6:00 am until 8:30 pm. This is her third year of successful business operation. 

Dancille is the group leader of the group called Tuzamuke in the local language. Dancille is the person on the right side in the photo. The group includes five members, each one has her own business. 

Dancille and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses so that they can offer good service to their customers. This loan will impact the group members by helping them purchase larger quantities of products, which will allow them to earn more profits. Dancille and her group hope to save the extra money and reinvest it in their businesses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Don Tomas, tiene 50 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de hamacas y Jarcia, vive con su esposa y cinco hijas, María de la Paz de 19 años, Sandra de 18, Guadalupe, Blanca Lidia de 13 y Adeyda de 11 años de edad, todas aun son dependientes. 
El Negocio de don Tomas fue heredado por su padre y los productos los vende en el mercado municipal de Corinto los días miércoles, sábado y domingo de 6:00am a 2:00pm, tiene 20 años de estar en este negocio que le ha dado hasta el momento lo necesario para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo, que lo piensa invertir en hamacas por docenas y lazos, esta inversión le permitirá responder a las necesidades de los clientes con nuevos productos en el inventario, los riesgos serian las ventas que en un momento dado pueden bajar.
La aspiración de don Tomas es mantener el negocio fuerte, atender bien a los clientes, ofrecer siempre buenos productos y velar por el bienestar de su familia que es muy numerosa.
texts.en:
Tomas is 50 years of age and lives in the Corinto department of Morazán. He sells hammocks and rope and lives with his wife and five daughters: María de la Paz (19), Sandra (18), Guadalupe, Blanca Lidia (13) and Adeyda (11), all of whom are dependent on him financially.
 
Tom inherited this business from his father and sells products in the municipal market of Corinto on Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays from 6:00am to 2:00pm. He has worked in this business for 20 years and up until now it has given him everything he requires to cover his family's needs. 

He is currently applying for a loan to invest in rope and hammocks by the dozen. This investment will help him to cater for his customers' needs with new products in his inventory. The risks are that he could experience a downturn in sales from one moment to the next.

Tomas' aspirations are to keep his business strong, attend to his clients well, always offer good quality products and ensure the well being of his numerous family.

loans.use: To purchase hammocks and rope

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
La Sra. Dolly pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada y tiene 45 años.  Tiene estudios secundarios completos y es madre de 02 hijos, de los cuales uno asiste a la universidad y el otro continúa en el colegio.

La necesidad de aportar un dinero adicional a su familia y las ganas de cumplir parte de sus sueños, la motivaron a emprender su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.  Ella empezando con tan sólo una mesita y unos cuantos productos de limpieza vendiendo en la vereda de su casa. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando muy buenos clientes; hoy en día, cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todos los productos necesarios que se requieren en la casa; siendo ella quien personalmente los atiende  con el carisma que la caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará leche, conservas de pescado, huevos en jabas; otra parte del dinero la invertirá en comprar detergente, papel higiénico, jabón en cajas; así como también galletas, gaseosas y fideos para así continuar brindando una muy buena atención a sus clientes.

Dolly dice que se siente con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para salir adelante y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Dolly belongs to “Las Orquideas” (The Orchids) Communal Bank, District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martin.  She is married and 45 years old.  She completed secondary school and is the mother of 2 children, of whom one attends the university and the other continues in school.

The need to bring in additional money for the family, and the desire to fulfill part of her dreams, motivated Dolly to  begin her own business.  She sells groceries., beginning with just a little table and a small quantity of cleaning products and selling in the lane to her house.  From the beginning to the present,  she has been winning very good customers.  Today,  she can count on fixed customers who daily visit her store to buy, because there they find all the products they need for the home.  She personally attends to their needs with the charisma that characterizes her.

With this loan of 1,500 New Sols, she will buy milk, fish conserves, and cartons of eggs.  Another part of the money will be invested in buying detergent, toilet paper, boxes of soap, and also cookies, soft drinks, and beans, to continue attending to her customers demand.

Dolly says that she feels very determined to continue working to get ahead and she is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like her to have opportunities to develop themselves and advance.

loans.use: TO BUY MILK, FISH CONSERVES, BOXES OF EGGS, PLUS  DETERGENT FOR HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nim D. Nim sells vegetables at KoKi market, approximately three kilometers from her house. Her husband, Mr. Davy Srey, offers firewood-cutting services to his fellow villagers. 

The couple has two sons and six daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, one is a driver, three attend school, and one assists her mother in the business. The family lives in a village along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Mrs. Nim D. Nim is requesting her second loan of $1,200 in order to purchase neighboring plots of land to expand the family property.

loans.use: to purchase neighboring plots of land to expand the family property

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group
