texts.es: Maria Luz es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales tres son jovenes, residen en un centro poblado de Huarochiri junto a su conviviente. Maria Luz se dedica a  la venta de  de cosmeticos de dos reconocidas companias de productos de belleza desde hace 12 meses.ademas en temporada de verano comercializa sandalias de todo tipo. María Luz empezó como ayudante en la venta de estos productos para luego convertirse en una buena vendedora, junto a su conyuge han logrado darle estudio  a sus hijos ademas de lograr su independencia en lo comercial. Maria luz apoya en su hogar con los gastos de estudios de sus jovenes hijos. Ella suena con la compra de un terreno y construirlo y aperturar una bodega para ofercer variedad de productos. El reciente credito sera invertido en la compra de productos de belleza como : colonias y champús a precios rebajados con lo cual lograra tener mayores ganancias y de esta forma ampliara su stock en esta temporada. Maria Luz y sus companeras son 7 en total y el nombre de la joven Alcancia Comunal “Las Palomitas” se debe a la calle por donde residen todos los socios.  La Alcom “Las Palomitas tienen 4 meses de participacion en el programa prosperidad y estan siendo responsables con su compromiso de pago cada mes.
texts.en: María Luz is the mother of four children, three are young children. They live in a population center in Huarochiri with her partner. She has sold cosmetics from two well-known beauty product companies for the past 12 months. In addition, during the summer, she sells many types of sandals. María Luz started out as a sales assistant for these products. Then later, she became a good salesperson. Together with her partner, they have been able to give an education to their children. In addition, they have achieved business independence. María Luz helps her household by providing the funds for the children’s studies. She wants to purchase a plot of land. Then she wants to build and open a store in order to offer a variety of products. The loan will be invested in the purchase of beauty products like: colognes and shampoos at reduced prices. She will have larger profits and she will be able to expand her inventory at this time. María Luz and her partners make up a group of seven. The name of the communal bank is “Las Palomitas”. The name “Las Palomitas” comes from the name of the street where all the members live. The communal bank has had four months of participation in this prosperity program and they are responsible with their commitment to pay each month.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like colognes and shampoo to increase inventory

loans.name: Soninbat

texts.en:
Soninbat is 42 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house, in the outer ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts of the city. His daughter attends public school. 

Soninbat and his wife operate a shoe manufacturing business. When they first started their business in 2007, they made shoes at their home. Today their business has grown so that they have 2,600,000 MNT in working capital and they have rented premises. They manufacture traditional leather shoes. With this loan of 2,000,000 MNT, Soninbat will purchase a large amount of leather/material for handmade shoes during this period when the prices are lower.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make handmade shoes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad rural del distrito de San Pedro ubicado en Pacasmayo -  La Libertad. A pesar de vivir en una zona rural la calidad de vida de esta familia es buena.

Rosa cuenta, desde hace 3 años, con una bodega en su domicilio, en esta vende todo tipo de abarrotes (fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos, etc.), algunas frutas y verduras, bebidas y golosinas. A pesar de tener una tienda pequeña, esta está bien surtida y cuenta con clientes fijos.

Rosa desea invertir en su negocio para que este le produzca mayores ganancias y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que repartirá en el mejoramiento de su cocina y en comprar nuevos productos para su bodega.

Rosa tiene muchos deseos de arreglar su cocina y de que su negocio crezca para poder hacer arreglos en su hogar, por su propia cuenta. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 44 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and children in a rural community in the district of San Pedro located in Pacasmayo - La Libertad.  Despite living in a rural area, they have a good quality of life.   

For the past 3 years Rosa has been running a store out of her house where she sells all types of grocery products (noodles, rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc.), some fruits and vegetables, drinks and sweets.  Even though her store is small it is well-stocked and she has a steady clientele.  

Rosa would like to invest in her business so that she can increase her income and improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to make improvements to her kitchen and buy new products for her store. 

Rosa is eager to make improvements to her kitchen.  She wants her business to grow so that she is able to make other improvements in her home.  This loan will be very useful.

loans.use: make improvements to her kitchen and stock her store.

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: el sr. Juan nació en Chuquisaca el 24 de julio de 1963 tiene un hijo mayor,  su esposa es doña Mercedes hace 20 años que se vinieron a Santa Cruz el torno en busca de mejores días, y mediante el sindicato agrario de Zurutu tienen una parcela de 35 hectáreas en la cual vive y trabaja siembra maíz, arroz, y yuca y también se dedica a la crianza de chancho, con el dinero del crédito comprar semillas y también lo utilizara para el preparado del terreno para la siembra, y como es una distancia larga salen una vez al mes al Torno para compra de víveres, para poder abastecerse para todo el mes, es cliente responsable hace 4 años que el esta trabajando con Emprender, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juan was born in Chuquisaca  on July 24, 1963 and has one adult son. His wife is Mercedes and 20 years ago they came to Santa Cruz to find better opportunities. Through the Zurutu agrarian union they were able to obtain a parcel of 35 hectares of land on which they live and work. They grow corn, rice and yucca and they also raise pigs. 

With the money from this loan Juan will buy seeds and also prepare his land for sowing. And, since it is far from their home, Mercedes and Juan go to Torno once a month to purchase provisions to support them for the entire month. Juan has been a responsible client of Emprender for four years and he is grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to invest in sowing rice.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 35 years old and lives in San Francisco, liloy. She is married and has 4 children. Lorna has a transportation business and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a transport vehicle, such as a motorcycle. 

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her vehicle transportation business.

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
Grimanesa nació en la ciudad del Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 62 años de edad. Actualmente, Grimanesa vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació y tiene un hijo. Grimanesa se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y pasamanería. Ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el modelo mercado de Calca. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Grimanesa  requiere el préstamo para pagar comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cuarderno, lapiceros y otros cosas mas. EL sueño de la socia de Grimanesa es abrir una tienda de bazar. 
 
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Grimanesa was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and she is 62 years old.  Grimanesa currently lives in the same beautiful city where she was born, and she has a son.  

Grimanesa sells desk supplies and assorted merchandise.  She has a stand where she sells at the Modelo Mercado (market) in Calca.  She has had this business for 15 years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Grimanesa needs the loan to pay for more merchandise like notebooks, pens, and other things.  Grimanesa’s dream is to open a bazaar type store.

She is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  These qualities are the reason her colleagues invited her to participate the the Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with six children – one boy and five girls. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a fish selling business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season the availability of fish is minimal, making it difficult to meet her customers’ demands. 

With her KES 10,000 loan Mariamu wants to purchase bundles of dry fish for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dry fish for sale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two young sons. 

Sopheap wants to continue her weaving business, so she is requesting another loan to purchase weaving materials.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Rosario está conformado por Manuel de Jesús, German francisco, Lucia del rosario, María Elena y Alba Maritza. Don German tiene 24 años es soltero y no tiene hijos él se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y elaboración de picadillo de cerdo. Desea en un futuro establecer la venta de comida en su vivienda lo fines de semana. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para compra de masa, cerdo, hojas y bolsas. Otra integrante del grupo es Alba Maritza ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva las cuales distribuye de manera ambulante. El mayor obstáculo que ha tenido ha sido las enfermedades de si hijo. El financiamiento es para la compra de camisa, pantalones, short, faldas y trajes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Rosario” consists of Manuel de Jesús, German Francisco, Lucia del Rosario, María Elena, and Alba Maritza.

Don German is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He sells Nicaraguan tamales and makes mincemeat out of pork. In the future, he hopes to establish a food stand in his home where he can sell on the weekends. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy cornmeal, pork, leaves, and bags.

Another member of the group is Alba Maritza. She sells new clothing as a traveling merchant. Her main challenge has been dealing with her son’s illnesses. Her loan will be used to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts, and suits.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal, pork, leaves, and bags.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao has applied for a loan from Kiva partner HKL for the betterment of her fruit-selling business. She sells different varieties of fruit in the market. She is very fair in her rates and makes good sales every day. She always gets up early in the morning to go the market because the market is far away from her house. 

Due to the long distance, she decided to buy a motorbike. She lacks money, so she would like to request some funding from HKL's partnership with Kiva.  She will use this funding to buy a motorbike to transport her fruit to the market in time. She will also use a part of the money to purchase more fresh seasonal fruit. 

She is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past 6 years. Nao is confident about the positive growth of her business after the loan investment. She is the mother of ten children. Six of them are already married and live independently and the other four are enrolled in school. Taking time from studying, her children do different kinds of work to support the family financially.  In addition to her business, Nao spends her time staying at home and performing her household responsibilities. She said that this loan is very advantageous for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport fruit to market and to purchase more fresh fruit

loans.name: 3.9.81 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase processed seafood to resell.

Minh is 34 years old and she is married with three children. Minh is the group leader of the 3.9.81 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her three dependents.

In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demands for her products.

With her business profit, Minh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase processed seafood to resell.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es: Moisés tiene 39 años, convive con Victoria su esposa y juntos tienen dos hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar. Ellos haboitan en su casa propia ubicada en ciudad de Santa Rosa. Él se destaca por ser un hombre de bien, dedicado a su trabajo, pues diariamente labra la tierra, espacio de 04 hectáreas, y ahí cultiva cacao, café y raíces de barbasco. Tiene 15 años de experiencia y eso lo ha convertido en un gran conocedor de la materia, pero en tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de jornaleros para que extraigan los frutos y trasladarlos a los centros de acopio, siendo el cacao y la raíz de basrbasco que más ganancias le ha generado. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos que perjudican las plantas. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras y ampliar la siembra para así aumentar la producción. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP, afirma que será cumplida con el pago de sus cuotas. Asimismo agradece la ayuda en anteriores veces ya que gracias a ello ha logrado desarrollarse como agricultor. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, comprará más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Moisés is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife Victoria, which whom he has two school-age children.  The live in their own house, which is located in the city of Santa Rosa.  He emphasizes that he is a good man who is dedicated to his work.  He works his fields every day; he has 4 hectares where he grows cocoa, coffee, and mullein roots.

He has 15 years of experience which has made him an expert, but during harvest times he looks for workers to help him pick the crops and transport them to the gathering center.  The cocoa and mullein roots have earned him the best profits.

The problem in his work lies in the fact that he can't combat the insects which harm the plants.  But now his biggest priority is to buy new fields and grow his planting so as to increase his yield.

This will be his sixth loan with MFP, and he vouches that he will be reliable with his repayments.  He is also grateful for the support on the previous occasions, as thanks to that he has been able to further develop as a farmer.

With the 3,000 Soles that he is requesting, he will buy more cocoa plants that he will then graft, to make good use of the fruit in a short time-frame.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is a 59-year-old single woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has been raising pigs for 2 years. Diega built her own backyard piggery where she raises her pigs. She sells her pigs at her town's market and earns about 7,000 PHP per month. She also tills a small parcel of land where she grows rice crops.

Diega has requested this loan to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and materials for the piggery. She hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes to build a better house.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and materials for the piggery.

loans.name: Saodatdjon

texts.ru: Саодатджон замужем имеет двоих детей. Она пекарь и у нее своя пекарня. Национальные лепешки очень востребованы. Она приобретает муку на рынке и занимается выпечкой, от чего получает хорошие доходы. Она хочет получить кредит для закупа муки и увеличения объема производства лепешек.
texts.en: Saodatdjon is married and has two children. She owns a bakery and makes ethnic pastries that are in high demand. She buys flour at the market, bakes pastries, and makes a profit. She's requesting a loan in order to buy more flour and increase her production rates.

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 28-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Alice, who is a house wife. They are blessed with two children. He has been a mixed-crop farmer for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. John will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Gloria Catalina

texts.es:
Gloria de 38 años, con la ayuda de Dios empezó con el negocio hace 7 años en su propia casa para ayudar con los gastos de su familia y ser una fuente más de ingreso.

Trabaja sola todos los días. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ningún problema. Es una madre soltera con tres hijos (2, 9, 16 años) quien trabaja muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar crema, cosmeticos, perfumes. Su meta es poder tener un bazar para que tenga más ayuda de su negocio y también poder hacer la loza de su casa para poder vivir más cómodos.
texts.en:
Gloria, 38, with God’s help started the business 7 years ago at home to help cover family expenses and to have another source of income.  She works alone every day.  Thanks to God there have been no problems.  She’s a single mother with three children (2, 9 and 16 years old) who works very hard to be able to raise her children.

She will use the loan to buy cream, cosmetics and perfume.  Her goal is to have a store to get more help from her business and also to install tile in her house so that they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Work For Unity Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Lunsar town, about 37 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children who are attending secondary schools. Kadiatu hawks medicine such as Pennadols, Amodaqui, ORS, etc.
 
With the help of this loan, Kadiatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (700,000 SLL) to buy medicines – eight boxes of Pennadols and two cartons of Amodaqui to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines – eight boxes of Pennadols and two cartons of Amodaqui to add to her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dinámica, es separada, vive en compañía de sus tres últimos hijos, de 28, 24 y 18 años de edad, a los que quiere mucho, instalados cómodamente en si propia casa.
La actividad que realiza María es la crianza de pollos para eso cuenta con un pequeño galpón con capacidad máxima de 60 pollos, que está instalado en la parte posterior de su casa, iniciándose con un capital propio desde hace 10 años, con el apoyo de sus hijos en la limpieza y alimentación de los pollos.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico extra, para los gastos que se presentaran en el hogar, también el sentirse una mujer productiva. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es que algunas veces se le murieron todos sus pollos debido a la peste, ocasionándole pérdidas, logrando reiniciar gracias al apoyo de MFP, por eso tiene planes de continuar con su actividad y realizar algunos arreglos y mejoras a  su galpón. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, dice cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas, para poder tener un buen record crediticio. Además de sentirse muy bien con su grupo comunal, pues los considera personas sociables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en el arreglo de la infraestructura de su galpón, comprando hojas de bijao para renovar el techado, así como materiales para el piso.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking, dynamic 51-year old woman. She is separated, and she lives in with her three youngest children (28, 24, and 18), who she loves very much. 

Maria's business is raising chickens, and she owns a small chicken coop located at the back of her house with a capacity of 60 chickens. She began the business ten years ago with her own money, and she counts on the support of her children with cleaning and feeding the chicken. 

She likes the business because she can earn extra money for the home, and it also makes her feel like a productive woman. The difficulties in her business are illnesses that can kill chickens and cause losses. She has been able to maintain her business thanks to MFP, and she hopes to make repairs and some improvements to the chicken coop. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue her relationship and make plans for the future. She pledges to make her payments on time, so that she maintains a good credit record. She feels content with her community bank group, who she considers sociable and loyal people. With the loan of 1,000 new soles will be used to repair the chicken coop, purchase materials to renovate the roof, and materials for the flooring.

loans.use: Comprar materiales para su galpon de pollos.

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is a weaver and also assists her husband’s pig farming businesses and rice wine production. They have been married since 1987 and have two sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home. One is a weaver and the other two attend school. The family is living in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nao is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Ebtesam

texts.en:
Ebtesam is a 40-year-old divorced woman from Irbid, Jordan. She has a home-based project in which she sells clothes and Abaya, the traditional dress worn by women in the Middle East. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more Abaya and clothes for trading purposes.
Ebtesam is looking to open a shop for her business so that she increase her customer base as well as her income. She is also looking to purchase a home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and Abaya for trading purposes.

loans.name: María Argelia

texts.es: María Argelia es una señora muy trabajadora quien siempre ha ayudado a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la venta de trapeadores, los cuales fabrica de diferentes tipos de tela, este negocio ha sido muy bueno para ella ya que tiene 5 años de realizarlo, vendiendo de forma ambulante por diferentes lugares. María es una esposa muy responsable y madre de dos pequeños quienes se dedican a estudiar, por lo que ella desea mejorar sus ventas y así brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de telas e hilos con lo pueda producir mayor cantidad de trapeadores, ella confía mucho que gracias a la oportunidad que este préstamo le brindará podrá mejorar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de tela e hilos para elaborar trapeadores

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 53 years old and lives in the remote village of Moek in the Nandihills area of Kenya. She is blessed to have 6 children whom she loves more than his life and for whom she works hard, so that they have a good quality of life.

Christine has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaged in a small “side hustle” business. 

The Moek area is very populated and demand for cereal products such as maize and beans is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds cereal selling very enjoyable.

Christine biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her cereal business, so she is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy different varieties of cereals.
Coming from Kenya which is a third world country and accessing funds is challenging but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more cereals. 

Through the loan, she will sell cereals to her neighbours and to the local market; this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her cereal sales to other markets as this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income Christine will earn will be used to fully repay the loan and permanently change her living conditions by building a modern house and also to secure the future of her school-aged children.

loans.use: To buy cereals from farmers to resell

loans.name: Veronica Concepcion

texts.en:
My name is Concepcion and I sell clothes, make-up, tablecloths, ornaments and other household items. My clients are people who work for companies and neighbors from my community. Sales go up in December, because everyone wants to buy clothes or other items to give as gifts. With what I make from sales, I help my family.

Loan Use: Purchase Christmas tablecloths; women’s, men’s and kids’ underwear; lotions; make-up; etc.

Me llamo Concepcion y me dedico a la venta de ropa, maquillaje, manteles, adornos y otros articulos para el hogar, mis clientes son personas que trabajan en empresas y vecinos de mi colonia. Este mes de diciembre es de bastantes ventas porque toda las personas buscan comprar ropa u otros articulos para regalar. Con los ingresos que percibo de las ventas ayudo a mi familia.

loans.use: Compra de manteles navideños, ropa interior de dama, caballero y niño, lociones, maquillaje y otros

loans.name: Soifua

texts.en: Soifua and her husband live in the village of Safaato’a Tai with their four children, who are all in school. Her husband is a good swimmer and a strong fisherman who's skills inspired her to join the Pacific Business Development program so the could operate a fishing business. PBD has provided her with the confidence, guidance and group support that enabled her and her husband to get their business up and running. With the last loan of $1750, she purchased two fishing nets and a canoe. Now she is ready to grow her business by buying another fishing net and increasing their catch.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is an enterprising woman with a lot of desire to move up in the world. She is married and has two daughters, ages 23 and 25, the youngest of which is still going to school. A long time ago, Leticia was a secretary, but it didn't leave her much time to spend with her family. So, 18 years ago, she decided to start her own beauty shop. She started with a mirror and a chair in a corner of her home; she didn't have all the necessary equipment. But thanks to her hard work, she has a room in her home set aside for business and has arranged it, little by little, to offer her customers a better service.

Currently, she is well known within her neighborhood for her quality of service and has a lot of clients. With a lot of hard work, she has seen her business grow. She wants to this continue, so she's requesting a loan of $925, which will be used to buy the supplies needed to continue on her work — dyes, bleach, shampoos, etc. She plans to repay the loan within six to 12 months. You can play an important role in Leticia's success; please support her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Leticia es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de superación, ella es casada y tiene dos hijas, de 23 y 25 años de edad, su hija menor aún se encuentra estudiando. Anteriormente Leticia trabajaba como secretaria, pero tenia poco tiempo para dedicarle a su familia, por esta razón desde hace dieciocho años inició su propia estética, empezó con un espejo y una silla en un rincón de su casa, no contaba con el equipo necesario, pero gracias a su buen trabajo, después adaptó un cuarto de su hogar y lo fue acondicionando poco a poco para ofrecerle a sus clientes un buen servicio.

Ahora es muy conocida entre su colonia por la calidad de su servicio y tiene muchos clientes, con mucho esfuerzo ha visto crecer su negocio y quiere continuar haciéndolo para lo que solicita un crédito de $ 925 dólares, que empleará en la compra de materiales que necesita para la realización de su trabajo, como tintes, decolorantes, shampoo, etc., ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros de Leticia, no lo pienses más y decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies like dyes, bleach, shampoo and equipment

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Hi, I'm Rufina, and I have this small business selling shampoo and creams and gold. I sell in the workshops near my town, and I have very good clients who work in those workshops and are neighbors. Now, I need to buy more products, since I have several orders. For 2 years, I have worked selling these products. My goal is to increase my inventory to have greater variety of products. With the earnings, I will be able to support my family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Hola, yo soy Rufina tengo este pqueño negocio de de venta de shampoo y cremas y enchape de oro. Yo ahago mis ventas en las oficinas sercanas de mi pueblo, tengo muy buenas clientas las cuales son oficinsitas y vesinas. Ahora nesecito comprar mas producto ya que tengo varios pedidos. hace 2 años me dedico a la venta de estos productos. Mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor variedad de productos con las ganancias asi podre mantener a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of shamoo. face and body creams, glasses and gold

loans.name: Ape

texts.en: Ape S. is one of the members of Aleisa A center. Her business as mentioned above is growing vegetables such as cabbages, beans, spring onions, green pepper and cucumbers. Ape is one of the old ladies in this center and she is a hard working lady. This family also has no one working but all relies on the vegetables for survival. One thing good about this lady is that she is supplying one of the supermarkets in town name Lynn’s supermarket.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizers but especially for the equipments needed

loans.name: Asifa

texts.en: I am Asifa R. from Lahore, a big metropolis, and I have been married for three years. My husband and I operate a food stall in the nearby market, where we make and sell fried chicken pieces. Our customers really like the taste of our food. Therefore, day by day the number of customers is increasing. But we do not have the necessary funds to buy raw materials in bulk and respond to a greater number of customers. We need a loan to expand our business .

loans.use: Expand food business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther A. is married with three children. Her husband is also a trader. Esther is helping her husband with the family finances. Esther is a mobile trader.  She carries what she sells on her head and performs door to door sales. However, her door to door business is breaking her down. She wants to build a store and settle down.  She is asking for $1,200 to buy cement, iron rod, paints, and other building materials for the store she wants to build.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron rod, paints, and other building materials for the store she wants to build.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Queen Simkokofrom Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, aged 18,22, and 25. In 2006 Queen established a charcoal business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
The committee “San Francisco Group” is made up of 15 working women from the neighborhood of San Francisco in the city of Caacupé, Paraguay. They all make and sell “chipas” (traditional corn and cheese breads) as walking saleswomen. They are in their sixth cycle of the program sponsored by Mujeres Emprededoras (Enterprising Women), and their group is unusual in that it is the only committee made up of women who are all dedicated to the same activity. Generally group members pursue different endeavors.

The women of this group are dedicated to the making and sale of “chipas.” La chipa is a typicial dish in Paraguay, made from a base of starch, eggs and milk. It is similar to a cheese bread and eaten a lot in the region, so the demand for these products is quite high. La chipa is baked in a “tatakua,” which is a mud oven. The women of San Francisco Group prepare the chipa in the early morning so that at first light they can sell their baked breads fresh from the oven.

Mrs. Cándida L. notes that this group of women has a strong sense of solidarity. She recalls that two of the group members had health problems recently and the committee took action in order to help the ill women manage the costs of hospitalization and the purchase of medicines.

The group is requesting credit in order to purchase ingredients such as eggs, starch, cheese, milk, and other items for the making of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El comité está integrado por 15 señoras trabajadoras del barrio San Francisco de la ciudad de Caacupé, todas se dedican a la elaboración y venta de chipas en forma ambulante, ellas están en el 6to. Ciclo del programa comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y tiene una característica peculiar, es el único comité integrado por señoras que se dedican a una misma actividad, ya que por lo general las integrantes poseen actividades diferentes.

Estas señoras se dedican a la elaboración y venta de “chipas”. La chipa, es una comida típica de nuestro país, elaborado a base de almidón, huevos y leche, es parecido a un pan con queso y bastante consumido en nuestro país por lo que la venta de estos productos es bastante alta. La chipa es hormeada en “tatakua” que es un horno hecho de barro. Estas mujeres preparan durante la madrugada sus chipas para que a primeras horas de la mañana puedan vender sus chipas recién salidas del horno.

La señora Candida manifiesta que éste grupo de mujeres tiene un alto sentido de solidaridad cuenta que dos de las integrantes tuvieron problemas de salud recientemente y el comité realizó actividades para poder ayudar a costear los gastos de la internación y compra de medicamentos.

El crédito lo solicitan para la compra de ingredientes como huevos, almidón, queso, leche entre otros para elaborar sus productos.

loans.use: For the purchase of ingredients used to make chipas, such as starch, cheese, vegetable oil, firewood, flour, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van S., 44, is a vendor of a variety of grocery products and makes on average about $3 a day. Sometimes she helps her husband to refine sugar. Her husband supports the family by working as a palm tree climber, climbing up bamboo poles to tap the sap of  trees to boil and make palm sugar. Everyday he collects palm sap and refines it to sugar to sell in the market and earns around $8 a day of income. They have five children, one of who is married and lives away from the family. Two of their children contribute to the family’s income by working to collect palm sap with their father and one of their daughters is employed by a garment factory in Phnom Penh, earning a salary of $60 a month, the majority of which she sends home. In order to improve the family’s living conditions and give their younger son a better education, this couple is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a plot of land to farm in the dry season. The farm will give them a long term, stable source of income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to farm in the dry season.

loans.name: Anna's Amani Group

texts.en:
Anna is 42 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 24 and 22 years old. Anna owns a small grocery, which she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Anna has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rose, who has a salon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
The “Estrellas” Association is located in the center of Villa Tejada. Headed by its president, Mrs. Carmiña Gutiérrez, they have shown themselves to be an accomplished and organized group. Said group is comprised of sixteen members who have worked for more than one year with Pro-Mujer. The primary activity of these women is retail, dedicating themselves to the sale of vegetables, handmade chocolates, ice cream, and cell phone cases. They market their products in an ambulatory manner, given they do not count on established sites from which to sell their wares. The group needs additional capital to lease a stall/stand where they can be assured of making transactions. In this manner, they would generate more income to help improve the financial situation of their households.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación “Estrellas” pertenece al centro focal de Villa Tejada, a la cabeza de la Sra. Carmiña Gutiérrez como presidenta demuestran ser un grupo cumplido y organizado. El mencionado grupo esta formado por 16 socias que trabajan hace mas de un año con Pro-Mujer. El comercio informal es la actividad principal de estas mujeres, se dedican a la venta de fruta, chocolates artesanales, helados, estuches de celulares, productos que por lo general los ofrecen de manera ambulante, ya que no cuentan con puestos propios de venta por lo que necesitan mayor capital para el alquiler o compra de dichos puestos de venta lo que les aseguraría una venta segura de sus productos. De esta forma generarian mayores ingresos para mejorar la economia de sus hogares.

loans.use: Capital to lease and/or purchase their own stalls.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun H., 56, and his wife, Mrs. Kin Nao, 54, who live about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1970 and have nine children, six sons and three daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home. Of the remaining children, one is a carpenter, another a mason, another a farmer, and the last one a garment factory worker.

Mr. Savoeun and his wife have been farming since 1991, growing a variety of vegetables and fruits. Now he is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama D. is 37 years old, married and cares for eight children. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian village bank for two years, and trades in wax and thioub, a dyed fabric. Adama wishes to improve their living conditions, as well as the health and education of her children. She is seeking a loan which would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Adama D. 37 ans, mariée avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des wax et des thioubs(tissus teintés). Adama souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité des enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of thioub dyed fabrics and wax

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo G. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle tient le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine  à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle  souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité pour attirer beaucoup plus de clientèle et dégager plus de bénéfice. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
At 34, Adjo G. is married and the mother of three children. She owns a business selling kitchen utensils in Danyi, a village about 170 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this, her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to increase the size of her business to draw in more clients and turn greater profits. In so doing, she will contribute to a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dishes, bowls, and pans for resale

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat K. is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Okoko in Lagos State, Nigeria. Sarat owns a restaurant where she sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yams, and plantain. Her customers love her food, so the demands for her cooking is high. She hopes to retain her customers by meeting their demands.

Sarat is a LAPO Microfinance client and the leader of a lending group. She needs a loan for $850 to buy more bread and foodstuff to cook and sell to her customers. She thanks all the Kiva lenders and LAPO for their financial support.

loans.use: To buy more bread and foodstuff to cook and sell.

loans.name: Danilo Candelario

texts.es: Danilo Candelario P. Guido habita el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casado,  su esposa Arlin Rodríguez  es ama de casa, tienen 3 hijos, quienes todavía están a cargo de sus padres, Danilo trabaja en una organización llamada CENADE desempeñándose en el cargo de Ing. Agrónomo, tiene 7 años trabajando para esta organización. Danilo solicita el crédito para hacer varias mejoras en su casa de habitación, como por ejemplo,componer una parte del techo por donde se le filtra el agua cuando llueve
texts.en:
Danilo Candelario P. Guido lives in the region of Juan Ramon Padillo in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He is married, and his wife Arlin Rodriguez is a homemaker. They have 3 children and they are all still under their parents' care. Danilo works for an organization called Cenade, working under Mr. Agronomo. He has been working 7 years for this organization. Danilo is requesting this loan to make various improvements to their home, such as, for example, fixing a part of the roof where water seeps through when it rains.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel their home.

loans.name: Femmes De Gandiol 2 Group

texts.fr: L'écovillage de Mboumbaye est situé dans la région de Saint-Louis à 300 km de Dakar. La Population de gandiol s'estime à 13968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques dans la zone sont : le commerce, la pêche, le maraichage, l'élevage et l'extraction du sel. Présidé par Monsieur Ndické D. responsable de l'écovillage de Mboumbaye, les femmes du groupement ayant bénéficié d'un premier prêt qui leur avait permis de réaliser leurs rêves reviennent auprès de Kiva pour solliciter un renouvellement. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter des produits de grande consommation (poissons frais, légumes, fruits, épices et matériaux d'artisanat)trés recherchés par les populations locales qu'elles vont revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires et villages environnants.
texts.en:
The ecovillage of Mboumbaye is located in the Saint Louis region 300 km from Dakar. The population of Gandiol is about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities in the area are: commerce, fishing, truck farming, farming and extracting salt. However, due to the climatic decline and anthropogenic phenomena, the level of decline and disruption is felt by the entire community. The women of the Mouit group, having benefited from a first loan which allowed them to realize their dreams, are coming back to Kiva to seek a renewal. With this loan, they are going to buy mass consumption products (fresh fish, vegetables, fruits, spices and crafts materials), which are heavily sought after by the local populations.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fruits, fresh fish, crafts materials

loans.name: Bartolina Sisa Group

texts.es:
Quince miembros forman parte de la asociación “Bartolina sisa” , esta  pertenece al centro focal  Santiago II, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. 
Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo por ejemplo la venta de dulces, venta de F., pero la actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de  comida. Preparan almuerzo variados y los venden todos los días, pero con la venta de estos alimentos solo consiguen ingresos mínimos para cubrir gastos diarios tanto de sus casas como de sus negocios, necesitan mayor capital para ampliar su producción, por lo que necesitan comprar insumos en mayor cantidad,  de esta manera conseguir mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The "Bartolina Sisa" association comprises 15 members; it is located in the Santiago II neighbourhood of the city of El Alto.

The group members engage in a variety of activities, including the sale of sweets, and the sale of flowers, but they principally cook and sell food. They prepare varied lunches which they sell every day; this provides a small revenue to cover the day-to-day expenses of their homes and businesses.

Now they need more capital to expand production. They plan to buy larger quantities of raw materials with a view to increasing revenues and improving their living standards.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Hikmatullo

texts.ru: Зарипов Хикматулло житель города Вахдат. Проживает в центре города и там же имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Товар привозит из города Душанбе . Бизнесом занимается уже 4 года. Он женат , детей не имеет . Но готовится стать отцом. Кредит планирует получить для того , чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт в магазине. Создав лучшие условия он сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hikmatullo Z. lives in the center of Vakhdat. He owns a food store in the same neighborhood. Hikmatullo Z. has been in business for 4 years. He delivers his goods from Dushanbe. Hikmatullo Z. is married and is planning to become a father. Hikmatullo Z. will use this loan to renovate his store to attract new clients. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela trabaja tiene una tienda donde todas las tardes a partir de las 18:00 vende Pollos a la broster y salchipapas, el esposo es transportista de taxi; estas dos actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. La familia vive en alquiler  en una casa ubicada en la zona de Villa Mariscal Sucre Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra insumos por cantidad como ser papa, pollo, arroz, para de esta manera reducir el costo de los mismos e intentar mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el Tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Marcela owns a shop, where every afternoon from 6.00pm onwards she sells fried chicken and 'salchipapas', a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and french fries, mixed together and eaten with different sauces. Her husband works as a taxi driver. These two activities make up their principal income sources, with which they cover the costs of raising their three children. The family lives in a rented house in the Villa Mariscal Sucre Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy basic food supplies in bulk, including potatoes, chicken and rice. In this way she can reduce her expenses and try to increase her income. This is her third loan with Impro. Thanks to her good repayment history with the institution she is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, potatoes and other supplies in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Sharifan Ishaq Masih Group
loans.use: To buy animals for selling.

loans.name: Azizov

texts.ru: Азизов Хайдарали проживает в Джиликульском районе. Возраст 25 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. Работает  в сфере услуг. Имеет столовую в которой работает уже два года. Столовая находиться в центре района . На центральном рынке. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить инвентарь. Таким образом он сможет улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует  в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
H. Azizov lives in the Djikulskiy region. He is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children. He is occupied in 'services' sector of the economy. He has owned a cafe for the last 2 years. It is located in the central part of the city in the central market. He would like to obtain a loan to purchase additional equipment. That way, he will be able to improve the quality of his services and attract new customers. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, Southern Lebanon. Ali has owned a coffee shop since 1999. He also serves narguileh (also known as shisha in Egypt). Narguileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Narguileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East and is beginning to gain popularity in the U.S., Europe and other countries. Ali requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his coffee shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali is special in his work because people feel comfortable coming to his place. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started, he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the necessary tools and machines for his shop. He decided on doing this business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on enlarging his shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a coffee shop

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima P., 30, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in her banana plantation business. She sells three days per week to the village community and to the general public. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $115). Part of her loan will be used for school fees.

Tima has five previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, weedkiller ,pesticides. bushknives and fence wire and to pay school fees

loans.name: Julia Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Paraíso.
Karina es soltera, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Karina vendía cebiche en la casa de su mama pero actualmente esta terminando de construir su casa para aperturar su Marisquería en un local propio.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una congeladora.
Los sueños de Karina son Terminar de construir su casa, construir un hotel y estudiar gastronomía.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Paraíso Communal Bank.
Karina is 30 years old, single and has 2 children. Karina used to sell ceviche from her mother’s home but now she is finishing construction on her own house, where she’ll open her own seafood restaurant.
Karina needs a loan in the amount of 900 nuevos soles to go towards the purchase of a freezer.
Karina dreams of completing construction on her house, building a hotel and going to culinary school.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Go towards the purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Isoken

texts.en: Isoken E. sells provisions and drinks. She is 50 years old and married with seven children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Beatriz C. Dávila, tiene 47 años de edad actualmente separada, con cinco hijos, tres aún dependientes de ella. 
Ella participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde hace dos años y un mes, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “Las Solidarias”. Este ALCOM está conformado por once socios, quienes se dedican a la venta de comida, ropa, productos de belleza. Consuelo trabaja como vendedora de anticuchos desde los 35 años a raíz del abandono que sufrió de parte de su pareja conyugal, con este negocio toma la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos a los cuales les provee de los recursos necesarios. Es así que decide obtener un crédito con nuestra institución para incrementar su expectativa económica, lo que le permitió tener otro negocio más, como es la venta de productos de belleza; a fin de mantener y educar a cinco hijos. Con este préstamo Consuelo comprará mercadería de ropa, colchas que expenderá y le permitirá a futuro mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
La señora Consuelo Beatriz C. Dávila, tiene 47 años de edad actualmente separada, con cinco hijos, tres aún dependientes de ella. Ella participa en EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desde hace dos años y un mes, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en la alcancía comunal “Las Solidarias”. Este ALCOM está conformado por once socios, quienes se dedican a la venta de comida, ropa, productos de belleza. Consuelo trabaja como vendedora de anticuchos desde los 35 años a raíz del abandono que sufrió de parte de su pareja conyugal, con este negocio toma la responsabilidad de mantener a sus hijos a los cuales les provee de los recursos necesarios. Es así que decide obtener un crédito con nuestra institución para incrementar su expectativa económica, lo que le permitió tener otro negocio más, como es la venta de productos de belleza; a fin de mantener y educar a cinco hijos. Con este préstamo Consuelo comprará mercadería de ropa, colchas que expenderá y le permitirá a futuro mejorar su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar productos

loans.name: Yeimy Julissa

texts.es: Yeimy Julissa A. de 23 años de edad reside en el cantón Las Chinamas del departamento de Ahuachapán. Yeimy vive con su hermano de 12 años de edad y su hija de 8 años de edad. Yeimy se dedica a la venta de boquitas como yuca y papas fritas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su casa tiene nueve años de experiencia en la elaboración y venta del mismo, el crédito Yeimy lo solicita para la compra de materia prima, ya que desea aumentar su producción de boquitas para lograr obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Yeimy Julissa A. is 23 years old and lives in the county of Las Chinamas in the district of Ahuachapan. Yeimy lives with her 12 year old brother and her daughter who is eight. Yeimy sells snacks like fried yuca and potato chips for a living, and her business is loaced near her home. She has nine years of experience of making and selling these foods, and Yeimy would like a loan to buy raw ingredients as she would like to increase the production of these snacks in order to obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Fikret

texts.en:
"Dear friends! I need your help for improving my business again. I think that you have not forgotten me. Thank you very much! Good luck!" Fikret is applying for his second loan from Kiva. The first time he applied to Kiva in 2007, and he successfully repaid that loan.

Now he has his own butcher shop and he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy meat to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy meat for sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and currently has four children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in their community. She is a trader in fresh fish sales. She takes stock of fresh fish from Kumasi, which is a nearby city. She sometimes buys them on credit and repays her suppliers in a week's time. She said she buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has increased her market share within a few months and lots of people buy from her. Currently, she sells the fish at the market center. She needs the loan to buy bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. She dreams to save more to rent and store, and also to buy a fridge to enable her buy more fish. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell

loans.name: Mugobe Central Kalina Fambe Group

texts.en:
Kalina F. is a loan group representative. She is forty-six years old, married with two children and looks after two siblings. Kalina F. deals in cassava flour and silver fish which she has been selling for over nineteen years, since 1990. She is using the loan to purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale. 

The loan will improve her business and her dream is to build a house and educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida es una emprendedora mujer de 49 años, vive en su casa propia con su hija de 17 años llamada Saly. Desde hace 10 años se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos de librería en un puesto que tiene en un mercado cercano a su casa. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, ya que gracias a su trato amable y carismático ha logrado obtener muy buena cantidad de clientes, los cuales son muy fieles a su negocio. Ida siempre trata de tener su puesto bien abastecido, ya que no le gusta que un cliente consulte sobre algún producto y que ella no lo tenga a la mano, es por ello que su puesto tiene de todo. A Ida le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias a él se siente independiente y puede brindarle a su hija una buena calidad de vida, quien en algunas oportunidades, también acude al puesto para ayudarla con las ventas. Para el futuro, Ida quiere agrandar su bazar para lograr más ingresos económicos a favor de su familia. 
Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, ella siempre ha sido muy puntual en la cancelación de todos sus pagos y se compromete a seguir siéndolo. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para mejorar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ida is an enterprising woman of 49 years old. She lives in her own house with her 17 year old daughter named Saly. For the last 10 years, she has devoted herself to selling office and paper supplies in a stall at a market near her house. This business has proved to be quite profitable. Thanks to her friendly and charismatic manner with customers, she has been able to obtain a good number of loyal customers. Ida always tries to have her stand well supplied. She doesn't like not having an item that a customer specifically requests in stock, so she tries to have some of everything on hand. Ida enjoys her work very much because it makes her feel independent and she can provide her daughter with a high quality of life. Her daughter comes to the stand to help Ida with sales. In the future, Ida would like to expand her business in order to increase her income for her family. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She always has been very punctual with her payments and commits to continue being so. She will use the money she is asking for to buy a larger quantity of merchandise to increase her business' sales.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increased purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des oignons, des cubes, du piment

loans.name: Nosa

texts.en: Nosa is 30 years old and single. For the last seven years, he has made a living as a farmer. He has applied for this loan to buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm.  Nosa extends his thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings to plant and raise on his farm

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel V. is from the village of Panalsalan Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Rechel is married. To make a living, Rechel owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood to local community members. Rechel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rechel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rechel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from GDMPC. Rechel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rechel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
“At the back of hardships and difficulties, there is a valley of Success”, that's an inspiring quotation shared by Cerelina G., a responsible house wife of Eduardo G.. They live in a village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. They have four children; three of them are now in elementary level while the youngest is not yet studying. Being parents, they want their children to finish their studies so that they will be employ in the good job someday.
	In this regard, they help each other to cultivate their farm lots by planting rice and some vegetables twice in a year. Since they are financially shortened,Cerelina put-up a small general store in front of their house to earn additional income. Since she has inadequate capital, she wants to borrow from KIVA lenders an amount of P 5,000.00 to be able to increase her capital in improving her small store. She is thankful if the lenders will grant her request because it is a great opportunity to improve her small business and she hopes that she can able to increase her income and support the schooling of their children.

loans.use: additional capital to improve her general store

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 42 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers il y’a un peu longtemps de cela. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers tels que les habillements et les produits de premières nécessités. 
Les articles achetés en gros à Bamako et sur place, sont revendus sur place à MARKA COUNKO à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of Sabougnouma Group (the "good cause") are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have three children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families in the village of Marka Counko, subprefecture of Fana, in the region of Kolikoro of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighborhood and family links.

These women have been merchants of various articles for quite some time. They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure the long-term success of their businesses. This is their sixth solidarity loan. They have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

They will use this new loan to buy a large quantity of food condiments and various articles such as clothes and basic household necessities. They will buy these products wholesale in Bamako and on location, and then retail them in Marka Counko to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs each. They will reinvest part of their profit in their businesses and use part of it to contribute to the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Falak

texts.en: Falak has worked as a home-based hairdresser since 2005. She is 21 years old and living with her parents and 4 brothers and sisters. They cooperate together to provide a good living situation for the family. Today, Falak is asking to borrow $1,200 to purchase cosmetics products and hair accessories in order to enlarge her business and be able to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair accessories

loans.name: Tsendsuren

texts.en: Tsendsuren is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Khovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". His daughter and son currently attend a local secondary school. Tsendsuren operates a clothing trading business at a local trading center in his town with the help of his wife. Besides his business he works as a doctor in a police department in his province. Tsendsuren started his business in 2003. It has quickly grown over the last years and he has built a strong customer base. With his business earnings he was able to buy a car and a shipping container where he sells his clothing. Tsendsuren hope to build on his experience in the future and says, "I want to expand my business and have my own shop." He is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: Astou N. est une femme de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois de 12 ans et demi et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité qu'est l'élevage de mouton. ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou N. is a 39-year old woman who is married and has ten children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for twelve and a half years and has good experience in her business domain which is the rearing of sheep. Her income will allow her to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build up her rearing activity

loans.name: Loisith

texts.es:
La Sra. Loisith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años y 06 hijos, 05 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando, presenta Estudios de Secundaria Completa.

Loisith, decidió  por idea propia vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada cerca a un colegio de su Distrito,  lleva 05 años en el negocio, un lugar muy bien amplio y acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen, cuenta con muy buena acogida, con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, pollos en javas, arroz, azúcar en kilos así empezó creciendo y poco a poco fue muy reconocida.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles , comprará pollos en javas, arroz , azúcar en kilos , aceite en litros .También comprará algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Loisith, se siente muy segura y con ganas de seguir adelante y asegurarse una  vida tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Loisith belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work", which is located in the District of Juanjuí, Province of Mariscal Cáceres, Department of San Martín, Peru. She is forty-three years old, married, and has six children, five of whom still depend on her and are currently enrolled in middle school and high school. Loisith came up with the her business idea all on her own. She makes and sells prepared foods from a location situated near a school in her district. She has carried on this business for 5 years now, and she maintains a spacious and well-equipped workplace to suit her customers' needs as best she can. She tells us that her daily income is very good, on account of the special seasoning she uses on all the food that she prepares. Her main customers are either city residents, passers-by on the street, or regular customers who are already familiar with her food. She is able to count on a good turn-out of customers every day. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles, she bought bulk amounts of chicken, rice, and kilos of sugar. This enabled her to begin growing her business, and bit by bit her reputation grew. Today she continues with her same business, servicing the customers who continue to visit her every day. She personally attends to her customers to provide them with the delicious flavors and friendliness that characterizes her enterprise. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, she will buy more bulk chicken, rice and sugar, as well as liters of oil. She will also buy new kitchen utensils to replace the old ones she currently uses, enabling her to offer nicer service to her customers. Loisith feels very confident in her ability to continue succeeding with her business, and she is very motivated to continue working hard for her success, so that she can achieve a calm, happy life. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the assistance it has given her in achieving her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos como arroz , azúcar en kilos , etc.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn A. is from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Rubelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rubelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rubelyn has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rubelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rubelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Dy Morng

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy Morng T. is a villager who lives in the village of Chambak Tuem in Takeo province. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom has married, while the others are students in the local school. 

Mrs. Dy Morng now is requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to add to her savings to purchase a threshing machine for the business of her married child. Mrs. Dy Morng owns a small store in the local school in which she sells candy, cake, and so on.  Her husband is a teacher and earns a small salary to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a threshing machine

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
During her five years at ASHI, Annalyn has shown very good performance as a member, and, because of her solid performance, ASHI trusts her. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business, and attendance at center meetings, Annalyn has also cared for the needs of her children at home and in school.

Annalyn plans to utilize this loan of 20,000 PHP to expand and to support the maintenance of her general store as her family's primary source of daily income. This loan will be used for additional capital to pay for groceries for sale in her store, and she will use any remaining money to improve her small eatery business.

She hopes the loans from ASHI, KIVA's field partner, will support the education of her two children. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, and that it will provide for the educational needs of her children. Annalyn is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for the continuous love and support she receives for her dreams.

Annalyn R. is a devoted mother to her two children. She is married to her loving spouse, Reynaldo, who is a driver, and she lives in the province of Binangonan, Rizal. Despite many challenges in their life, they never gave up fighting against the umbrella of poverty.

About ASHI:
As a microfinance institution that uses the Grameen methodology and as the first practitioner in the field, Ahon sa Hirap (ASHI)--which means "rise above poverty" in English--saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money to provide cash flow for their families and to give their children a better life. Because the microcredit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly to their villages and on the doorsteps of their houses, the loans from ASHI are giving these women hope that someday they will rise above poverty.

loans.use: To pay for groceries for sale in her store and to improve her small eatery business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 31 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, entre lo que sobresale la venta de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. La señora ya tiene 4 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio con una prima, la cual en ese tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento tendrá buenas ventas en sema santa. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Verónica is 31 years old, and she has a three year old son. She sells clothes. Pants, shirts, skirts, and suits sell the most. She started her business four years ago. She started it with a cousin, who was selling used clothes at the time. Little by little she increased her inventory until she came to have the business she now has. The loan is to buy merchandise.
