If she buys now she will have good sales during Holy Week. Her dream has always been to improve her house. She intends to use the loan to invest more in her business so that it will be more profitable. That is where she will get the resources to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando D. P. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. He is 29 years old. Armando is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. He is also engaged in a bakery business where he cooks and sells bread. Armando has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Armando is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Armando from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan D. Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of eight people from Kor village in Takeo province, including Mrs. Yoeurn C.. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Yoeurn C. is a weaver at her home, which allows her to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Yoeurn C. is asking for a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Toum Yiv, is construction worker and she has five children -- three of whom are laborers, while the others are too small to work or study. Mrs. Langka Noem, Mr. Sem Suon, Mr. Lon Dieb, are group guaranties so they are also presented in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena A. is from the village of Linao East, Tuguegarao City. She is 53 years old. Magdalena is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP whenever she sells a pig she has raised.

In 2005, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Sok Kong's Group

texts.en:
The five people of this group loan selected Mrs. Sok Kong C. as their leader. The members live in An Long Barang village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion to support their own purpose.

Mrs. Sok Kong C., 41 years old, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates peanuts for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and peanut seed.

Her husband, Mr. Kim Eng Ong, is a government worker who receives a small salary to support his family. They have two children; one is a construction worker and the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and peanut seed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

La señora Juana, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es vender hortalizas y verduras como por ejemplo maíz, cebolla, orégano, papa y lizas. Sus actividades económicas complementarias es confeccionar chompas de lana, chullos, guantes, etc. También  se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más cereales y lana de alpaca.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is a half hour from the city of Cusco and one hour from the city of Urubamba. The people of Rayanniyoc work at farming and livestock production. Sra. Juana, 52, is married and has four children. Her main source of income comes from selling produce from her farm and garden: maize, onions, oregano, potatoes and "lizas". She supplements her income by making and selling wool sweaters, hats, gloves, etc. and by raising animals. Sra. Juana belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc community bank, a group attached to Asociacion Arariwa. She has been a member of the community bank for some years and has proven to be a responsible borrower, with a record of repaying her loans on time. She will use this loan to buy grains and alpaca wool.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Larch

texts.en:
Larch S., 30, is married and resides with his wife and child in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment industry. He sells a kind of traditional cake usually eaten in the afternoon and earns a gross income of USD 52 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike to transport and sell his food to various places in the town. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport food

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Nov M., age 28, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Since 1999, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to maintain her standard of living. She is married with a young child who is a primary school student. Her husband works in construction. In order to earn extra income, Nov M. will be using the loan to buy more pig feed and piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Ascencion

texts.es: Ascensión tiene 62 años de edad, vive sola en su casa propia pues no se caso ni tuvo hijos. Al tener grandes dotes culinarios, Ascensión vio por conveniente sacarle provecho, es por eso que gracias a mucho esfuerzo puso un restaurante en su propia casa, el cual es su principal ingresos económico y el gran motivo para salir adelante. Lleva 8 años trabajando y se siente satisfecha por las rentas que le genera, pues su sazón ha trascendido, eso le ha dado mucha ventaja frente a sus clientes, ahora es muy conocida ella y su establecimiento. En un futuro quiere tener un gran restaurante muy bien implementado y con más empleados que brinden al cliente un mejor servicio, pues siempre fue su gran sueño. Es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará gran cantidad de ingredientes para preparar mayor cantidad de platillos y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ascension, 62, lives alone in a house that she owns. She has never married or had children. She is a gifted cook and, realizing that she could make a living cooking for others, overcame the obstacles in her way to open a restaurant in her house. The business is her main source of income. She has operated the business for 8 years and is pleased with the income that it generates. Her food is tasty and well-prepared, an advantage for gaining customers, and she and the business are now well known in the area. In the future, Ascension wants to improve the restaurant and add more employees so that she can better serve her customers. This is her first MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale stocks of the supplies she needs to run the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny C. was born in Roluos village in Takeo province in 1985. She and her husband, Mr. Sophoun Souy, are farmers who own a 3-hectare plot of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She also sells beef at the local market, where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family, while her husband owns a mill.

It is time to grow the rice, but she does not have enough rice seed. So, to improve production Mrs. Ny C. is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, and to hire a plow machine to plow her field and farm laborers. She is a mother of two children who are both too small to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, 5 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Pelengana sud de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce des poissons, de glace, de calebasses et de pagnes wax. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia  Tébé est beaucoup connue et sollicité à Pelengana surtout pendant les périodes de mariage (début de la saison pluvieuse) pour la qualité de ses calebasses. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 colis de calebasses (environ une centaine de calebasses). Elle se ravitaille en calebasses à Tonan et à Ségou avec les forains de Noumou Wêrê pour celles qui sont gravées.  La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit et parfois sur commande, à domicile, au marché Château de Ségou et à Bamako à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Kadia  Tébé espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et épargner. 
Elle a pour objectif d’avoir un lot à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group named Benkadi are all married and live in monogamous families. On average they are 34 years old and have 5 children each. They live in the Pelengana South quarter in Segou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They are known through their famililes and through their neighbours and from their businesses in the Chateau de Segou market. The members of the group sell fish, ice, gourds, and clothing. With the goal of increasing their earnings the members of the group decided to integrate with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and they are on their seventh loan cycle. Mrs. Kadia Tebe is well known and sought out in Pelengana, especially during the wedding season (at the beginning of the rainy season) for the quality of the gourds she sells. She will use her loan to purchase 3 packs of gourds (about one hundred grouds). She stocks up her supply of gourds in Tonan and in Segou and in the fields of Noumou Were, for those that are decorated. She completes her sales in cash and in credit, sometimes taking orders from private homes and in the market Chateau de Segoup and in Bamako. Her clientele is mostly made up of women. With the help of this loan Mrs. Kadia Tebe hopes to earn a monthly income of 30FCFC which will be used to reinvest back into her business and part will be placed in savings. Her goal is to purchase a plot of land to build a house.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gourds.

loans.name: United Sisters I Group

texts.en:
Adama J. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born twenty-eight years ago in Magburaka town, Adama is single and has one daughter who is attending primary school. Adama is a hairdresser; she has been running a salon for many years now. She also sells soft drinks and cold water in her salon. Adama will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy hair extensions wholesale to sell in her salon. 

This is the second loan that Adama and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, they were able to increase the size and quality of their respective businesses.

loans.use: Buy hair extensions wholesale to sell in her salon

loans.name: Sherry Mae

texts.en:
Sherry Mae A., age 35, buys and sells canned goods, instant noodles, detergent powders, and other products in her sari-sari (variety) store. Sherry Mae has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. She and her husband have three school-aged children and live in the village of Tibanga, Iligan City. 
   
Earlier this year, Sherry Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sherry Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Sherry Mae is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and utilized as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Wangeci Ngutha

texts.en:
Wangeci has been operating her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 44 years old, married to Ngutha N., and they have six children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the cash to add more foodstuffs such as flour, rice, etc. for her retail shop.

In future, Wangeci hopes grow from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s sweetmeat-selling business. With the loan, her husband will buy necessary items such as sugar, milk, and dried fruits in larger quantity that will help him to make larger quantities of sweetmeats to meet the demand of his customers and to expand his business. 

She lives in Khanewal which is a small city located in Punjab province, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a single-room brick house with her family in the area called Railway Landy. She moved here after her marriage to A. A. 14 years ago. She has given birth to 2 daughters and 2 sons. Her daughters are studying while her sons are too young to attend school. 

She herself is a housewife and stays at home, doing her household work and taking care of her children. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application.  She is hopeful that this loan investment will be a profitable one for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy necessary items for sweetmeat-selling business

loans.name: Pruk

texts.en: Pruk K., age 57, makes a living by working as staff in an office in the province of Kompong Tom. She has been employed in this manner for over ten years and has a formal salary very month. Pruk K. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has five children; one is married and four are single. Pruk K. depends on the income from her three children who work overseas in Thailand. Beside this work, she has also been planting the rice crop that is her annual business. Pruk K. is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy a cow to help plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow farmland

loans.name: Carmen Italica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Los Andes.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella lleva dos ciclos  en el Banco Comunal y dice que está muy a gusto porque ha recibido muchos beneficios de parte de la Fundación Espoir para sacar su negocio adelante. Tiene 47 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene  6 hijos, 4  de ellos ya son mayores y tiene  dos de 16 y 12 años y los dos estudian en colegio. Su marido es ebanista.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  zapatillas y sandalias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días tres horas por dia, su mercadería la compra en Portoviejo, en la actualidad espera con este crédito empezar a vender ropa ya que estos productos tienen más salida en esta temporada.
 
Por eso este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar ropa de todo tipo y aprovechar la temporada  para ganarse un buen dinero. Su sueño es tener una casa mas grande.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds since colonial times, the communal bank "Los Andes" meets every 15 days.  

Here we find Carmen, who has been with the communal bank for 2 loan cycles.  She says that she is very pleased because she has received benefits from being part of the Fundación Espoir which have helped her to succeed with her business.  She is 47 years old, and is in a common-law marriage which has produced 6 children.  Four of her children are grown, and the other two, aged 16 and 12, are in school.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

Carmen has a retail business selling sneakers and sandals.  She sells door-to-door, and works every day for 3 hours per day.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo, and now hopes with this loan to start selling clothing, since these products sell well in this season.

With this loan she will purchase all types of clothing, taking advantage of the season to earn good money.  Her dream is to have a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat B. lives in Ljevan city.  She is married and has 3 sons.  Her two sons are already married and live separately from their parents. 
Arevhat works at Ljevan city’s court as a secretary and at the same time she is engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding. 

Arvehat says her husband and parents-in-law (who are already retired on a pension) helps her a lot in this occupation.  On her farm she has some cows, chickens and turkeys; and in her garden she grows prolific trees such as apple and pear trees, etc.
 
Arevhat says farming take a lot of time, but it is profitable.  She wants to organize swine breeding on her farm, so she is asking for a 900.000 AMD loan, which she will spend to buy some pigs.  She also wants to buy fodder for her farm animals.  She plans on using the future income for barn repairs.  
This is Arevhat's 3rd loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some pigs and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is from Bethlehem City and a mother of seven children.  She has a small store in the city that her father gave her after she was divorced.  Her father gave her the store so that she could start her own business and take care of her children.  Najah was a housekeeper before she received the help from her father.

Najah came to Kiva partner FATEN to request a second loan.  This loan will be used to purchase goods to sell and secure an income for her family.  

Najah appears in the picture at FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase cloths to sell in the store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila P. C. de 32 años de edad vive en el caserio San Juan Bautista. La Sra. tiene su negocio de venta de ropa en la cual vende los días sábados y domingos. Su sueño segun nos comenta es incrementar su negocio y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. Lucila está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Señora Lucila P. C., aged 32, lives in the hamlet of San Juan Bautista. She has a business selling clothes in which she sells on Saturdays and Sundays. Her dream, she told us, is to expand her activity so that she can give her family a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we provide through this funding.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Cocal Group

texts.es:
La señora Efrocinia A. Pérez, vive en la Ribera el Aguacate, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Celin Pérez Juárez, en donde  procrearon  cinco hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad y son: Luis Fabián de doce años, Ignacio Eduardo de  diez, Víctor Manuel de ocho años, Fabricio Germán de seis y la más pequeña es Paola Daniela de cinco años.

         Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado), o en pie, en esta actividad lleva ocho meses y comenta que le va bien.
 
         Por su propia idea inicio con esta actividad ya que también quiere apoyar a su esposo con  los ingresos  de su hogar  y así sacar adelante a sus hijos.

         De las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad para que su mercancía no esté limitada y sus clientes estén satisfechos con  la atención brindada.

        Lo que más desea es que  logre tener su propia pollería, para que con ello logre ahorrar y poder darle lo mejor a sus  hijos que estudios.

       Las personas que integran el grupo son las siguientes:

       Efrocinia A. Pérez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollos por reja para luego venderlo aliñados (destazado) o en pie.

      América Pérez E.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de  ropas para dama y caballeros.

      Lorena Juárez A.. invierte el préstamo e la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda abarrotes.
texts.en:
Efrocinia lives in Ribera el Aguacate, in the municipality of Copainala, part of Chiapas state, México. She is married to Celin, and they have 5 children in their care:12 year old Luis Fabián, 10 year old Ignacio Eduardo, 8 year old Víctor Manuel, 6 year old Fabricio Germán and the littlest, 5 year old Paula Daniela.        
She is requesting a loan to buy farm chickens and later sell them seasoned (cut up) or alive. She has been doing this for 8 months and says that it is going well.
She started this business on her own initiative as she wants to help her husband with the household income and so help her children to be successful. 
She will use the income that she gains through this work to ensure that she has sufficient supplies and that her customers are satisfied with the attention she offers.
What she most wants is to have her own store selling poultry, because that would enable her to save and give the best to her children who are in school.
The following people are members of her loan group:
Efrocinia: will use the loan to buy chickens and later sell them seasoned (cut up) or alive.
América: will use the loan to buy men's and women's clothing.
Lorena: will use the loan to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy chicken and later sell it seasoned (cut up) or alive.

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis de 39 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la carpintería, este negocio se fundó hace 6 años, por iniciativa propia cuando ingreso como empleado de una carpintería, ahí Fredis aprendió lo necesario para trabajar por su propia cuenta, trabajando de lunes a domingo de 6:00am a 5:00pm.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de madera, pintura, clavos y pegamentos, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener a su disposición todos los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de muebles, también será ayuda porque sus trabajos los realizara de una forma más eficiente y rápido.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio en las mejores condiciones, desempeñar su trabajo cada día mejor, y prosperar económicamente.
texts.en:
Fredis is 39 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel where he works as a carpenter. He started his business six years ago when he was still employed at a carpentry shop. There he learned everything he needed to know so that he could work on his own. Fredis currently works Monday through Sunday, from 6am to 5pm.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood, paint, nails, and glue. This investment will enable him to have all the necessary materials at his disposal for making furniture. Fredis will also be able to complete his work in a more efficient and timely manner.

His goals include maintaining his business under the best conditions, completing his work each day, and prospering financially.

loans.use: Purchase wood, paint, nails, and glue

loans.name: Sobeyda

texts.es:
Con su anterior credikiva, Sobeida logró comprar pescados y mariscos en mayor cantidad, así fue como ligeramente aumentó  su capital de trabajo, y quedó muy feliz con esta inversión;  esta es la razón por la cual volverá a invertir para responde a nuevos clientes que   están solicitando sus productos, ella está aplicando a  su segundo credikiva con el cual comprará pescado aprovechando que se acerca la semana santa   y desde ahora los fieles que conservan la tradición de no consumir carnes en este periodo,  están a la expectativa de comprarle el fresco y delicioso  pescado que ella vende. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Sobeida pude acceder al siguiente enlace:
http:// kiva.org/lend/170475
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Sobeida managed to buy fish and seafood in larger quantities.  In this way, she managed to slightly increased her working capital and was very happy with her investment.  For this reason, she will invest once again, in order to respond to new customers who are requesting her products.  She is applying for her second Kiva loan which she will use to buy fish, taking advantage of the fact that 'Semana Santa' (Holy Week) is approaching and the faithful maintain the tradition of not eating meat during this period.  They expect to buy the fresh and delicious fish that she sells.  If you would like to know more of Sobeida's story, you can click on the following link: http:// kiva.org/lend/170475

loans.use: to buy fish wholesale

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhin M. (in the photo with her loom) is a widow with six children--two sons and four daughters. Four are married and live outside the family home; one has full-time employment and another one stays at home. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Chhin is a weaver. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support two children. She is married and has a Ready-To-Wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Estela requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Estela is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor branch, a rural town whose economy depends on agriculture. She sells clothes, shoes and underwear, operating a miscellaneous sales business in her house. She is a 30-year-old single mother of two.

Ana is very excited to be receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza Internacional. She has had her business for around 5 years, and it started thank to her first loan with Esperanza. She is very thankful to have received this loan and she will use it to buy jeans, shirts, blouses, slippers, sandals, underwear and other items to increase her sales. She plans to use her business profits to reinvest in the business and to make some changes in her house. 

Ana tells us that the most difficult challenge right now is to study; she wants to complete a postgraduate or masters degree. Ana likes to run and exercise. She is hoping for God  to bless her family with a safe life and an improved business. Thank you for supporting this loan!

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and underwear

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Садуллоева Ибодат проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, имеет двоих детей. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии она работает 15 лет. Кроме того Ибодат занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает канцелярские товары. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. В продвижении бизнеса ей помогает ее сын. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. То есть для покупки книжек, карандашей, ручек, тетрадей (общих и простых), фломастеров, альбомов, маркеров и ватманов.
texts.en: Ibodat S. lives in Vahdat. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She has a higher education in pedagogy.  She has been working in her trade for fifteen years. Additionally, Ibodat works in trade. She has a shop where she sells office supplies. She has been doing this work for seven years. Her son is helping her advance her business. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she offers. She is going to purchase books, pencils, pens, thick and thin composition books, felt-tip pens, albums, markers and flipcharts.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods she sells.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel Mesias tiene 29 años, es soltero vive  con  los padres  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar, no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Manuel se considera como una persona honesta y trabajadora, le gusta festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Mesias is 29 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He has no children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Cooperativa Patrón San Miguel” (St. Michael’s Cooperative) meet in the neighborhood of Pailaloma, which is located 60 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in the canton of Chillanes. This Communal Bank has 13 members who engage in farm activities that involve growing corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Manuel is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. His supplies are purchased in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month. He sells his goods at the fair every Sunday in Chillanes.

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially to access what he needs to increase production. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to have a house of his own.

Manuel is considered to be an honest and hardworking person. He enjoys celebrating the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Piñas Coladas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Piñas Coladas". Está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Martina es integrante del grupo. Tiene 44 años, estudió hasta la primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años ya que en ese tiempo tuvo problemas económicos ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo por lo que ella busco oportunidades y así pudo emprender este pequeño negocio. Solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancia. Sus clientes son personas en general. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente entusiasmada ya que con este prestamo comprara más mercancia.   Quiere este prestamo para comprar zapatos de diferente marcas y diseños además de economicos que se amolde a la economia de sus clientes. También espera que con el préstamo peda surtirse para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia, brindandoles a sus hijos una mejor educación ya que desea ver a sus hijos con una carrera profesional. Observaciones la señora que no se ve bien en la foto se llama, Dulce.
texts.en:
This group is called "Piñas Coladas" and it is located in the State of Puebla, Mexico.  The group has nine members.  Martina is one of the members.  She is 44 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  She is married and has two children.  Martina's business is selling shoes.  She started her business three years ago since she had some financial problems as her husband didn't have any work.  For this reason, she looked for opportunities and started her own small business.

Martina is requesting this loan to buy merchandise.  Her customers are the general public.  At the time of requesting this loan she is feeling enthusiastic because she will use her loan to buy more merchandise.  She would like to use her loan to buy different brands of shoes, in different styles.  She will also buy cheaper shoes that are affordable to her customers.  Martina hopes that this loan will enable her to stock her business so that she and her family can enjoy a better quality of life.  She hopes to provide her children with a better education since she would like to see them study for a degree.

(Note: the lady who can't be seen very well in the photo is called Dulce)

loans.use: to invest in footwear

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Bayarsaikhan is a 52 year old retiree who he lives with his wife and 5 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He owns a small  plot of and the family house on it.  His 5 children are between 19 and 28 years of age, but none of them have married yet and currently his family live quite crowded all together. Bayarsaikhan is a former policeman who had worked as a policeman for 30 years. In 2009 he retired and bought a car with the lump sum which he received at retirement. Currently he is running a taxi business using his family car. Bayarsaikhan is planning to buy an another car and give it to his eldest son. He wants him to run a taxi business as well bringing extra income to the family. Bayarsaikhan has 1800 USDs in his savings and he needs another 2800 USDs to buy a good second hand car. The loan Bayarsaikhan is taking will be combined with his savings to buy the car.

loans.use: To pay for the car which he is buying. The car will be used by his eldest son as a taxi and bringing extra income to the family.

loans.name: Norman  David

texts.es: Don Norman, de 51 años,  habita en la ciudad de León, tiene tres hijos. Norman es un hombre multifacético pues el realiza varias actividades para ganarse el pan de cada día de manera honrada el es técnico reparación y mantenimiento de refrigeradora, es barbero y comerciante, dueño de una pequeña pulpería la cual tiene en su casa de habitación. Tiene 20 años de ser comerciante pues en los años 80 el tenia un Bar- comideria  tuvo este negocio por 15 años , hace 5 años fue que decidió dedicarse a reparar refrigeradoras, aprender barbería y poner una pequeña pulpería donde vende agua, gaseosas, jugos su esposa e hijos lo ayudan atender el negocio. El requiere el préstamo para invertir en comprar de materiales y equipos de barbería, herramientas para trabajar en  refrigeración e invertir en compra gaseosas y jugos para su pulpería. Con esta inversión espera poder realizar su trabajos de refrigeración mas rápido, tener equipos de trabajos que le permitan trabajar con mas agilidad en su barbería y aumentar el inventario de su pulpería para mejorar sus ingresos. Sus próximas metas son mejorar el local de su barbería, tener una pulpería bien establecida y comprar una moto para trabajar.
texts.en:
Norman, 51, lives in the city of León.  He has three children.  Norman is a multifaceted man because he’s involved in a variety of jobs to earn his daily bread in an honorable way.  He is a refrigeration technician, a barber and a merchant; he owns a small, home-based grocery store.

He’s been a merchant for 20 years because back in the 80s he had a small bar/eatery that he had for 15 years.  Five years ago he decided to go into refrigeration repairs, learn barbering and set up a small grocery store where he sells water, soft drinks and juice.  His wife and children help him tend to the store.

He needs the loan to buy barbering supplies and tools, tools to work in refrigeration and to buy soft drinks and juice for the grocery store.  With this investment he will be able to do the refrigeration jobs more quickly, have work tools that will allow him to work in the barber shop more efficiently and the stock in his grocery store will improve income.  His next goals are to improve the barber shop’s locale, to have a better established grocery store and to buy a motorcycle for work.

loans.use: to buy barber shop supplies, tools for refrigertion repair work and to buy soft drinks and juice for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling maize flour, wheat flour and sugar at the market to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business to establish rental houses in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu because of favorable loaning procedures.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Leonora has a fish stall in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Leonora has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Ursula Consuelo

texts.es: La Sra. Úrsula, quiere tener una mejor condición de vida y por ello ha venido trabajando muchos años para conseguirlo; su principal negocio es la venta de cosméticos de las marcas BELCORP, AVON, UNIQUE Y LEONISA; ha trabajado así por más de 11 años, su principal sueño es ser la vendedora que mas haya vendido en la ciudad de Ica, el crédito lo va a invertir para una necesidad personal que es la construcción de una pared en su casa por seguridad. La Sra. Úrsula está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sra. Úrsula wants to have better living conditions, so she has worked many years in order to achieve this goal. Her main business involves selling cosmetics of various brands such as Belcorp, Avon, Unique, and Leonisa. Úrsula has worked in this business for more than 11 years. Her main wish is to be the most successful sales representative in the city of Ica.

Her loan will be invested in a personal expense, the construction of a wall in her house for safety reasons. Sra. Úrsula is very grateful for the loan that has been provided.

loans.use: to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking 45-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. For the last 12 years, he has been selling vegetables in order to make ends meet. He supplements his income with the earnings he makes from farming. He wants, in the next 5 years, to be a leading supplier of vegetables in the major hotels in the country. He is requesting a loan of 100000 Kenya shillings to buy courgettes and capsicum. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy courgettes and capsicum

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old and married with four children aged between 25 and 15 with the last born still in school.  She has been in farming for 20 years producing cabbage, maize, potatoes, carrots, and beans which are all sold to the local market.

Jane has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds for a poultry farming business.  She says the poultry business will give her security when her farm crops fail due to poor rains.  She adds that she will also use the income to educate her youngest child.

Jane notes that animal diseases and poor market prices for produce are the challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Otoño Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Otoño, está conformado por la señora Casilda va a comprar con su crédito tazas, juegos de platos, jarras con vasos de cerámica, la señora Tomasa va a comprar perfumes, cremas, labiales y cosméticos,  la señora Angelina va a comprar alimento para animales y medicamento para su veterinaria, la señora Columba va a comprar carne, cilantro, cebolla, tortillas, chiles etc. para sus tacos, la señora Angelina va a comprar peinetas, pinzas, donas, diademas, bolitas, etc. la señora Leonor va a comprar calzado para dama, caballero y niños, la señora Natividad va a comprar huaraches de dama caballero y niño, la señora Clara va a comprar topperware, el señor Urbano va a comprar vidrio, aluminio, metal para elaborar ventanas y puertas. La señora Leonor tiene 57 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad ya trabajan, ella vende calzado por catalogo de la marca Andrea y Class, ella solicito su crédito para comprar calzado para estudiante de dama, caballero y niños para este inicio de clases los da en abonos, ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años, por necesidad para tener ingresos, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, ella ofrece a sus clientes botas, tenis, huaraches, zatatillas y zapato de dama cabarrero y ninos, ella se siente orgullosa de atender a sus clientes de dar los zapatos en facilidades de pagos, las ganancias las vuelve a invertir, ella está planeando ampliar las ventas yendo a las comunidades mas cercanas a ofrecer sus productos, ella está feliz con este préstamo le va a ayudar a surtir sus pedidos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son que sus hijos formen su propia familia y que vivan bien, ver crecer a sus nietos. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a fundación Realidad “Les agradecemos mucho el apoyo que nos están dando, que Dios les bendiga y que sigan ayudando a las personas que lo soliciten”.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Otoño [Fall]. Señora Casilda is going to use her loan to buy cups, sets of plates and ceramic vases. Señora Tomasa is going to buy perfumes, creams, lipsticks and cosmetics. Señora Angelina is going to buy animal feed and medicine for her veterinary surgery. Señora Columba is going to buy meat, coriander, onion, tortillas, chilis etc for her tacos. Señora Angelina is going to buy combs, hairgrips, hair donuts, hairbands, hair bobbles etc. Señora Leonor is going to buy shoes for men, women and children. Señora Natividad is going to buy sandals for men, women and children. Señora Clara is going to buy Tupperware. Señora Urbano is going to buy glass, aluminum and metal to make windows and doors. 

Señora Leonor is 57 years old, she is married and has 4 adult children who work. She sells mail-order shoes from the Andrea y Class brand. She is applying for her loan to buy school shoes for men, women and children for the start of this term and she will accept payment installments. She started her business 7 years ago out of the necessity to make an income. She offers her products to her neighbors, friends and family. She provides her customers with boots, trainers, sandals, slippers and shoes for men, women and children. She is proud to be able to offer her customers repayment facilities. She reinvests any profits she makes. She is planning to increase her sales by going to nearby communities to sell her products. She is happy with this loan as it will help her to fill her orders. Her hopes and dreams are that her children will have their own families, that they have a good life and that she will see her grandchildren grow up.

The members of the group have the following message for Kiva and Fundación Realidad: “We are very grateful for the support that you are giving us, God bless you and may you continue to help the people who need it”.

loans.use: to buy school shoes for men, women and children.

loans.name: Dianalan

texts.en:
Dianalan is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Dianalan has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has run this business for six years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Dianalan is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Saruni Ole

texts.en:
Saruni is currently married and is a father to two children. He is still a farmer and wheat farming is his specialty.
 
He has been a good client and currently he is applying for his second loan which he plans to use to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to make profit and use the amount to purchase sheep for fattening and resale in future.

His dreams are to become a well-known farmer in the area in the future as he is a hard-working man who can do more if supported.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
This is Flocerfida, 61, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Aniceto, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband and children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. 

Flocerfida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Flocerfida hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and so she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Karin Pilar

texts.es: La socia sigue administrando su negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construccion, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue, la socia compra arena, ladrillos, cemento para la venta ella desea a futuro crecer y mejorar sus ventas, la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillos, arena para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: Karin Pilar continues administering her business buying and selling construction materials. She works alongside her husband. Karin Pilar buys sand, bricks and cement to sell and hopes in the future to grow and improve her sales. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of cement, bricks and sand to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Gloria Nohelia

texts.es:
A sus 36 años de edad, Nohelia es una emprendedora que desde hace algunos años se dedica a la confección a terceros y actualmente genera 3 empleos a personas de Bello, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín en donde vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. 

Nohelia inició con su negocio con la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia y así tener una mejor calidad. En el futuro, esta emprendedora espera tener su propia línea de ropa y un local propio para trabajar. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas e insumos para producir mayor cantidad de productos y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At 36 years old, Nohelia is an entrepreneur who for some years has worked creating for subcontractors and currently has 3 employees from Bello, the metropolitan area of Medellin where she lives with her husband and her two children.

Nohelia began her business with the hope of increasing the family income and thus to have a better quality of life. In the future, this entrepreneur hopes to have her own line of clothing and her own facility in order to work. Right now she needs a loan in order to buy fabric and supplies in order to make more products and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Luis's Group

texts.es:
Luis's group está conformado por tres personas, dos mujeres y un hombre, estas personas son trabajadoras y muy responsables, les gusta emprender. Luis es el presidente del grupo debido a que es una persona sincera y responsable en su trabajo. 

Luis es viudo, vive con sus cuatro hijos en Salcedo que está ubicado a 40 minutos de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador.

Luis tiene una panadería, empezó con su negocio gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres, actualmente no tiene buenos ingresos económicos ya que no hay mucha producción de pan, es por eso que acude a Fodemi a realizar su primer crédito para invertir en la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos entre otros que le ayudarán a poder cumplir con los pedidos y poco a poco va a ir incrementando sus ventas y sus ingresos van a ser mejores. Gracias a esta inversión Luis podrá seguir dandoles el estudio a sus hijos.

Su sueño es tener buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis’s group consists of three individuals, two women and one man. They are hardworking and responsible people who enjoy being entrepreneurs. Luis serves as the president of the group because he is sincere and responsible in his work.

Luis is a widower and lives with his four children in Salcedo, which is located 40 minutes away from Latacunga in the central mountains of Ecuador. He manages a bakery. Luis started this business thanks to the knowledge that his parents passed on to him. At the moment, he does not generate a good income because he does not produce much bread. For this reason, he approached FODEMI to secure his first loan. He will invest in the purchase of flour, butter, eggs, and other supplies that will help him complete his orders. Over time, he will be able to increase his sales and improve his income. Thanks to this investment, Luis can continue providing an education for his children. His dream is to have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs, and other supplies.

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржан 27 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей двух и трех лет. Нуржан работает учителем английского языка  в сельской школе. К сожалению, заработная плата учителя не позволяет Нуржан покрыть все расходы своей семьи и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода, ее семья занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Нуржан насчитывает одну корову, одну лошадь, два теленка и десять баранов, а  также она возделывает  1,20 га земли, выращивая картофель и фасоль. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Нуржан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых овцематок. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en:
Nurjan is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, aged 2 and 3.  She works as an English language teacher at a village school.  Unfortunately, her teaching salary does not allow Nurjan to cover all of her family's expenses.  Livestock breeding and crop-farming are an additional source of income for Nurjan and her family.  As of today, there are one cow, one horse, two calves and ten sheep on Nurjan's farm.  She also cultivates 1.20 ha of land where she grows potatoes and beans.  

In order to further increase the livestock numbers, Nurjan sought help from Bai Tushum & Partners and asked for a loan in the amount of KGS 70000 to purchase pure-bred ewes.  Nurjan is planning on investing the earnings from the loan into the livestock, which will allow her to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 35 years old, married, and has three children currently going to school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalie has been pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed fourteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 46 years old, married to John and has five children. She has been operating a second-hand clothes shop and making balls from leather, fabric and paper for the last 11 years. She makes a monthly profit of 13,200 Kenyan Shillings. 
She is applying for her first loan with Kiva partner KADET to buy second-hand clothes and materials for making balls. The profits will be used to expand her business. Elizabeth's dreams are to grow her business into a large retail store and produce balls on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale and materials for making balls.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children between the ages of 4 and 8. She describes herself as aggressive and determined. She operates a butcher shop where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good environment for sales. In addition, she also provides rental house services. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat. Faith's business goal is to run more butcher shops within five years.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a married woman with two children, neither of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a grocery selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the perishability of products leading to incurring losses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 52 year old widow. She has 3 children and is a refugee who fled from Nagorno Karabakh in 1993. She is homeless and temporarily rents her relative\'s flat.

Jamila is the only person to earn income for her family. For this purpose, she opened her fruit counter in 2001. Having insufficient working capital, she started her business with limited volume.

In 2004, she borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded her business slightly. After this Jamila could not only cover the food consumption needs of her family but also deal with other health and clothing expenses for her family.

Now, Jamila wants to borrow to expand her business further in volume and variety to be able to increase her family income and deal with the education expenses of children and other consumption needs.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and digital scales

loans.name: Urima

texts.en: Urima is a happy mother from the village of Leusoalii, and is married with three school children. She sells different kinds of handicrafts such as bags, ula tifa, earrings, tie dye lavalava and puletasi in a flea market. She works six days a week and uses her income to support her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase Samoan bags, which sells very well in her business.

loans.use: 10 boxes of Samoan bags

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married and has one daughter. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at the market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Svetlana has been in business for over 10 years. Currently she has about $1,600 in gross income each month, and her monthly net profit amounts to $500.

Svetlana has an enterprising spirit. She is very hard-working and perseverant. The success she has achieved in her business is a direct result of her efforts and commitment to her work. Svetlana has repaid each of her loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies.

Svetlana would like to get a loan for $500 to increase her assortment of clothing items so she can better present the benefits of her products and services to her customers. She always tries to offer a nice variety of stylish and unique outfits for ladies and avoids copying the products of other markets vendors. Svetlana has built a good reputation for the quality of her products and support services. We believe that her constant quest to improve her business and services will help her achieve continued success and enable her to repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Barat

texts.en:
Barat U. lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 35 years old and has three children. Barat has been raising sheep for 10 years. 
He would like to a  loan of $1200  to buy 10 sheep and 200 baling presses.

loans.use: To increase his flock of sheep and buy equipment for his livestock operation

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a widow of 51. Her husband passed away a year ago and so she's living with her parents and one child. Supporting her family has been a hard task for Pelenatete, especially since she had not been working outside her home to support her child before her husband died.

Pelenatete decided to join SPBD and with her first loan she bought herself a sewing machine. She's planning to develop her sewing business into a bigger one, and hopefully, to display her own designs and fashions in future.

loans.use: To expand her newly started sewing business

loans.name: Kubra

texts.ru:
Kubra Q. was born in the city of Agsu in 1956. She is married and has three children. She has been working in this business for more the 10 years. The pharmacy, however, needed repairs. This is why Kubra has come to Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) in search for help. Her first loan allowed her to fix her pharmacy. She is looking to secure a second loan to be able to increase the selection of products she has to offer.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Караева Кубра уроженка города Ахсу. Родилась в 1956 году.Замужем . Имеет троих детей. Стаж работы в этой сфере уже более десяти лет. Аптека нуждалась в ремонте. Кубра обратилась за помощью в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала . Взяв кредит она отремонтировала свою аптеку. Она вторично обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала чтобы расширить ассортимент товаров.

loans.use: To increase the selection of goods

loans.name: Asiman

texts.en: This 42-year-old man lives in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has a child. This man has run a farming business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: He would like to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en: Hasifah is 37 years old. She distributes tap water. With the extra profits, Hasifah intends to pay water bills and more airtime for her public pay phone.

loans.use: To connect another water tap

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn lives along National Road Number 05 on the way to Battambong Province. She married in 2002 and has a son and a daughter. She has finished grade seven in a secondary school, but her husband, Vuthy, has finished a university degree and her son is studying in a kindergarten school. She learned to sew from a neighbor and started her own business in 2001. Meanwhile, her husband teaches English at home. He has taught for over seven years.

Mrs. Thoeurn is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $700 to buy clothes and fix the house where she lives.

loans.use: To buy clothes and fix her house

loans.name: Ashura's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 48 years old and is a widow with 7 children, aged 30, 26, 25, 18, 16, 13, and 12. She also takes care of 1 other person, aged 90. Ashura sells clothes and makes batiks, and she started her business in 2001. Every day she works from 8:00 AM to 8:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Ashura now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sou V., 43 years old, lives with her husband and four children in the city of Phnom Penh. They have lived here since 1985. Everyday, she and her husband, Mr. San Sor, age 42, make brooms and sell them door=to-door. Sometimes, they also sell these in the market, earning around $10 per day in revenue. One of their children is employed by a garment factory; two others help their mother building brooms, and the last one is a student.

To increase business revenue, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase the grass to make the brooms (In Cambodia the brooms were made by a certain type of grass). When she receives the loan from Kiva, she can then produce a higher number of brooms to sell at the market , thereby enabling them to earn more profits to support the family.

loans.use: To increase capital and make more brooms.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 6 and 1 year old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 48 and 50 years old. Amina owns a small general store and she is market seller, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 8.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Thi Luong

texts.vi:
Ms. Luong Thi N. is 35 years old. She works as a seamstress, and her husband works as a construction contractor. They have two small children. In the past the couple has borrowed from the Bank of Agriculture and Regional Development and repaid the loan. She joined the Fund because of the way it is able to save her money. She is borrowing 2,006,000 Viet Nam Dong (VND) to buy a sewing machine to do sewing work at home. The family’s income is more than 300,000 VND per week. Ms. Nguyet Thi Duong is borrowing 2,006,000 VND as capital for her business. Ms. Ngoc Lan Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy a sewing machine. Ms. Binh Thi N. is borrowing 2,006,000 VND to buy stock for her business. Ms. Hai Nam Thi N. is borrowing 1,534,000 VND to also buy stock goods for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), năm nay 35 tuổi. Chị làm thợ may, chồng chị làm chủ thầu xây dựng. Anh chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ. Trước kia anh chị đã tương vay vốn của ngân hàng nông nghiệp và phát triển nông thôn huyện và đã trả hết. Chị rất thích hình thức tiết kiêm của chương trình nên đã tham gia. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND để mua thêm máy khâu về làm may. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là lớn hơn 300.000 VND/tuần. Chị Dương Thị Nguyệt (MS:13010034), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngọc Lan (MS: 13010035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua máy khâu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bình (MS: 13010036), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ buôn bán . Chị Đinh Thị Hải Nam (MS: 13010037), vay 1.534.000 VND để đi chợ.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Originating from Notsé, a city situated 100 kilometers from Lomé, Mr. Kodjo D. was born on December 31, 1984 and is single. After having finished his studies, he began a business selling secondhand clothing in the Attikoumé district of Lomé. This business, which he began in 2006 with a small investment, has grown so much that he can not keep up with the customer demand. This first loan will allow him to buy four bundles of secondhand clothing in order to improve his sales.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Originaire de Notsè, ville située à 100 KM de Lomé, Monsieur D. Kodjo est né le 31 décembre 1984 et est célibataire. Après avoir cessé ses études, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de friperie dans le grand quartier d’Attikoumé à Lomé. Ce commerce qu’il a commencé depuis 2006 avec une petite somme grandit aujourd’hui de telle sorte qu’il n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter quatre ballots de friperie afin d’améliorer sa vente.

loans.use: Buy four bundles of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is a 53 year old woman who lives with her current partner and a 17 year old daughter.

She sells groceries in her small store that took a lot of work to open four years ago in her community. She likes her business because she can take care of it and her home at the same time. She has some problems with the purchase of products and merchandise which she accomplishes in the nearby cities, which are located an hour away from her community, this makes the transport of her products very costly. The reason for her work is her 17 year old daughter, to whom she wishes to provide a quality education.

The money that she is currently requesting is for the purchase of more merchandise which will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers and make her store the most popular in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Marcela es una mujer de 53 años que viven con su actual pareja y una hija de 17 años.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en su pequeña tienda que abrió con mucho esfuerzo para su comunidad, hace ya 4 años, negocio que le agrada realizar porque atiende su hogar y su negocio al mismo tiempo, durante todo el día.Sin embargo, tiene ciertas dificultades en la compra de productos y mercadería, porque lo realiza en las ciudades más cercanas, que está a una hora de su comunidad y trasladar sus productos le trae muchísimos gastos. El motivo de su trabajo es su hija de 17 años, a quien desea brindarle una educación de calidad.

El dinero que requiere y solicita hoy es para la compra de mayor mercadería, y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, para lograr ser la tienda más concurrida dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (groceries) for her store.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov L. I., 41, is a rice farmer and also raises ducks for eggs. 

She lives with three of her four children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband are working together to earn a living and are able to make around $2.50 of profit per day. All the children are employed in different jobs and always send their parents around $20 each month to support the family. 

Mrs. Nov would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $800 to purchase more mechanic tools for one of her sons who works as motorbike repairer.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for one of her sons who works as motorbike repairer.

loans.name: Villa Mayo Group

texts.en:
At approximately 3,600 meters in the Peruvian Andes you can find FINCA Perú's community bank, Villa Mayo, in Huancavelica. This area is known for its new types of potatoes and a chilly climate. The community bank is maD. up of 11 members.

Martha S. Q. lives in Huancavelica with her husband and two children, aged 10 & 5. She has a small grocery store with a phone service. The grocery store started small yet she is improving little by little. The area has its problems, she says, as her business is sometimes too small to cover her necessities. The loan will be invested immediately in the store by purchasing more goods that her clients are interested in.

After joining FINCA Perú she has been able to improve her business, and is very grateful that she has been able to save more and invest more in her business. Right now, Martha is saving the income she receives from her business to fulfill her dreams of making sure her children are educated to become professionals, and she would also like to move and start her business in another area, Huancayo. 

Ana Q. R., another member of the group, also lives in Huancavelica with her husband and 3 year old son. Her business, which she has had for two and a half years, includes the buying and selling of animals such as pigs and cows. Though her business is doing well now, she has had some trouble in the past, as do all start-up businesses. Since Ana joined FINCA Perú her business has improved and she can only hope it will continue to do so. The loan she has requested will be invested in her business for the purchase of more animals and to increase her capital. She is currently saving to buy a house in Huancayo and start her business there. In addition, she hopes that with the success of her business she will be able to put her son in a good school.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Aldi Forti Group

texts.en:
This is Majula S. and Abdul B.. They call their group Aldi Forti. They have received several loans through SMT. They repaid their loans on time and have requested a new one. Their previous loans were a great blessing to these entrepreneurs. The last loan they received was for Le 500,000.00 each. This enabled the group’s leader, Majula, to boost her business, which was on the verge of collapsing at the time of the loan.

Majula was born in Kabala thirty-two years ago. She is married to a Health Inspector and they are raising four children, two from their marriage and two from a previous marriage. (Her first husband passed away.) Two of the children are in secondary schools and the other two are in primary schools. Majula pays the fees for her two children in secondary schools. Majula sells soft drinks, bottled water, sardines, Vaseline, creams and a lot more in her shop at the centre of Kabala town. She has been in business for the past 10 years now.

With this loan, she would like to buy some items she currently lacks in her shop. She will invest in items like onions, rice, and provisions. She buys her goods in Freetown where the prices of goods are cheaper than in Kabala. The greatest challenge she faces as a businesswoman is that most of the items her customers are asking for are not available in her shop. This causes her to lose some of her customers to rivals. But with this loan, she will be able to buy most of the items her customers want.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Pueblo Nuevo, somos tres integrantes, tenemos muchos años de conocernos y somos muy unidas, decidimos obtener un credito ya que necesitamos salir adelante con nuestros negocios y mas en esta epoca de navidad que es muy buena y necesitamos inyectarle capital a nuestros negocios, asi podremos salir adelante con nuestras familias. ahora les voy a hacer una pequeña explicacion sobre lo que nosotras hacemos:
Mirian M.: soy la jefe del grupo, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva y esta ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, tengo muchos clientes ya que les gusta mi producto porque tiene un precio accesible y es de muy buena calidad la ropa que vendo, soy madre soltera tengo 2 hermosos hijos, los que estan cursando la educacion primaria, gracias a este negocio he podido sacar adelante a mis hijos.
Juana Lorena P.: ella se dedica a la confeccion de ropa para damas y niñas, ella es madre soltera, su hija esta en cuarto grado, ella necesita comprar telas y accesorios para poder hacer ropa y venderla a sus clientes, ella trabaja por pedidos.
Mirian M.: ella es comerciante, su actividad es la venta de pan casero, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio, ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, es importante decir que este negocio es el que le ayuda a cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
We are the three members of the group Pueblo Nuevo (New Village). We have known each other for a long time and are very united. We decided to obtain a loan since we need to grow our businesses especially during Christmas-time which is a period of high sales. We need to inject some capital into our businesses in order to move forward with our families. Allow me to explain what we do: Martha de Jesus: I am the leader of the group and I run a small business selling new clothing out of my home. I have many customers who like my products since they are well-priced and of very good quality. I am a single mother of two beautiful children who are both in elementary school. Thanks to this business, I have been able to support my children. Juana Lorena P.: She works producing clothing for women and children. She is a single mother whose daughter is in 4th grade. She needs to purchase fabric and accesories to make more clothing and sell it to her customers. She makes custom-made clothing for her customers. Mirian M.: She sells homemade bread. She has worked in this business for quite a while. She is a single mother of two children and this business helps to cover her family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 34 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de artesanías en la ciudad de Puno, hace bonitos bordados y tejidos, actividad que viene realizando desde hace un año. Noemí siempre ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante, quiere forjarse un futuro mejor, para tener estabilidad y conformar una familia. El negocio es muy rentable, ya que recibe pedidos de diferentes lugares, así como de la isla Los Uros, del lago Titicaca, donde hay una buena venta a los turistas. Lo más difícil de su trabajo son los acabados finales, que son el principal atractivo, pero con la experiencia que día a día gana Noemí, los resultados son cada vez mejores. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de material para elaborar muchos bordados más, y así, mejores los ingresos económicos en época navideña.
texts.en:
Noemí is 34 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells handicrafts in the city of Puno and has been making beautiful embroideries and weavings for around a year. Noemí has always been a hard worker trying to make ends meet. She struggles for a better future and to find stability and to have her own family. Her business is very successful, as she receives requests from different places, such as Los Uros Island or Titicaca Lake, where her work is very popular among the tourists. The hardest part of her work are the final touches, which are the main attraction of her products, but she’s becoming more experienced every day, so her results are improving very fast. This is her first loan request to Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she will purchase more material to make more pieces of embroidery and obtain a better profit during Christmas time.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make embroideries

loans.name: Assifuah

texts.en:
Assifuah M. is married and has three children. The highest level of schooling he has received is junior high school. His wife is a trader.
